BO4lZZlWv_t1Dbfj1lrfDw.text: This is what I called secondary buffet choice.  It's great value, decent selection and good food.  $7.99 (with a players card) for lunch can't be beat. I like their fish and chips.   Collar green used to be my go-to vegetable choice, but lately it's very salty so I just stick with salad.  Each salad bar has different selection, so check out both if you want to have salad.  I would skip the Chinese, not even up to Panda Express quality.  My favorite dessert is the walnuts tart.  Ice cream didn't taste like ice cream, more like yogurt or something very artificial.

sgX9CQWmAOb_rOk658lv1A.text: Just give me the beef ribs and prime rib from the carvers station and I'll be happy.  When a family of four can eat there for 20 bucks (with coupon), all you need is to impress me with about 10 dishes that I can rotate on all of my trips.  The Orleans is like the Costco of casinos: not much flash, but plenty of value.  Their buffet is the same to me.  Give me value: great food, low prices, and cleanliness and I'll stick around.  Alcohol prices are super cheap and the waiters are responsive and friendly.  The kiddies love the dessert bar, and I like the constant rotation of the food.  Chalk one up for the little guy.

e7_4hB4L5cbFB_87lFO4Mw.text: First meal of the day at Vegas and its breakfast.. I get tons of breakfast foods; eggs, bacon, waffles,donuts, ham, and hash browns. I decide to get a omelet with everything on it including the shrimp. The next few hours I get sick and my stomach is churning like threes no tomorrow. Everyone was fine besides me and I find out I am only the person that got an omelet with shrimp. So it has to be that that got me sick. All around the food was really bland or salty. I was stuffed at the end but who isn't at a buffet. You gotta get your moneys worth. Anyways I would've gave it a 3 star but since I got sick it looses both star and only is left with 1. Too bad.

moRZ0u6uhuswsxA4R_Gn9Q.text: Me and my boyfriend are planning to go somewhere else but he recommended to go to this buffet place where he said the food is delicious. It is but the problem was the service, no hospitality at all!! the person who bring us to our table didnt even bother to apologize when we asked for a booth and there was none, all she said was "nope, here's your table", our server took 15mins to refill our sodas twice! my boyfriend asked for water and we just left because it was ridicoulusly no proper way to take care of the customers, i mean for water?! i finished my ice cream and other desserts i have, still i never had to drink water! i am so pissed and never gonna come back here ever!

WWpM3B1UxJjN4Hm5wGWM_g.text: When the Orleans was still fairly new in the 90's I can remember my family and I mean my ENTIRE family would come to eat here because of our aunts who gambled received fairly good comps. However, those days are obviously in the past and I seedom see myself going into this Casino. Recently came here on a week day for lunch costing $8.99. This was a reception for event I attended prior, making it free for all of us! I was at the same buffet 2 years ago and remember it being not that good. Contrary to belief, this time around it was better. The Korean style ribs was decent, not the best, but definitely edible. The BBQ section also had pretty tasty selections. I tried the pasta with alfredo sauce, which had a nice texture and a flavorful garlic taste. I had tirimisu for dessert and I enjoyed that as well. Overrall, "good enough." I don't think I would pay money to eat at this buffet, but the food was good and didn't make me sick.

Ce1uCNDaiQ7zrFcjwu4iJA.text: I've eaten here twice.  Once for lunch 2 years ago, and once for dinner 2 weeks ago.  I have to say that I really like this buffet.  There's nothing fancy or gourmet about it, but maybe that's what keeps the "down-home" menu consistently good.  Small selection at the salad bar, but the romaine lettuce mix was fresh and they had beets.  My favorite section is the BBQ.  The pork spareribs were baked to a delicious tenderness.  Sauce is served on the side.  Mac n cheese was  bright orange, creamy, and cheesy.  LOVED IT!  Other sides were simple but good.  The sign at the register said $13.99 for dinner but they were charging $16.99 that night (because it was Christmas week?).  We used our $1 off Gold card, so it was a good meal deal.

rHtoIgiLdQofotZJADQpdQ.text: Much better than we thought! We came here after getting married in Vegas and to our surprise it was amazing! The day before we came by to check if they take reservations and were surprised to find out they did! It worked out perfectly. Another amazing thing, we came on Octoberfest day so the price was only $10 a head! Amazing! It is like the Rio World Buffet but for a third of the price! Now I will admit it does not have all the selections of Rio but it was just as good! I do highly recommend you coming here for cheap but good buffet with a good variety!

ijsTmcF8uPbIw5hyTW-eTg.text: Excellent food for a very good price. This was our first time here and we will be returning. $57 for a party of 5 on a monday is not bad at all!

pEC9btuK1Dy8yMmsK0TRdQ.text: Friday Night Seafood I'm just not that enthusiastic about this place as my 1st two visits. Tonight was the Seafood Buffet for $17.99 with $1 off with players card. The oysters were absolutely scary looking. I've never seen oysters look so dried and shriveled up before. And there was a large bowl loaded with them. But we were happy with the salmon, the king crab, snow crab, shrimp, craw fish, mussels and clams. But not so impressed with the $37 we paid for this. We could have gotten the same things at Asia Buffet for $28 and enjoyed the oysters and a larger sushi selection. The desserts here deserve 5 stars because they all are very delicious. I have no complaints.   I'll be back.... just not for Friday night seafood. Any other time I want to say will be my money's worth.

9V9RlgqqnPFQJfF_e9Lnmw.text: Go for lunch, if want crawfish and beef ribs you'll enjoy this buffet. Desserts were hit and miss, not worth the money for dinner.   Staff were very friendly but the food was a huge disappointment and this meal was my intro to the Orleans hotel dining...will stick with my old time fav the Spice Market in PH.

bpDO4M1jGtheptk47dltKg.text: I stayed at the Orleans for several days this past weekend and the French Market Buffet was a staple of my diet while here. Hey, I'm Chinese (or at least half)- you say "all you can eat" and I'm runnin'!  The breakfast is economical at about $7.50 (okay, I don't remember exactly, but it was more than $7 but less than $8). Compare that to a menu breakfast at Denny's or the like only you can come back for seconds!  Saturday night was my favorite night because they featured prime rib! They have two stations, one for medium rare and one for medium well. The rare is juicy and buttery! Mmmmm!! For seconds I went for assorted jumbalaya, seafood and crawfish which are regular dishes.  I was getting pretty full and felt it was time for dessert. I got up and came back with another helping of rare prime rib!  I think I'm going to be eating a bag of salad everyday for lunch for the next week or so....

jjn1QWHhfwPgj1MBg1snEQ.text: SO and i visited today - another freebie...overall, we liked it....even if we had to pay, i think it's worth the money...$15/ person  plus - free glass of wine...sure it's table wine...but it's drinkable            bbq foods - ribs, pork and beef, pork loin, sausage            variety - like most casino buffets - about 7 food stations -               bbq, seafood, mongolian ( yes...they say mongolian             but i did not try any of the foods at this station ) chinese,           mexican, italian, etc          decent variety of desserts  minus - steak ( it was steak night ) - allegedly ny steak...hmmm                it ain't high quality, but i don't expect high quality !!!  the drink server - very pleasant and attentive  i would call it a "2nd tier" buffet, but it's one of the better 2nd tier places ( it's comparable to the green valley and red rock station casino's )  Enjoy !

RHT9yQ-UW8y7hqMw_-K8kA.text: Definitely not worth it anymore. Thought the prime rib night would at least worth the trip but it was dry and all food for that matter was not that good. If you want to spend 35 I'd recommend going to south point.

IQX6X2gI-43OFWxxn5gxsA.text: It was edible. I came here with my mom and grand parents. they wanted to eat here. Think they had crab or something they wanted. It is not very memorable. I have eatin at several better buffets similarly priced. I have been to vegas too many times to like this place. But the food was average, service and atmosphere is the same. I rather eat at the orleans Coasta Cantina. Much better quality.

8gasZQVVpaRULxakEjFW2Q.text: We went to the French Market Buffet on Christmas day.  We were looking for a good buffet, off the strip, without the 2 hour wait in line.  We were in line before the 1100 opening.   At the carver's station the roast turkey was very good.  The ham was very watery, like it was boiled or steamed.  At the other ethnic stations, the food appeared to be from the day before.  The mexican refried beans were old-looking.  Mind you we we at the start of the lunch buffet.  You could get breakfast, and the scrambled eggs were freshly made, but room temperature.   The steam table temperatures were not hot.  End result two of us got sick  The waiter service was great.    Bad show for such a special occasion.

I3cU-f72dqylVQOVfGJb2A.text: Great deal and great food. Especially breakfast. Its not the fanciest place. But i come here everytime i'm in LV.

VUsp0We5dtEh6OozyeHysw.text: I ate here for breakfast on Saturday. It was only $8.99 including drinks. I expected the worst but suprisingly, I enjoyed the food here. The bacon was crisp, the mexican sausage was especially juicy and you can't go wrong with the biscuits and gravy. There was also an omellete bar. It's a steal at $8.99.

KaklqQqyXaZooqecNYu5Bw.text: Service there sucks and the food is mediocre at best I wasn't expecting greatness just decent food.  Save yo dollas and go to some place else.

Zid7xEngPJuMRsOyaEqt9A.text: Went with the family about an hour before they closed for dinner. I wasn't that impressed-it seemed like it was the place to eat your sorrows away with mediocre food after you lost a decent amount of money at the casino. Because of the odd time, we were placed at a small corner of the eating area, and rarely had anyone come and take away our plates. It was definitely A-Ok.

7aR0tjY2dOAI5w0pzOnUSg.text: First, let me say that I'm not one to eat at a buffet, sorely because i lose my appetite when I see piles of foods on trays lined up from one end of the wall to another.  I was forced (yes, forced!) to go here with my family - party of 8 with two toddlers. Usually, for big parties wiith messy toddlers, the host would normally sit you in the corner away from other gobbling patrons, but not our case. we were just a few feet away from the food, yet not too close from foot traffic. (that's 1 star)  The buffet, being in the Orleans casino, serves southren food (among other "international theme") - from crawfish to hush puppies. They also have cooked and raw oysters. Not bad for a $20. The only drawback is the desert section - they dont have much to offer tehre. But then again, I get stuffed easily and usually dont have much room for sweet shutffs. (that's 2 stars)  This is no Rio buffet, so there's really not much waiting. However, being that it was graduation week, there were a lot of locals with their graduating kids (still on their cap n gown). Stilll, we only waited for about 8 minutes. (that's 1 star)  I got a bad impression of our server at first because instead of neatly placing our silverwares on the table, she would just toss it from the other end of the table, so I had to catch my fork as bouncess across the table.  (that's -1 star)

GSy0whMalY7IvnolH4z3BQ.text: Arrived at 9.45am for the breakfast buffet only to be told by the hostess that the food would be pulled at 10.30am and everyone had to vacate the restaurant before 11am.  Turns out over 50% of the food was yanked by 10.10am and many containers of food were already empty.  The food is inline with Station casino food. Plenty to choose from but not many healthy options, lots of fake/toxic food additives/flavors and you won't remember eating it a couple of hours later.  Surprisingly, the coffee was exceptionally good.  Our Server Elsa was top knotch. We poached her as our original Server Peggy couldn't be bothered showing up for 15 minutes and the place was not busy.

hvPC3jiGFyYrU8rgR6Ho9A.text: Great new modern remodeling with expanded choices.   Great selections , always open omelet station and  a salad bar. Friendly service

photos.caption: Photo of Medley Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seating
Photo of Medley Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Front cashier

DKBP6Big0qI-Vi6zUNXd6w.text: I'm not a very picky eater because I don't enjoy cooking.  For me, the effort (grocery shopping, cleaning, prepping, chopping, stirring, frying, etc.) and time is not worth it - especially if it doesn't turn out well.  I'm so exhausted from my Graveyard Shift job, that sometimes I'll skip a meal because I'd rather sleep.  That's why I truly appreciate anything anyone cooks.  I understand the work that went into combining ingredients to create a meal.  With this in mind, I especially enjoy Senior Days at the Orleans Casino.  It used to be on Tuesdays, but now it is Wednesday.  After collecting 50 points on your B Connected Players Card, you earn a free breakfast or lunch buffet.  After 100 points, you get a free dinner buffet.  I believe I earned both a lunch and a dinner buffet!  I have been to pricier, higher quality buffets like the Wicked Spoon at the Cosmopolitan, but for the price (free), I can find good enough food at the French Market Buffet.   For example - the dessert section... the fluffy cheesecake; and the strawberry torte.  I wish the torte's crust was on the lemon meringue pie!  I try to eat things that I don't normally make, such as the bread pudding, chocolate cream pie, and the gelato.  Those are pretty good.  Remember to get a plastic spoon from the dispenser!  The Italian section was okay - there was pizza, pasta, garlic bread, and lasagna.  Nothing really outstanding.  The pizza crust was on the thicker, softer side.  The BBQ area was interesting with its collard greens, yams, black eyed peas, hush puppies, ribs, and fried okra.  I had a well-done rib and enjoyed the crispy edges!    The Asian foods were adequate: spring rolls, Hot & Sour Soup, Egg Drop Soup, crab sushi, and shrimp tempura sushi...  The noodles loooked spooky, so I just had one for good luck. Some dishes looked sad and overcooked, like they had been there a while...   The salad bar looked fresh.  The fruits (cantaloupe, honeydew, and watermelon) were relatively sweet.  The peel and eat cocktail shrimp moves here at dinnertime so the crawfish can take its place at the Seafood station.  Dinner buffet includes Prime Rib at the carving station.  Breakfast buffet includes an omelette station.    I skipped over the Mexican section because by that time, I was full.  I had a bite of macaroni and cheese for my niece, but it was bland.    The service is quick and efficient.  The atmospere is energetic with many people moving here & there.  It's like a variety show!  The coffee refills are often.  Raspberry iced tea is available.  The long line to get in moves well.  There are many, many chairs and tables for singles and large groups.  It's just a basic buffet for everyone of all age groups to fill up.  The variety and value are noteworthy!

photos.caption: Photo of Medley Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Many ice cream flavors!
Photo of Medley Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribs and other meats at the carving station!
Photo of Medley Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. If the desserts are not plated already,  they will serve a fresh one to you!

wb_JZ5aWZ5oPP9ROoJN5BA.text: We ended up at the Medley Buffet inside The Orleans because we were uninterested in the food court options they had. We had been here several years ago, and were not particularly amazed with the food-and even had a sushi food poisoning incident. However, with the recent remodel of the buffet, it seems they have really improved!The selection isn't huge, but is still pretty decent, so you are sure to find something you'll enjoy.   It was really refreshing to see that hey had completely renovated the buffet, from the decor, the flooring, the chandeliers, everything appeared clean and looked beautiful! When we were here a couple years ago, the decor was very dated but we were happy to see that the place had really opened up, was bright, and overall a major improvement from our last visit.   We had no problems with the service, all of the waiters were extremely friendly, and we were checked on numerous times. Our waiters were quick to bring us refills and clear plates off our table. She also made me custom iced coffee (not on the menu!) which was so nice of her.    The food quality-having been to numerous AYCE buffets in Vegas has really improved since our visit years back. On this particular visit this past weekend, there were two standout dishes for me: the pesto tortellini, and the al pastor tacos! Pesto tortellini is one of my all time favorite Italian dishes, so to see it as one of the dishes in the Italian section was a big surprise, and it did not disappoint! The pasta was creamy, the cheese-stuffed tortellini was sooo delicious, and the pesto was not overwhelming, and tasted fresh! The al pastor tacos were such a pleasant surprise!! We are Southern California natives so everyone in my party was super excited, and they were DELICIOUS. The quality of meat was fantastic, and the salsa gave an amazing kick. We also saw the al pastor being cooked traditionally on the stick, and carved fresh-so amazing! They also renovated their dessert bar, and I'm so happy that they added gelato- my AYCE Vegas buffet trips are not complete without it!   So happy with the remodel and improvements! I would recommend this buffet to anyone as they are really beginning to stack up to the higher end buffets located on the strip. Their selection is smaller but very unique. Very happy with the service and left very satisfied!

xSB6uqbcti2MbtXnmnplWA.text: Love, love, love this place. Great food, friendly staff and great prices. Perfect for that off the strip place. Italian food great, Mexican food (enchiladas) great and the sweets are "oh so wonderful." You might wait a hot minute at holidays but that's ok. Oh also parking is free.

vnMCIrZ78XpFo-zmOBOWZg.text: Our server was Chow.  l loved his service if I could give him 10 stars I would  I will be coming back.  His manager was Ana.  Thank you both wonderful job.

Zc_TqEZk9WEaP8KE12oR8A.text: Great service and delicious food!  In other countries, they charge a fee if you leave too much food  It wouldn't be a bad idea to start charging people because some of them waste to much food

3W7XYrVKXFSVsdd6VhgSLw.text: Best value for a quality buffet. Champagne is included at the Sunday Brunch. Renovated and reopened on Sept 13 2017 with its new name, Medley Buffet, and contemporary decor.

Photo of Medley Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sorbets are great, especially for the lactose intolerant. Many ice cream flavors as well.

ctisLoxuR4VPOlJ2pcQ1Sw.text: went today @ 2pm horrible Asian waitress only came by my table once, looked at me crazy when I asked for more napkins. Everything was absolutely cold not even luke-warm. what a shame @ $15.95 , on a Friday just cold fishsticks and hard fries, loads of pizza that no one was touching. the taco meat was hard very dark brown and congealed.     I want my damn money back...Now!

XZ0xoRepFPRJGg9MZmZb6g.text: Couldn't cut the bbq pork rib, both Mexican meats had no flavor, chicken wing ok, but fries were limp, 2 sushi barely ok, wife said "could not tell what flavor the red ice cream was.", the part of the oatmeal cookie I ate was wonderful, the reason for 2 stars.

PUxvB7dDzCieBRUksPLTww.text: I have been to most of the buffets in Las Vegas and this is just one of the absolute worst. We went for lunch with starts at 11. They had a line of probably three or four hundred people and only had three cashiers to take payment. A lot of the items are definitely frozen food which has been reheated such as the taquitos and burritos. There were three rice dishes all of them had extremely overcooked rice. The other dishes were extremely Bland. Honestly the best part of the meal was the cold glass of water.

I7M07k5Xo2GhEEjjByBatA.text: We go to a buffet at least once a week and our current favorite is the Suncoast. Today we were nearby the Orleans so we decided to eat here for lunch. There was no wait on a Saturday after 1:00 pm. We were pleasantly surprised to find both pork ribs and beef ribs. The beef ribs were great but the pork ribs had a strange aftertaste. I loved the Italian broccoli and the onion soup (minus the cheese and croutons). The Chinese section had well prepared baby bok choy that was not overcooked like at other buffets. What was especially nice was the chart defining the gluten free choices and the dessert section which included a selection of gluten free options. The only picky thing was that the hand cleaners were hard to find and one was broken. $12.99 with players card is a bargain slightly off strip. Btw, it was less smoky than usual.

GOihwiJoA83leChrnhdpHQ.text: 3.5 to 4+  Stars, maybe more.  Depending on if your Fav's here that buffet day.  Been here many times over the years. Lunch today awesome Beef Ribs, Brisket. Oxtail Stew. See my picture.  Ribs, yam, corn bread, blackeye peas, polish sausage.  I know. Its not a on strip buffet What would I know???  Been to Wicked Spoon Buffet twice at Aria or Comospolitin. Took hour to walk there in Casino. Waited 3 hours to be seated.  Been to Paris Casino Buffet, Old Aladdin Buf. Been to Wynn Buffet.  Been to Red Rock Casino Buffets three times.  Been to many other buffets.  So here We are. In Old Orleans Casino's Buffet. Orleans Casino is the Locals Favorite. Every night it seems the Casino's gambling is PACKED!!!!  Kids would love to ATE Here. Lol. Dessert Stations here mind blowing. A buffet in itself. Kids Delish Heaven. Yummiest. Me...I'll need about 5 dessert Trips   HAHA. It seems empty at the Rio Casino for gambling.  Read Yelp Elite's Rex M.'s review. For Foodie's Impression from the Heart.   Every, Every, Every Trip to Vegas we will MUST eat here at the Orleans French Mkt Buffet least once. If for Nothing Else than to satisfy my huge Dessert Craving here

qcoLlSlLyk3DjCLM_5kQGA.text: The new buffet at The Orleans Hotel and Casino was disappointing.  The food wasn't good at all.  The cornbread was dry and tasteless.  The prime rib was fatty and cold.  It is definitely not worth the price.  The service from Robert was excellent.  The poor quality of the food and drink was not his doing.  I remember when this buffet was one of the best around.  Admittedly it was a long time ago, but when you continue to raise the price of a buffet you should not lower the quality of the food.

m6Ld_6h_aNVhE15ZWqok6Q.text: This is my favourite buffet in town, it's reasonably priced and has a great selection.....doesn't matter what time of day you come, there's always a big selection with cooking stations cooking to order.  The staff are all good and very attentive

We went yesterday 1st time we been since they re-did it, and we WILL be back it was simply great!!! Love the selections of food and the taste was great!!!!!

UWKeI6zwKyq8FWbvBOk0UA.text: Worst buffet I have ever experienced in my life.   Nothing was edible.  Everything was old and dry.   Terrible location.   Prison food is an upgrade, I suggest you try that first.

KW3sPjrgYU6dkzLTg5xNGw.text: I was pleasantly surprised to eat at this buffet in the Orleans Hotel and casino. It was moderately priced not much of a long wait and really, really decent.  I went for breakfast, primarily. I enjoyed the really crispy bacon, the scrambled eggs we're perfectly scrambled and fluffy. I also enjoyed the buttermilk pancakes. I've been to buffets in Vegas such as Caesars Palace, the Bellagio, Winn, Harrah's, The Flamingo, Rio, pH, etc. This one was nearly half the cost and was about as good as most. Nothing fancy but good and satisfying.  The service, on the other hand, was very lacking and almost non-existent. I basically got up and got my own coffee and tipped accordingly.

gHO6XaL5OMXNoRwd8u132A.text: This is our go-to buffet for a seafood crab night where we don't end up paying an arm and a leg.  Its not a high end strip buffet but its decent for the price.  Every Fridays between 4pm-9pm you're looking at spending 28.99 per person.  Go early because the line can get really long.  We went at 8pm and still waited 30 minutes before we got seated.    If you're like us and you love crab, you have two options here, steam and frozen.  You can also ask them to stir fry the crab at the Mongolian station in a yummy asian blend sauce.  Also, the oysters are awesome.  Especially if you can get them right when they first bring out a new bucket.  Freshness!  The buffet is split up into sections, Mexican, Chinese, Italian, Salad Bar, Seafood, small Hawaiian/Japanese section, and of course dessert.  One thing I can not get over is their fondue station.  Ladies and gentlemen there is a chocolate fountain.  Yes, I just said it.  Running waterfall of chocolate with a spread of marshmallows, pineapple, bread, strawberries, and a few other items you can submerge into the brown gooeyness.  Awesome goodness.

WA7oxJkLqW6OOX7kR6uLxQ.text: We were in Vegas for Thanksgiving and looking for a reasonably priced buffet with good food.  We were close to the Orleans so we went to their French Market Buffet. After a 40 min wait (not bad for Thanksgiving at 1pm) we got a table and it was really, really good for the most part.    The traditional Thanksgiving fare was not that great.  I didn't like the way they did the yams at all.  My husband thought the dressing was ok but I didn't.  The turkey breast was delicious but the dark meat was pressed in a loaf and slice, my husband didn't like it much.    However the other food was awesome!  Seafood Newburg, Jambalaya, Crab Stuffed Salmon from the seafood section.  Hubby had a plate of Mongolian BBQ that he loved.  The Steak with Peppers from the Asian area was faboo, tender and delicious!  There was also some Veal Osso Bucco.  It was new to me but really good.    The dessert area was also wonderful with a LOT of variety.  Strawberry Shortcake and Cheesecake were our favs.

mLxwhm1wnOS_xWlg16IQUg.text: Great buffet especially for the price! We went to breakfast buffet for $7.99 with club card. OJ was good and great omelet bar. Several folks making omelets. We will be back! Short breakfast hours though M- Saturday (8-10am)

LBZh1nA2W-B90e1H38aYPA.text: The first thing to know is that this buffet is super cheap -- which is awesome. I've tried just about every hotel's buffet and sub-$15 blows my mind. Food is separated by types of cuisine and they actually have a seafood section with piles of shrimp. Quality is okay, you basically get what you pay for.  There's also endless gelato. Some foods I liked included the ribs, potatoes, roast chicken, shrimp, and pastas.   This is the kind of buffet you take someone who isn't a picky eater or someone who you don't like too much but eats a lot -- or both. Great place if you're forced to pick up the tab.

AA_WTmCPaDf_1aNQb0Rq4A.text: In town for the WCC basketball tournament and did not want to drive and hunt.  Decided to try the buffet and the price seemed okay.  $56 for two -- whoa!  Turns out I guess I missed the fact that it was Seafood Night.  Too bad because I am not that big a fan of oysters and Alaska King Crab legs which were flying off the serving trays.  The food was okay for buffet food.  I was served a thick slice of roast ham and there was a wide variety of food overall, but I never did find the fried chicken.

8yUufvnArXGSKrX60ha9Pg.text: I'm not a fan of buffets. Trays of food being 'tampered' with freaks me out! I haven't been to a buffet in ages -- at least not the last 3 times we've been to Vegas, but this time, I had a craving for peel and eat shrimp. I don't eat much else at a buffet, so I said let's go to the Orleans for their buffet since it's really cheap and I know they have peel and eat shrimp.  OK so the pricing was super cheap -- it's $7.49 for lunch -- and it includes non-alcoholic beverages. There were the usual bbq stuff, Mexican stuff, Chinese stuff, Italian stuff, and an attempt at Mongolian bbq, which was rather dismal.   I had about a pound and of a half of shrimp, a few slivers of bacon, 3 corn on the cob, a swirl of vanilla ice cream with crushed peanuts, 3 glasses of iced tea and I was done. I remembered last time they had these fantastic cookies, but there wasn't a cookie in sight. On top of that they have added a gelato station, but all the desserts were handed out, you couldn't help yourself to them.  For me, this buffet suffices because I don't really eat much at a buffet. Usually, I'll eat peel and eat shrimp, smoked salmon or trout, and lamb chops if they have them. What's the point of paying 20 bucks when that's all I eat?   The buffet at the Orleans is fine by me. It has the shrimp, and I'm happy to pay $7.50 for it! I must say I remember there to be more selections so I have to deduct a star for this visit. However, I didn't feel ripped off and I was content when I stood up to leave.  PS: If you are my kind of buffet eater -- check out my review of the buffet at Palace Station -- I thought it was better than this one and for almost the same price!

wUASrVCLCnJJBUMi-MSdNA.text: If your points are paying for the meal then it's worth it but i wouldn't pay out of pocket. Good place to bring kids to fill up on whatever they need. You won't find the best cut of meat here. They do have a good asian and seafood station. They have a good breakfast selection in the AM. The waiters were good at bringing the drinks and getting plates off the table.

9WoPWb2aXm7TmMGqj7La_g.text: Whoever says this place has good food has obviously had their taste buds surgically removed or ones that are accustomed to the creations Chef Boyardee and Hot Pockets.   Your options are:  *Pasta  *Mexican (The guacamole is made from a powdered mix) *USA (Proof that Americans don't eat anything original) *Chinese (Hello, MSG) *Salad Bar (Wilted lettuce leaves and sopping mayo bean/pasta salads) *Seafood (Cocktail shrimp, crawfish, and tuna doused in cream sauce) *Carcass (All the dried up meat carcass you desire) *Diabetes (All the "ice cream" you want, and grocery store cakes you can shove down) *Slops   Our server was incredibly sweet despite his sh*thole occupation of hauling away plates of half-eaten "food" and was prompt in delivering drinks.  But honestly, you're better off people-watching here than actually consuming anything.

jvs07sgR7W1WOtEliuEbaA.text: If i could give zero stars i would. Waited for an hour to even get to the pay line. Horrible wait for the not so great food.

c3syI3xnx5AdxT-qolxsjw.text: Disgusting food and LOUD!!! Went to this dump on a Saturday at Noon. The chicken was dry, the salad was crappy looking...cheap iceberg crap, The beef ribs had no meat on them, the roast beef was juicy but was like chewing leather... I could only eat 2 bites. Some of the trays containing meats were empty. Without a doubt the crappiest buffet experience I have ever endured. What a joke..... you mean to tell me that on a Saturday, you can't supply fresh food when there's literally 200 plus people eating? You can't afford to put some romaine lettuce into the salad choice? What's sad is this poop hole is owned by Boyd gaming and they run the Suncoast Casino buffet which is decent. I will NEVER be back to this crap joint again.......What a waste of $20 for 2. Should have gone to the Texas station for a buffet.

3KR4WQBCgaM_gPRM4fGY8A.text: Went for the breakfast buffet. We went with 3 people, clearly told the lady 3 people, apparently we got charged for 2 and the staff was getting angry at us for only having been charged for 2. Finally told the lady to charge us for the other person and gave her the money. Could have been handled better. Picked an eggs Benedict.... tasted like windex, made one of the ladies sick, not food poisoning but thinking about it. Sausage was overdone almost burnt. Cake tasted stale. Not good at all. Very dissappointed.

xHah5JnL_mIKhip8E-A0Mg.text: Great selection! Go for Sunday brunch and they will have one lox and bagels which is one of my favorite things to eat. They also have a great omlet station. I love that they have fruits and vegetables which are as fresh as it can be. I love there Asian section, they make great food there. They normally make lemon chicken, sesame chicken and a chicken dish. They have a great selection in the mexican food part as well as an italian part. If your at the hotel i'd recommend it. You cannot beat the food you will get at that price.   Go hungry because they do have a great amount of food that they serve. The meat is great whenever they have it out.   Dessert is awesome! They have everything there.

X6M10SUBkXWLibn5wMc2jQ.text: I used to go to this Buffet when I lived closer but haven't been here probably in 5-6 years at least. I usually figure a buffet is a buffet and know what to expect. Last night, this place was just a big MEH! Most of the food tasted exactly the same as other items and some of it was less than appealing in it's presentation. I'm also not a big Prime Rib fan but I do at least like it to not be smiling at me. It was clean inside and looked nice. The service was great and friendly, which is unusual for a buffet. I won't be back soon.

hVKfdfldrbWxji64-qePBA.text: Came to the Orleans Hotel with a roommate who scored free tickets to the Bill Maher show (He was hilarious)... decided on the buffet since the line wasn't long and none of the other restaurant options there seems interesting.  Being a native Las Vegan who was born here. I have not eaten at the Orleans Buffet since 1998 when I was 16.  That being said I was actually surprised by it.... the salad bar had nice crisp lettuce as well as all of the other options for your salad looking and tasting fresh and crisp as well. the salad plates were stone cold too which was a plus!  Of the options they had on the buffet line I didn't try any of the Mexican or Italian selections, I stuck mostly to the seafood area (They had a sign out that said due to unforeseen circumstances they would not have any craw fish, when I asked, the response was that they wouldn't have any for another week.) but the peel and eat shrimp were nice and plump and easy to get into and the Seafood Newburg and Cioppino were surprisingly good.   The beef ribs were disappointing however as was the cut of prime rib. I also didn't like the Salisbury style steak that they had with a mushroom gravy, I went in at it with a fork thinking it'd cut right through it however the fork bounced back and almost took my eye out.  not much for seafood selection and as I said before the Mexican/Italian section didn't have anything that looked appetizing, the Mongolian section had SUSHI though which is kinda strange however the rice was pretty good and the fillings were decent for basic buffet sushi.   TIP!: MAKE SURE YOU GET YOUR B-CONNECT CARD BEFORE PAYING!! (The regular price of the buffet is 14.95 without that card however it drops down to 9.99 after you get the card. 1 B-CONNECT card is good for two people to enter and the 5-10 minutes you'll use getting it is worth saving 5 bucks per person.  Overall it was not terribly bad however it wasn't amazingly good, but it'll make a turd.

ZJtRB298-slNDegvPKrKMA.text: I really liked this buffet inside the Orleans Casino. I like that they have a huge variety, large seating, good prices, and good schedule. Next time we're there I want to try their Sunday Brunch. So if you're staying at the Orleans, the Buffet is a MUST.

EzTFkTi1Dm9B7oXjiAoxxQ.text: Decent food for a Vegas buffet, only if you are staying here, don't go out of your way

xyInfFBTo5tGYNm4nkcFFg.text: Sat down with my parents and children for breakfast. Seemed like a nice place to eat. Kids ordered milk and as soon as they got it, the 3 and 4 year old started to spit it out saying it tasted funny. I took a swig and sure enough just about gagged. My father being as anal is as he is about serving bad food and causing mass illness in a public place, became concerned and notified the drink server and the waiter who didn't seem too concerned and told us they'd replace theirs with juice. Being the kids lost their appetite from the milk they didn't eat much. Again on the way out my father told the hostess that the milk could make people sick and they should have it replace. Her response in a sweet smiling way explained 'I'll be sure to let security know.' Seriously? How patronizing can you be to customers. Ridiculous!

FIQ0oPZ0538j7Czj8lIkQw.text: Great buffet with affordable pricing. It is the most expensive on Friday nights so a way to save money is do lunch or a late lunch before they switch to dinner pricing at 4 but stop letting people in for lunch at 3. They have a bbq, italian, mexican, american, chinese, seafood, and mongolian/Hawaiian station plus desert.  It's fresh and good quality.  Not as good as some of the more pricey buffets but for a $9.99 lunch it beats the $35 buffets anyday. Make sure to get a player card for a better price.

ru9Eg7i94AQyrEwKSMSYzA.text: For a southern style buffet, this place sucks...everything is flavorless unless it has sauce. What I did like about this place was that they had individual sections for each ethnic foods.  Still didn't do much for taste.  Even their freshly cut ribs were terrible (not to mention their dry roast beef)....$18 down the drain...had 2 plates and bailed cause I couldn't see stuffing myself with flavorless food.

wLsuZFW8TBSPG-oh3pRiXQ.text: This is what my mom and I like to call the budget buffet.  Cheap to chow...and the food is relatively tasty.    The food isn't of the same quality as let's say the buffet at the MGM, but the price is about half.  The food here isn't as bland and tasteless as many other buffets either.  I would eat here before eating at RIO again!  I am giving it 3 stars for the food and selection, plus a bonus star for the price.

photos.caption: Photo of Medley Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

k4-SklkBvnE1vWFyLsMzKQ.text: You have to know what to go for here. If you fill yourself up with their bland pseudo-Italian/Mexican/Asian offerings you will be disappointed.  On the other hand, endless crayfish and beef ribs? Yes please.  There is also a wide selection of desserts.

Gj69tVzjd57c14SXowux4g.text: Instead of charging you based upon a child's age, they charge you based upon a child's height (42 inches and under are free).  Join the "B Connected" club and save $2.00 on your meal.  Ok, on to the review:  This place is great!  I dined with my wife and two children here for breakfast.  They have all the standard stuff: eggs, bacon, hash browns, pancakes, waffles, etc.  The cool thing is they have two omelette bars, which really helps the lines move, and ensures you get one, if you really want one.   The Mexican breakfast section was REALLY good.  I could eat the Chile Verde all day (which is probably why they put a two hour time limit on buffet purchases).  The wait staff was very courteous.  You don't get drinks at a drink station or anything, they bring you all the drinks you want/need.  By booking a room at the Orleans, I got a $20 dining credit, which I used to pay for our group's breakfast.  Since one of my children was under 42 inches, and by joining the "B Connected" club, I only paid a few bucks for our breakfast!!!!!  This brought back memories of the "old days", when buffets were SUPER cheap in this town.

IdyP-Hr5CxxgMvQnbc-5rQ.text: HELL YEAH I know I came out weighing more but who cares, the food was lick my plate good ... I was playing with my B connected players card and thus it made this awesome meal for fahhhhhfreeeeee.. Now good food that is also free is a winner any day in my book!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Medley Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Medley Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Medley Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ISETeRjQhc01xXbnO1y3gA.text: Be wearing eat at your own risk this place terrible for leaving her with Schwab intended for the masses. The desserts are equally as bad. My lemon meringue felt like I was eating a piece of trucks rubber discarded on the 15 freeway.  GROSS!

XdM4ONMAixllLCFY2wSA1w.text: Was a regular before this up grade?  Now they have it looking more upscale but very limited for handicap access. Most accessible tables are to the far end from the food.  Getting around the tables in wheelchairs is difficult.  The lack of signage means diners wandering around to see what is where.  This must increase the dining time per patron considerably.  The food on my two visits was fair at best. Many items over cooked, dry and hard. A definite step down from the old buffet in all regards. Management was seen to be non receptive to a patrons complaint I observed and was borderline rude to her.  The upside is the table servers who really have to hustle.  Now ten months later decided to try again. As a wheelchair user, I was forced to a seat in the middle using the end of the table. Each trip for food required others to move their chairs as they do not comply with laws on accessibility. This also creates a safety hazard and no fire escape route. Discussions with managers were futile. They totally ignore the safety/fire laws in order to add tables to compensate for those they lost in the remodel. Handicapped, their families and friends should avoid it unless changes are made.

tCoLpWBTE9aY1F193rNbmg.text: A solid 3+.  We came on a seafood night (Friday) and it was packed.  The hostess/waitress was very helpful.  Plenty of shrimp, crab, and crawfish.  Liked their dessert; plenty dishes to choose from.  Price was reasonable.  $32 for dinner and on a holiday weekend.

ZJwmfrOLQoL9uMz82Diz-g.text: Always a great buffet. Lots of selection and flavors. Meats, fish, pastas, sugar free chocolate. Great price and very yummy.

34P0i9q_-xr3jAlc8oNdBw.text: Food: 2/5       Price: 4/5        Service: 3/5     Ambience: 3/5  This buffet is a little far from the Strip, but they offer cheap meals with pretty great taste! We came for the breakfast, and there was a wide selection including Italian(pizza, lasagna ), Mexican(tacos, enchiladas, beans), Chinese(fried rice, pot stickers, sweat and sour chicken), omelette station, American (biscuits and gravy, french toast, waffles, bacon, egg, fish and chips, potatoes), Carving (ham, brisket, ribs), salad bar, and dessert(pies, cakes, bread pudding, ice cream, cookies). Overall very worth the price and I enjoyed the meal.  Pricing  Breakfast : $9.99 Lunch: $11.99 Dinner : $ 18.99

Photo of Medley Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert bar

1sgzUhmrVQTx87KJKKKklQ.text: Husband and I went to dinner here it was not worth the $45 dollars spent and 20 minute drive out there. The meat was super dry and sides lacked flavor. Dont listen to the 4.1 review it's not worth it.

2inU3AANV15M-3Le12h5TA.text: They changed alot, it is no longer the French Quarter Buffet but the medley Buffet. Seems like they got rid of all the expensive food for cheap stuff it is now just like every typical buffet in Vegas nothing sets them apart and they rasied the prices at that. Used to come here every friday and bring all kinds of buisiness but now i have since found a new place.

BVjSs_I3v-qhsOuKEJsEFg.text: A great value at just over $20 for a dinner buffet. Fresh prime rib, Chinese selections, sirloin steak, Mexican treats, and sweet sweet desserts. It was newly renovated last year. This is my latest go-to reasonable Vegas buffet.

Kf-cab7isEcz_eYwcLXjAg.text: We'll I was expecting a way better buffet than before with the remodel. A bit disappointed with the food. The buffet looks more modern and better lighting. Only huge change was the look and the price. As expected to pay for the remodel the price has gone up a bit. Used to love buffets proceed under $20 for dinner. I think the new leader in town is the new Palms AYCE buffet.   The quality of food hasn't changed much compared to before. Ya it's expanded a bit but the only huge change I saw was a crepe station and a pho station which I didn't care for. The only big change I saw was the dessert station which improved a lot with higher end desserts like creme brule. They always had a gelato station.   My always favorite thing was to go there to eat the BBQ beef ribs which they still serve for dinner only. They also had prime rib but was very low quality of meat and tough. Who would've thought prime rib would be tough.   The Chinese section was decent the lo mein was good. Now sushi no matter what buffet you go to in Vegas is a must void food. They make it ahead of time and refrigerate it and you can tell the rice isn't made right. Anyways any buffet you go to sushi and pizza are a must avoid period unless you like crap food.  I honestly would only go here if I wanted all you eat beef ribs and gelato. For cheaper price I'd rather go to palms buffet way better quality. Even tho less quantity.  They also has a Al pastor station that looked decent.  The dinner price with players card was $20.57 you saved $2 with card. This is during week day.

photos.caption: Photo of Medley Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pizza oven
Photo of Medley Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Creme brulee a nice touch to the buffet
Photo of Medley Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

G60YSn-XpDFds8poKN1Y5A.text: Moody Rude servers, a manager who clearly does not give a shit about food quality or Temps and subpar food get this buffet less than a star.   Save your money and eat at McDo

XMnSfMjUEFTdEaRFcuWnDw.text: Pros: good price for a buffet (even better if you have a rewards card), nice selection of foods, delicious desserts   Cons: most of the food was subpar due possibly to being reused too many times and/or over cooked, sushi was horrible (cold hard rice)  We were a bit disappointed with our visit. We had heard that Medley was better than the old buffet and we finally had the chance to try it. Honestly if you're not absolutely starving then go somewhere else. We've decided that unless someone is willing to pay for us then we most likely won't be coming back.

Jga7crLFiSFPzbVmTZDCvw.text: If you're fortunate they serve their dinner steaks not well-over done and ox tail stew. Lolita is my favorite server since she's always cheerful and friendly.  I often go for late dinner.  Something this buffet need to work on is explicitly informing every diner in person or via speaker announcement when the food and desserts will be no longer be available and give a 5-minute heads-up when you're to leave.  We are your dining guests and it shouldn't be our responsibility to look at the time unlike the staff on the clock.  Correction: Alexandria is Hispanic not Asian/ Filipino as I originally mistook.

ErTg7rXqv5YUJKqRpAqEIg.text: The medley buffet closes way to early 8pm other similar places open until 9pm thats bad business they should stay open until at least 10pm.please stay open longer and make more money. At least stay oprn until 9pm like the ayce st the palms

BCB_jEkn01lbYWRQ67N7mQ.text: The food was good , but not much selections for dessert that may be pleasurable for others ..but the food was good . But it was not worth the wait we made in line .. we waited a good while in line , to be in the buffet to only be in there 40 mins in , not even finished with our food to be told they are closing .. because they were going to start serving dinner , in alarm my whole family got upset because we all hadn't even had a chance to get dessert , and we were NEVER told that we had to leave before they started serving dinner , the receipt clearly says you have a TWO HOUR LIMIT from the time you go in , and one of the waiters had to speak to the manager and apologized because we weren't the only table that wasn't told anything.. so they failed to tell many people and we felt rushed, until one of the waiters informed us they'd give us 20 more minutes to eat , which me and my family weren't happy about ... I think it was a horrible experience .. I think they should let you know before you pay that if you pay now you'll be asked to leave in a little while .. it was just not worth it for us , we left unhappy . And will not be returning .

ufxmtKfg6PY_XRpCUjW1_Q.text: Yikes! The Orleans Casino and Boyd spent 4.5 million dollars completely renovating the buffet, changing the name, layout and everything. I was super excited when I got a coupon for 2 free buffets and couldn't wait to give their new buffet a try.  Lets just say I'm glad I didn't pay for this.   On my first plate I tried their cheese enchilada (because how in the heck can you mess that up), rice and a few pieces of sushi. The sushi was inedible, falling apart, dry and fishy. The enchilada was over-cooked, falling apart and to say it was salty would be understating the salinity of this abomination. The rice, surprisingly crunchy.  I had literally one bite of everything and ditched the plate. I thought for sure our server was going to kick me out or something for throwing out an entire plate of food, but thankfully he didn't say anything.  Round 2: I tried the steak, a salad, some chow mein, and cheese ravioli with marinara.   So I ended up eating the salad for dinner (the rest was inedible).   Dessert was bland. Also, like every other casino in Vegas, they have those cute little desserts in the clear cups, and small tarts.... unlike other casinos, they put these tarts behind glass and you have to ask for the ones you want. So weird... you just know they're going to shame you if you ask to try 3 or 4 different tarts.  One guy reviewed the Aliante's buffet and said that if you wanted to know what the color beige tastes like you should eat there. EXACTLY! If you want to know what the color beige tastes like-- this is your jam. I would have been really upset had I actually paid the $43 for 2 buffets.   Pros: The place is gorgeous, new, and modern. Cons: The food is terrible.
