93pdYBE2q55D0OEL-uTaAw.text: Garbage.   This place used to be awesome before it became Medley buffet. Now the food sucks.   They used to have seafood on the weekend (Fri and Sat). Then they changed it to just seafood on Fri. Now they have completely got rid of seafood night. WTF?!   By the way, they also raised the price. For whaaaaat???? Luckily we get comped dinners here. There is no way in hell I would pay for this food.  For anyone thinking of coming here without a comp, please don't waste your hard earned money and go somewhere else.

xJzHTQtYu17u2oko4FBJbw.text: So I admit I'm not a regular to come to Vegas but for the past 4 years I've done my best to come to a hotrod car show hosted by "Viva Las Vegas Rockabilly Weekend" and luckily this year was one of them. Medley Buffet is located in The Orleans Hotel and Casino, which by far is my favorite. I love the Southern feel it has and the buffet hours are from 8 to 8. We went on a Saturday so the price was 20 in change, we were a group of 8 and they got us a table quick and our waitress was friendly which is always a plus considering the amount of people there. Well, considering i was wearing a tight 50's dress i admit i did not eat as much as i normally would but I attacked the egg flower soup, roast beef, salads and shrimp for sure!! In fact, I enjoyed the food so much i didn't take pictures of it. ( except for a video i saved in snapchat lol )

photos.caption: Photo of Medley Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0lE4q0FnBLIz3jHHG4XcZw.text: A few of their servers were rude after we were seated. When we got our server, she was awesome.... food wise, i totally missed a whole section, the bacon and potatoes on the breakfast side of the buffet was sooooo good. The chicken was dry, pasta was delicious,  didn't eat dessert. I would try it again the next time we go....

kAb1X09PO8bO198UEg7mJQ.text: I give 3 stars cause the service is excellent all the servers are wonderful and courteous, the food on the other hand is blah don't get me wrong there's tons to choose from but the food is not good, has no flavor I got the brisket was inedible tasted really weird like plastic, maybe to much liquid smoke, and the beef ribs tasted the Same just weird tasting, and the dirty rice was that yucky,, I then tried the breakfast u cAnt go wrong with that, but the sausage had a distasteful  flavor also and kind of soggy in the middle, the Asian food was ok the egg rolls were actually really good... I'm at hmmm with this place I want to really like it but to me the food just tasted weird and lacking flavor big time,,,

_XCeCkFwutLSRFk09CO96g.text: Just because you are staying at this hotel, it doesn't mean you should eat here. We were tired from traveling and wanted somewhere to eat that was close and convenient. Food is bland and nothing out of the ordinary as far as your common buffet. Not worth $18.

nVr1bQofCl6Ub7bNPrUD4g.text: I couldn't pass up this $7.77 buffet special for locals inside the Orleans Casino.  It is 1/2 of the regular price of their evening buffet and they had prime rib too.  I haven't been to this buffet for a long long time, so this was the perfect opportunity to rediscover this buffet.  I was impressed by the selection of hot food items.  The prime rib, though, was on the dry side (overcooked).  My wife really enjoyed the jambalaya and pulled bbq pork with fried onions pizza.  I know it sounds pretty weird to me but she said it tasted pretty good.  I, on the other hand enjoyed the crayfish,  Their sushi was freshly made which was nice, compared to other local buffets around town which served day old and dried out sushi.  I would definitely go back for this price.  Okay, maybe not for a couple of week, since I ate way too much in one sitting.

3Nc3vQUh5F41Nc_6q1QJLQ.text: Best buffet for all you can eat crab legs on Friday nights. The selection of other foods is also pretty good.  Will come back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Medley Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. All you can eat crab legs was excellent.
Photo of Medley Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Og9kPuvbmcNvw1cjwskJ_g.text: As some others have been saying, the terrible quality of this place may be due to it being under construction. But it is, as it stands now, terrible. Food is close to cafeteria quality. We went for brunch, and upon trying the eggs and sausage, I found both to be undercooked. The eggs were so runny it was unbelievable. One of the two gave me food poisoning, so here I am 24 hours later, missing out on my vacation because I'm now confined to my hotel room. I rarely use Yelp for anything other than checking reviews people have already left, but I was angry enough to make an account and write this one up myself!

FwGguLZ1eKJcIipISAlOCg.text: Great food diversity. Delicious and a lot of choices. I just would like to know why it takes so long if there is more than 50 tables available and the line still growing? Also a child under 12 shouldn't pay full price for Sunday brunch.

G3L-dBNyBAPgaRzucKhjPQ.text: I have been going to the Orleans and this buffet for many years. It has always been my favorite buffet and game me an excuse to spend the day in the casino, aside of the many times that I have stayed at the Orleans. However, I went to the Orleans on 7/4/17 to go to the buffet followed by the casino visit. The regular buffet area was closed and they had a mock buffet on the other side of that part of the casino. The line wasn't long, but we had to wait for 45 minutes to be seated. The food was about 1/4 of the amount of choices that the other buffet had, and it was of poor quality. The employees were commenting on how bad this was. We got it over with and I lost interest in the casino. I emailed the Orleans and received a response from Rhonda, the buffet manager. Basically I was told that that's just the way it is. They charged the regular price and did not notify their gambling customers that there was a change. Rhonda said that she hopes that I will come back to that buffet sometime, though wasn't acknowledging that there was a problem with their setup. I'm done there and maybe someone else will avoid wasting their money sometime.

M2gGFCfBwRDLcSWLWyPkBQ.text: This may be one of the better Vegas buffets off the strip. A variety of foods such as seafood, Mexican, Chinese, Italian, and Mongolian.   I had a little bit of everything but my favorite was they're carne asada and seafood enchiladas. Mixed with some salsa, guacamole and sour cream. Oh boy!   Two salad bars, but who eats salad in Vegas?   Very big selection of desserts! Not only ice cream and pies, but gelato! That really surprised me.   Awesome place to eat if you're at The Orleans.

photos.caption: Photo of Medley Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 3 liters of greatness.

w7sMk2_fIDOSJ2KICSOe7A.text: Yep, things have changed!  The new design in the buffet area is really hard to understand.  There is a massive hallway in the middle of the dining area that is not used, from what we could see.  The food is now distributed all along the back rather than utilizing cold tables just to the fore of hot service.  It was so convenient.  We both picked two different eggs Benedict for breakfast that were supposedly on steam tables in terrines, which looked warm and savory.  They were both cold and awful.  Neither one of us could eat them.  So wasteful.  Waiting for a table was also long and weary, even though the number of people was about 20.  I wish I could give our once-favorite buffet a good rating.  We've gone to the Orleans for years!

4C6vOsNpEeEWoAsdnRDb3g.text: Decided to go to this buffet after many years. When I was a kid, this buffet was the best, but it has gone downhill. When I came for Seafood Night on Saturday, there wasn't lots of people in the buffet. The food quality didn't look so good and the taste of the food was horrible. Not recommended.

RCMRkd3Ir5T3uLHQggAqdw.text: Lunch was $10.99 and includes a beverage. After 3:00 they start packing up the food and my waitress was busy cleaning and stopped bringing drinks, so it's best to get there before 2:00. The food was great, the price was alright.

RNdIEI0TFrI4lKc_SvqOyw.text: I love the renovation!! It looks very modern and cute. $20 for the dinner on a Sunday is a great deal! The steak was the best buffet steak I've had in a while. They definitely expanded for the better, and their staff is very friendly. I had Kathy our server and she was so nice. She made sure our glasses were full and she always cleared our plates as soon as we were done. She really made the experience a lot better. I would recommend the dinner, the food was hot and fresh. Definitely my new favorite buffet in Las Vegas!

bHVOIHm2rTSIcxoNMIia9A.text: Tried the lunch buffet here this past Saturday around 2pm-ish  - pretty decent for the price of $10 per person and they weren't super busy at that time.  Service:   The service was okay - our waiter was a bit slow and they didn't really clear out our plates as quickly as we ate...actually it would stack up quite a bit before he or anyone came to clear it. He was also hard to wave down to get refill on drinks. It did get a little busier with big parties of people coming in - looked like there was a graduation somewhere cause a lot of graduates came in to eat with their families.   Food:  They have pretty good selection of cuisines and not to mention an unbelievable amount of choices at the dessert section. They had a lot of comfort food for sure - fried chicken, mac n cheese, jambalaya, etc. What's interesting was that they had really good pizza - usually buffet pizzas are okay - but the pizza here was really cheesy and the crust was really perfect - not super thick and not too thin - so to my surprise I think their pizza was pretty awesome.   They had a lot of good choices for desserts too - 7 different flavors of Gelato - the peach ice cream was the best and the Watermelon Sorbet was very refreshing. In addition, they also had Tiramisu, red velvet cake, cookies and just too many to name - However I did like their Chocolate Cream Pie the most - it was pretty heavenly.   Overall this was a pretty decent buffet for a pretty fair price - at least for lunch. I would come back here again.

ycd3dzm3DJw4S-G3Fb-NJw.text: It's a remodeled French Market Buffet. The decode is modern with open theme, but I think it lack personality. I guess everyone uses the same designer. Palm's new 24 Cafe has similar decor. I have the seafood buffet. They raised the price by about $3/person without raising the food quality. The food selection is the same, but the quality becomes a little worse. For example, the crab legs are much smaller than before.  The worse part is the service. Our server is Loiter.  She never refilled our drinks. She just cleaned out the dishes. She can walked up to me and asked was everything ok when my glass in front of me was empty. Could you just open your eyes and see we need refills? My friend and I stayed to have some girly talks. Our server just walked past at least 5 times without making eye contact or refilling our drinks. She probably trying to chase us away, so she can rest.  Anyway, I won't recommend this place. It's over price with so so food and bad services.

_PTS_NVVUAINhwLgsS3skg.text: We had 3 ruby players cards for our family of 5 adults and my son and for my son they wouldn't do the discount of $5. We told the cashier and she wouldn't do it. The service was average.   The food was good but not excellent. I liked the shrimp, crab, and other foods but their fruit was unripe.  The price was reasonable for its food which I liked. Each adult is $21.99.(kids older than 8 are full price)

hGVtdZONU_KqoNBXJRF8zQ.text: This is hard, for value I'd easily give this 4 stars plus (at 17.99 the food is excellent), great variety, and it's really really good.   But, it's not Caesar's, but hey it's less than half the price. I think Caesar's and Orleans would be my 1/2 go tos in that order. You should try both.   I'd rate it at 3 1/2 stars.

g_bNtFI2wXDohDe_34guyw.text: I actually didn't finish anything that I attempted to eat. This Buffett had a little of everything which in the beginning was promising. I tried the enchiladas, bad choice bland and cold. Tried the egg rolls, took one bite and was done yuck. Tried the fried okra one of my favs. Tasted like it had been in the freezer along time before it was cooked. Tried the roast chicken and one bite was enough. Then I thought let's try desert, that can be bad. Have you ever had warm coconut cream pie? I have now.

7_k_wq0m29hyP7TMQEJ_4Q.text: Voted Best Buffet in Las Vegas... I see that advertising for everywhere in Vegas... Who decides what is the Best of Anything???  In this case, regardless of the billboards, I do. I believe this to be the Best Buffet in Vegas. I have eaten at several including the Rio and Bellagio.   The French Market Buffet at the Orleans is a much better value than the others. On Friday's it is higher than other days, but being Catholic I appreciate that almost everything they serve at all the stations is seafood.   For under $20 on Friday, I piled high plates with crab and shrimp. Had civeche, shrimp fajitas, fish, sushi, clam strips, oysters, a smorgasbord of seafood. Everything was delicious.   There are also a ton of desserts to choose from.

-SfsESikp_8niYOX-LNOsQ.text: Basic Vegas buffet that's Popular with some locals I'm guessing mostly because the prices are some of the lowest in town.  They also offer good discount deals for their player's club members. The lines can get long if you come right at the peak of service (like 9am for breakfast; noon for lunch; or 6pm for diner).  They've got the various food stations based on either type of food or region.  BBQ, seafood, Asian, Mexican, Italian, etc. Two salad bar stations and a center desert island with cakes, pastries and ice cream round out the mix.   The servers are all busy, efficient and make multiple stops by your table to fill drinks and take away plates as you grub your way through your meal session.   Some of the food is decent, some you'll pass on depending on freshness and others you won't even touch.  That's what keeps a buffet fun and you on your toes.

oqWchpc-SaxUU7Lu5vNH1g.text: This will be a shorter review than what I usually write. This buffet sucks. Truly. The BBQ station serves sour cream, horseradish & another sour cream that's lumpy. Instead of labeling it sour cream/horseradish mix they call it sour cream. Desserts are dry. The carrot cake especially.  There's a breakfast station too, although I couldn't find it. Everything I had was bland, dry or had a funky taste to it: chili tasted like corn, dumplings bland & dry, same with fried rice. Someone in my group found it & he took one bite of scrambled eggs & pushed his plate away. I'm not a buffet person but have been to a few that are actually good. This isn't one of them. It's easily the worst in town. I stopped for lunch elsewhere after "lunch" here. Servers were nice & attentive.

Zst7P80cHcPDjOv7TT3dhg.text: Not as good of some of the high end buffets in Vegas, but the price and food are decent. You get to sample various different types of cuisine (American, Chinese, Italian, Japanese, Creole/Soul, etc.), and although it's not the best, you will eat well. My favorite was the desert bar which had so many options, it was hard to make a decision. The desert bar even serves Gelato hand scooped by a server : )    One thing that turned me off was seeing children put their fingers in the chocolate fountain, while their parents were standing right there!   If you are in search of an off "The Strip" buffet on a budget, this is your answer. Just don't eat from the chocolate fountain ; )

LUskyp3OjGnC_Ga5Scgt5Q.text: When I first arrived I was excited to see a long line to get in for breakfast. I  came here with a Meet up Group  of around nine of us for Thursday morning breakfast. It was my first time here. My friends had been last week and stated they had some issues but were going to give it another try. When I sat down The staff was terrible about getting our drink orders . They weren't friendly at all about Refills. I was really surprised because my experience since being in Vegas has been pretty friendly service.  The food was not cooked well at all. The Scrambled eggs looked RAW and the Sausage was burnt. The eggs benedict wasn't appealing at all.  Overall they had decent variety but bad quality service and very poor quality food. For the money its not a BAD breakfast if you're staying at the hotel but I wouldn't go out of my way to come here for food otherwise.

Y7vq46bE9pwbsXR9-vMf_w.text: Cheap!   Would not pay a dime more on this food. It's your run of the mill buffet food with poor cuts of meat.

BeRZFKoMn-GE8b7ADbddcw.text: First things yes its good for kids... there is a play area for school age and an arcade room for teens, a movie theater also!! So that there since i havebmy 14 year old was a big plus. I dont play much so it was a good find. Now the buffet breakfast! Was bomb!! Loved the Mexican food section they need to add pozole for the hang over. The spice in the food was perfect.

photos.caption: Photo of Medley Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Medley Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. &#34;I found hawaiian food!&#39;
Photo of Medley Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. &#34;I found a chocolate fountain!&#34;

5StQVVfbrru21iyNqQ_mBA.text: Food here is average. Ate here many times. This review is a classic "I was mistreated" type of review.   I showed up 3 min late. My fault no doubt. Along with about 10 others who were turned away. Considering just two days ago I got in line 10 min late I was surprised that they were enforcing the clock so strictly. But "rules are rules."  What I can't handle, though, is being lied to. I was watching hundreds of people in line for a buffet, and they told me that they "didn't have someone who can take my money." (lie) Then I'm told there are "no open tables," when I could see many open tables. (lie #2) Our group is then told that there is a "power issue" (possible lie). I asked, "so what about all those people in line to eat, are you going to make them all leave?" She says "yes." I was floored and said I would like to see that... So she then starts going table to table, but nobody actually leaves.  I know this because at this point I was standing away from the front door looking at my phone deciding where to go for food when hotel security surrounds me ...  Now ... I know that I was late and I know that they weren't going to let me in. I lost, I moved on. I never yelled, I never made threats or swore. I had what I thought was nothing more than a conversation with a restaurant manager. The fact that she resorted to calling security shows that she is out of her depths in a position of leadership. I cannot imagine what she would have done if I truly was a risk.   I can handle being rejected. But if you are going to obviously lie to me then I have a problem with you insulting my intelligence. Just say, "sir, we don't want to let you in " and be done with it. Telling me you "can't" and then making up of a bunch of made up nonsense is really insulting.  And a manager should learn how to be firm without having to call security. That was downright offensive and embarrassing.

H8oghhE9DoVP55U4LkKb5A.text: I've eaten here a ton of times. It's ok. You get everything you want. There's American, Asian, Italian, Mexican, and an extensive salad bar. Pretty much your typical local casino buffet. Nothing will stole you as awesome, but it's all edible. Salad bar is loaded. I do like the Mongolian grill. Lots of dessert options including a chocolate fountain.

rBk5BA9WX-hzEeXLKuEccA.text: Food is ok . I really just ate desserts . Desserts ok . Overall customer service sucks . Cashier very dull. No customer service what so ever . When seated asked to sit near another family but we had to pay 1 dollar more to get seated near each other that's not the problem  at all what's the problem when I asked they brought that up but in a rude way... it's like paying for extra guacamole we charge more! . They sat us like maybe near each other but still refuse to put us next to each other knowing theirs an empty table there.  Jesshhh ok well first time here u could of said something  First and probably last. Customer service f-  had to call someone for refills when asked she asked what I needed in a very rude and like I just shouldn't of asked her anything . Stupid lady ur help obviously refill .. 0 stars

OndtTsWFUIfAx1IdxIMsFw.text: This was our plan B when plan A was a bust (we checked out the menu at the oyster bar and the cafe, but majority ruled)- the McMullen's irish bar across the street was jam-packed, and there was a radio station there too (should've known it would be a hot spot since St. Paddy's fell on a weekend this year). (We'd been here years ago, but I think that it was seafood night.)  Since I had the baby, my system has gotten a little sensitive to certain dishes so I went the safe route and stuck to a few choice items: shrimp scampi- didn't really taste like it was supposed to but eatable (didn't get seconds), chicken gumbo (good considering the averageness of the buffet as a whole), peel 'n eat shrimp- who can mess this up, right?, mussels- a tad overdone but eatable, green beans- surpsingly a crispness to it, and not soggy, prime rib- good, once you cut out all the fatty parts (and there was a lot of it). There were salads, mexican, seafood, carving stations, asian including a mongolian feature, and pasta.   I still find that some people get a little crazy when it comes to food, and that there will always be an impatient person right next to you or someone who wants to create their own line when there is already a clearly defined line started. The majority of the diners were good, except there were a couple kids playing and when there is a big crowd, that type of horseplay is not appropriate period.  An average Las Vegas casino buffet is the best way I can put this place, not the worst, not the best, just right smack-dab in the middle. To tell you the truth, the desserts ARE better than the food selections- there were No-Sugar selections as well, in addition to the pies- pumpkin and pecan, cakes- red velvet cake, slice of rolls- lemon or raspberry, cookies, macaroons, plus ice cream and gellato- about 9 flavors like cookies 'n cream, coffee (delish!!!), watermelon sorbet. Just steer clear of items like cake slices that were the obvious leftovers. I made the mistake of grabbing a red velvet slice, against my better judgement, and had to take off the entire side because it had hardened a bit- eww.  There was a lot of refilling of dishes going on by the workers, which meant there were a bunch of customers here. It was a good crowd for a saturday night. It wasn't too noisy, since our baby got to nap a bit. I also noticed a Hand Sanitizer station in between food stations, which you don't see a lot in a typical Vegas buffet. The drink server was good except she kept missing asking one person in our party.   FYI- get the card so you don't feel like you just wasted your money; it's a few dollars cheaper when you "get connected." $12.99 for saturday dinner.

MNsP5jy-EGQ1Zbk3oI8VZg.text: I am rating the Seafood Buffet on Friday night only. Totally not worth the price. Worst crab legs I have ever experienced. Tough, over-cooked and tasteless. Servers reaction when mentioned it was "maybe the next batch will be better!" Also no wet wipes??? Then I decided I'd have a piece of prime rib, however I don't like it dry and overcooked. Unfortunately no option. I passed. Too be fair the other times I've eaten there since they opened I've enjoyed but I think there is a lot of repair needed on the seafood buffet.

OT5wLaCrU_M7uasC9o6ybw.text: $15 for an all you can eat buffet that includes PRIME RIB? I AM IN!  The prime rib was my favorite. I really ate about 3 slices. & thats ALOT because i ate the other food as well. The workers were very nice and the reasonable amount of items on the buffet were okay. I was sad they didn't have FRIED CHICKEN but its okay.  I'm not too sure if we'd be coming back here, but it was a nice change and surprise.

XKh9ldWlAbheyA6b2AvtJg.text: There is no buffet that I frequent more than this one, and not just because it's close-by, but because for the price you get a pretty good meal!  It's even better if you're a gambler there because you get a discount, sometimes a comp!  I have been coming here for years, and the food is always consistently good.  They offer the usual American-Asian-Mexican-Italian-salad bar standard that I've come to expect in the average buffet here in Vegas, so you shouldn't feel like you won't find something you'll enjoy.  I eat here once a week or so, and my favorite go-to items are their BBQ items... I love their ribs and their brisket!  I also judge buffets by their mashed potatoes and I believe this buffet has some of the best in town -- none of that powdered potato crap, this stuff is legit, smothered in yummy butter!  They have a mongolian grill if you're the type who likes fresh-grilled asian fare as well.  They have a really great selection for dessert!  Although my favorite is always the gelato, if you're lucky enough for them to have chocolate chip cookies that day, make sure you swoop some up!    I usually go for lunch or dinner, but the other day I woke up early enough for the breakfast buffet for the first time in a long time, and was pleased to see that they offered many gluten-free items, and their made-to-order omelets were on point!  Great selection and affordably-priced, this is my little gem of a buffet off the strip.

YcEQUofoZ7j7ZWUxKToIjw.text: Saturday night, so nothing special on the menu.  We've been here before, several times; just seemed like the selection wasn't quite as good as before.  No specific raves or complaints.  Or maybe I was just tired.

sW8bKX5yQdEzRA403K2VRA.text: Did I hear someone say ALL YOU CAN EAT PRIME RIB?!?!?!?! Yup Yup! You did!  This buffet is located inside the New Orleans casino. The price is a bit expensive (over $13) but if you sign up for a free B-connect membership, your meal admission is only $9.99! Need I repeat it? All You Can Eat Prime Rib for only $9.99!  I have to say the quality of the selections there is pretty good, considering how much you pay for your meal. I was pleasantly surprised at the Chinese section, since the stir-fried vegetables and eggplant dish was pretty delicious. Usually, in my experience, I usually avoid the Asian section when I go to buffets (except for sushi) since the food ends up tasting like Panda Express.  But other than that, I really did enjoy the dessert! They had ice cream flavors ranging from Vanilla, Coffee, Mango, and Peach. Also there were sorbet flavors such as Passion Fruit (My fav! HIGHLY RECOMMEND!), Lemon (another hit!), and Watermelon.  I definitely recommend this place, especially if you sign up for your B-connect membership before lining up at the buffet. It's worth it. You save AND you get to eat happily. :D

slaUGHQVYgXIqUddHci7Og.text: Me , my cousin and sister in law came here to eat brunch during the brief time I was able to pull them away from the strip. The buffet was like all the others with an Asian, Barbecue, Italian and dessert station. Some of the things that stood out was at their salad bar they served grilled veggies. They had asparagus and grilled zucchini. The taste was nice and sweet.   They also serve southern food like grits , and Jambalaya. I tried the grits because I remember liking them so much when I ate some at Rosemary's restaurant but it wasn't quite the same. I did have fried scallops and mini crab cakes which were really good with a spritz of lemon. I also had chicken fried steak but it tasted plain to me because I usually eat it with a side of honey mustard. It's different ... but it tastes good! Unfortunately they had no honey mustard salad dressing.   My second plate I thought I 'd try their chocolate waffles. If you like soft waffles don't eat these they had the consistency of toast. I also grabbed some scallop mixture they had cradled in a shell it's not as tasty as the ones at Asia buffet. I would pass these up.I also tried a cheese blintze but I could only take a bite the cheese inside was all crumbly.   My dessert plate was my favorite because they had this almond crumb cake that had drizzled raspberry sauce in it. They used to serve this at Red Rock casino but I haven't seen it there in a while. It was so good with tea,. They also had Tiramisu cups which were really tasty the cake part wasn't too wet it was just right!   The most amazing part of the meal was my cousin saying this was her favorite Las Vegas Buffet . I wasn't sure I heard her right but she said this was by far her favorite. I was like ...uh okay. I'm just happy she liked it so it was a win..win situation!

photos.caption: Photo of Medley Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My dessert plate was the best part of the meal!
Photo of Medley Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Plate # 2
Photo of Medley Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Plate #1

pDXiOefyR6Fi5V4I47B0yA.text: Went to renovated buffet the 1st day it opened.  The decor was nice but the food was better before.  Decided to give it a 2nd chance since it was the 1st day.  Tried it again today was very disappointed to fine they took the handicapped line away (I think the handicapped are more important than the Emerald players).  The food was a little better this time the Asian area was the best.

xK6JZ3K1hP4Ly5XHe9lbRA.text: Every Christmas season a club my husband belongs to, which shall remain nameless to protect the dorky, has their Holiday "party" at a different buffet.  I say "party" because this group eats and runs.  Luckily, we were at a separate table with two couples who stayed a while, so it was a pleasant experience. This year's buffet was at French Market at Orleans.  I was dragged, kicking and screaming.  I'm not a fan of buffets unless they're 5 Star Yelp quality, otherwise why bother?  I don't particularly like stuffing my face just because the food's there.    We went on Friday night, which is Seafood night.  I like seafood, but don't love it, so right there my review has to lose a star - or two.  I waited patiently by the crab legs while the Great Unfed loaded up their plates to overflowing, then took my two crab legs.  I promptly gave myself a deep puncture wound trying to wrestle the crabmeat out of the shell.  I DON'T LIKE TO WORK FOR MY FOOD!!  I was happy to discover that the crab wasn't as briny as the last time I tried it, but it wasn't full of flavor, either.  I don't do oysters, so I skipped that part, and the peel-it shrimp wasn't anything to write home about.  I did like the baked salmon and the osso bucco.  The desserts were typical - looked great, tasted not so, except for one chocolate-covered thingy that had a decent chocolate mousse inside.  And the soft-serve ice cream is ice cream, not froyo at some other buffets.  That was pretty good.  I don't like pie, but I'll give this buffet a 3 .1415.

bsbRf3iZjWXve-YtkBcP1w.text: Came here on January 15 for Sunday brunch with my family. Good price for all you can eat &my parents enjoyed drinking champagne with their meal. Definitely will come back worth the money.

QsPg7EGesnTVr0pzay9vww.text: Worth every cent! Crawfish and Prime rib at it's best!

F-8SPAiYkodAY-ChyQIwCQ.text: This is the buffet option in the Orleans Casino.  We had lunch there with a reunion group and were well served in a separate room.   The food options were extensive, if not terribly exciting....other than the dessert bar which was nearly overwhelming in variety of cakes, pies, fruit, gelato and even no-sugar-added caramel gelato.  Other reviewers note the different ethnic cuisine bars, but the Mongolian area offered bacon, eggs and other breakfast items at 11 am.   Price was under $10 with the free "B-card" offered by the hotel/casino chain (available on the casino floor.)   Slightly higher in the evening, but prime rib is included.   (BTW prime ribs seems to the the mascot meat in LV)  Considerably better and nicer ambiance than the usual Golden Corral or other buffet at a very reasonable price

E82_c_jS4us9CxHQWelKeA.text: Hate to give a bad review, but if you like the Orleans buffet, please un-friend me. THIS WAS GROSS!  Seriously, this is crap. Hopefully Mr. Boyd does not show up at my house and takes this as constructive criticisms!  We had a comp, I still wanted a refund! the people in front of us paid $44 for 2 on Sunday Night "Summer Sizzling Southern Crab & Shrimp Boil". Which comes with a free beer. I asked the server about the free beer, he asked if he should go get it for us? What? I asked what kind, he replied "Blue Bell Beer" ... ummmm, again, what?   No, I guess we will pass, since we did not want to inconvenience the server.  Now, let us break this down - "Summer Sizzling Southern Crab & Shrimp Boil" - they got one part right, it was still summer. Sizzling? Nothing sizzling in here, maybe luke warm. Southern? Well, they did have crawfish, but they tasted funky. Crab & Shrimp Boil - yes, very bad crab legs ... shrimp boil? They had some popcorn shrimp that were kinda fried ... no boiled shrimp at all. Oh, and the meat?  They claimed it was tri-tip. Chewy and had a weird after taste  I have been in Las Vegas for over 20 years - and this was easily the worst buffet experience to date.

WeGyHyOaF0J1R_IcTEsMjA.text: The Orleans had trashed there buffet over the last several years to where they had to redo it and relaunch it in another name, the Medley, i tried eating here again after years of eating elsewhere up here, I decided to try this place a year ago, at the time I'm like thank you god great primo buffet, 6 months ago it was a little off, this morning worst garbage that was so bad I can't even explain it, no one spoke English except the waitress, she was going to get the manager but I left, I had nothing to say, I'm sure as hell never eating here again ever again so it don't matter... I guarantee the manager would come out and pretend he didn't know... NO anyone working here know how bad this is, hash browns put out in front of me ice cold, eggs so running gross, omelette guy could understand when I said 2 cracked eggs omelet, started to cook them without scamming into an omelet, raw bacon don't even look like it was cooked, sausage raw.... I left before I cursed out these morons, I'll never eat at Boyd gaming again NEVER

jhOE4gjYuWYjwloxKMjTXg.text: We stayed at the Orleans in July. We went to eat at the Medley Buffet, and what a surprise! The food tasted way better than last year. It was delicious. Good job Medley Buffet!

Zm5F0kBHINyeboxeCa7UCQ.text: Remodeled and now a very awesome 5 star buffet! It was a good 3.5-4 star buffet before but a lot has improved.   I enjoyed all the food!  Salad bar was great. Fresh everything, nice thick dressing. Great tacos and nachos. Good meats and mashed potatoes. Even the French fries and soups were wonderful.   Decor and seating is pleasing and comfortable. Not to smokey like the rest of the casino. Music is bad but not too loud at least.   I could dock a star but another server made up for our first server who took on 30 person group and literally just left us and never came back. Not even to say sorry or check in at all. Odd. The seating ladies, most drink servers, and the cashier were very nice. I'll not dock any stars for the one employee because overall it's a good team working.   I plan on coming back much more often now.

photos.caption: Photo of Medley Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mexican street corn, baked salmon, pork, sushi. Yum
Photo of Medley Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sushi
Photo of Medley Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Friday night shrimp tacos, and ceviche which I&#39;ve never had before. Real flavorful with shrimp, scallop, cucumber, and onion.

LQZpIAjO0RESiNPiKZFOeA.text: We ate breakfast here every morning during our stay in Vegas.  We never had to wait more than five minutes or so, maybe because it's off--peak season.  Lots of food to choose from, with an omelette station also.  Staff was friendly and the food was delicious as well.

-qlamflZOBA8vIkZY_CSuA.text: Hands down, best Thanksgiving buffet outside the Las Vegas Strip. Our server, Morgan, gave us extraordinary table service!  We got in line around 12pm and, inspite of how busy the Medley was, we were led to our table around 12:30 :-)  The kitchen staff was on spot! There wasn't any cold dish anywhere, unless of course, it was meant to be cold. The meat dishes were tender and juicy. The veggies were crisp. The salad, fruit and dessert bars were equally good.  I thanked one of the supervising managers, after noting that two of them helped clear and set up tables to keep the incoming guests seated. That's teamwork!  It's no wonder that the Medley is my fave buffet. Highly recommended.  Now get in line before they run out of ham, Turkey, and steak! Not! LOL!

photos.caption: Photo of Medley Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Melt-in-your-mouth cake. Hey!
Photo of Medley Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Two of the many desserts. Hands off, please.
Photo of Medley Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh fruits.

axagZKKqIAyimsi5AWXM2w.text: Came here last night expecting a bad buffet experience but it was surprisingly good. Pretty descent selection of food everything,  especially the prime rib, was good except some strawberry cheesecake parfait that tasted a little bit like cough syrup. I'm giving 3 stars because the food was descent and our waitress Kathy was very attentive but the guy at the dessert station was standoffish and whenever we asked for a pastry he would kind of throw it on our plate and when we asked for gelato he scraped the gross side part that had freezer burn.

NOIL6BzVaOJBObItcc3OUw.text: It's not fair to compare Medley Buffet to the Buffet at Bellagio, the buffet at Wynn or Bacchanal Buffet because this place is pretty cheap for a buffet.  $11.99 for breakfast Mon-Sat $14.99 for lunch Mon-Sat $20.99 for dinner Sun-Tues 4 pm-8 pm) and Wed, Thurs & Sat(4 pm-9 pm)  Located at the Orleans Hotel & Casino, The Medley Buffet has create your own omelette station, basic breakfast stations (egg, sausage, bacon, pancake, waffle, etc), Chinese stations, Mexican stations, donuts, ham & sausage station and assorted pastries.  I was excited to see donuts, sweet potato pancake, menudo & beef fried steak.  3 stars!!   Medley Buffet is almost yummylicious!!

HkIGsGa1FLUtQEeyA8ltnA.text: This buffet is pretty decent I mean prices are supper affordable and has plenty of options.  It's got your basic prime rib carving station, soups and pizza, salad and Asian and Mexican foods.  They have a crepe station which was good.  There is a ton of seating and if you get a players card from them (which is free at concierge desk) you also get a discount!  They didn't have any crab legs which was a bummer.  Overall three and a half stars for me!

p3IgTtO1FYrxKeRq8Aik-Q.text: Wow so much better than before. Newly renovated with more food options. Best buffet I went to while here in vegas. Couches to sit on while you wait for your table. Take out a players card and you will get $2 off- it is free to get a card btw. Lots of delicious options. Leave room for dessert for some gelato. Those little baskets they put food in are cute. so good and the price is amazing. Will be visiting more often while in Vegas.

pOGVdRA7XwECdVm4M35xYg.text: Very unfriendly tor accommodation of handicap  Big attitude from the front desk of cashier and those that direct u to your table Be aware of  Lots of cross contamination for those with allergies or ingredient sensitivity!

hxWgZbuubO-NFqZHAh7HrA.text: The Medley Buffet was the last buffet we went to before leaving Vegas. The buffet line starts from the left. Starting with build your own salad, soups, and a ramen station. Their food selections change, of course... but at the time we went, they were serving tacos, prime rib, pasta, pizza, and also had a crepe station. The dessert section is at right side of the buffet area. The soft serve ice cream & cones are tucked in a small corner at the beginning of the dessert section, next to the no sugar added desserts lol. The reason I gave Medley Buffet 4 stars is because they use a mini ice cream scooper for their gelato ice cream & they only give 1 scoop! Seriously, don't they know there's ALWAYS room for dessert?! Like all the other buffets, they also have cakes, pies, danish, other pastries and even cereal.   An overview of Medley Buffet... it's clean, modern, and well maintained. The food is delicious and the staff is very friendly and always comes around to take away the plates you are finished with. Great atmosphere and I would recommend Medley Buffet if you're looking for a buffet off the strip.

ujkknRPjgp9kaYsEPtfcqw.text: This review is specifically for the cookies on the dessert bar!  Whoever makes the cookies (chocolate chip and oatmeal raisin) for the dessert bar should honestly open their own Cookie Bar Store!  These cookies are amazing, seriously ah-maze-zing!  You cannot miss these cookies, they are wonderfully soft and delicious and perfect in every way.  They are not buffet cookies.  They are cookie monster cookies.

udRHeKyvjlgFbwZUKpuj1g.text: Friday "seafood" buffet no longer has crablegs. None at all and totally discontinued. Seafood? Crayfish, some expertly under cooked. Pizza with dried up shrimp and enchiladas with the same junky shrimps. Fake crab salad and the same subpar dried "'sushi".....terrible. Shameful example of a buffet with no more crab. In its place is chilled apples and oranges.  Uh boy, what a treat )-:

JFaRmdYp5KrbKhfO8ZfE_w.text: It's better than ever now that they renovated  Food is way better and tastier  Opens till 8pm Prices are $20ish depending on the day  Friday's are steak and ribs night! Super delish  Sunday's seafood it's a little more on those days  I always come for the crawfish!!  Because it's so bombbbbb here  This is the only place that I know that steams the crawfish without seasoning it and it's the best ever!!! It's so fresh and doesn't smell   My sissy always make her own sauce for the crawfish and it's our dipping sauce so when we come we strictly come for just the crawfish!  It's my heaven   Everything else is pretty yummy!  This place is very worth it, prices are awesome and food is pretty tasty

Kcgth4BhnZxUxdaUIzf56Q.text: Don't often write bad reviews but, unfortunately it happens.  Buffet has been remodeled, prices went up on average $5.00 but quality suffers. Let's start with the dessert station, most items were fairly bland, the custard tasted like more flour than egg, the ice cream/sorbet/gelato did not have the basic chocolate or coffee flavors not to mention the mint chip i did have was not very good.  The main entrees were over cooked, the fried items were too crunchy/hard (onion rings), fried chicken. The one redeeming item was the chicken gumbo soup. I won't be giving this place another try for a while needless to say.

bYpGSpLiSCVrOlN3N1-xNw.text: This buffet represent a good value overall in comparison with other Las Vegas alternatives by balancing a decent selection of food with perfectly adequate quality in a nice setting paired with a reasonable price.   I must admit that I rather pick this buffet over some of the higher priced ones along the Strip since it offer a similar experience including a steak station for almost half the price without being "inferior" even if some of the other dinner buffets offer an enhanced selection in some areas such as Sashimi.   The steak station at the Medley Buffet is a nice thing since I prefer it over the "carvery" style (i.e. the traditional Prime Rib or Roast Beef station, which is common) and was a pleasant surprise for the price charged here even if Paradise Buffet at the Fremont Hotel provide such a feature during their Steak Night).  I consider the food quality here to be good in general but it must be stated that we are talking "Buffet Food" - i.e. not premium quality items "made to order". We are talking comfort food here but executed in an adequate way that make the dining satisfying.   The restaurant itself is laid out in a good way, plenty of space, bright and airy decor and the buffet area is well planned and roomy; it's easy to move between the stations even if the establishment is operating at capacity. The separation between the different stations is good.  One thing to be noted is that it is a popular spot for dinner so there tend to be a line outside and the ambient noise levels can be high during dinner. It is worth to get a B Connected card and one solution when you are two would be to send one party member to the desk to sign up for it while the other wait in line for the buffet since it can be crowded at both places.  It is also easy to get to the place by car or transit (bus 201) so the off-Strip location isn't a problem in this case. The bus departs from Tropicana and New York-New York every 15 minutes approx.  I can recommend a visit to this buffet for dinner in general.

3cHGXLOJGb2GljnBzIPctQ.text: Spend your money somewhere else. Not worth it! Though newly renovated, this place does not have great food selection. Most of the meat and seafood items were half-cooked. Crawfish was ok. No crablegs. Shrimp tasted weird. Noodle egg soup was horrible. I'm giving it 1 star only for the very friendly & nice server.

photos.caption: Photo of Medley Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Terrible food selection! Egg soup was a joke. Beef has red meat blood. It is a medley of unsatisfactory meals

AAyOClha-BoQsKRmSzK15Q.text: Worth coming for breakfast if you can get it comped or deeply discounted. It's kind of annoying that they close the whole thing down between breakfast and lunch, but I'm not a huge buffet person, so this might be standard now. I think you need to be selective about what day/ meal you come here for, as some offerings are better than others. We came on a Friday and got here at 11, so we had to wait until noon for lunch.  They put bell peppers in everything and I'm allergic to them, so that limited what I could have. The barbeque brisket was a little tough, next time I'll try the ham. There will still a few breakfast offerings, but for the most part it was pretty meh. Couldn't find toast or even plain sliced bread, they had rolls to go with our omelettes. The server (I think his name was Alex) was very good though, so extra star for him.

JnHYM1-bBqS4icfH9XgCyQ.text: Went on a Thursday. Awesome value dining on the weekdays. Enjoyed prime rib, mussels, shrimp, kielbasa and more for the money!  Special Thank you to our server, Dana! Seriously, request to sit in her section - awesome service. Surprised my nephew with awesome hot chocolate. Dana rocks!

lW4TsqByYbvpBJ1qgdEHDg.text: When I was in Vegas last year, I came to the Orleans French Market Buffet. When I showed up this year, I was surprised to see a total redesign and re-vamp, now as the Medley Buffet.  First, although the previous buffet was cute and rustic, it was clearly aging. I love the new set-up and decor. Its chic and modern and I like that it feels more "open" and fresh.  That said, the food was hit or miss. Some things were pretty good, while others weren't great. The shrimp scampi and the stuffing were mushy, but the cuts of turkey and salad bar were delicious. It seemed to be like that with most of the food, so quality wasn't consistent.   Our waitress was a bit MIA most of the night. I get that its a buffet so you don't need constant attention, but we didn't see her often and that made it difficult to get refills on drinks or dirty plates taken. Other than that, the service was adequate.   There's a nice variety on desserts but I don't like the addition of having some of the small desserts behind the glass case and having to ask for them. It made it feel like I was inconveniencing them, or that I shouldn't take as much, even though its a buffet and had they been out in the open I would've gotten one of each.   Overall, its a decent value buffet. I would come here for a lunch and maybe a dinner again. There are better buffets around, but this wasn't the worst by far.

photos.caption: Photo of Medley Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Medley, indeed.

zVSGMN20-0sNL2dQss2pZw.text: This buffet is awesome! They have a wide variety of items including sushi, BBQ, Mexican, Italian, Asian, salad bar, dessert (even sugar free options), and much much more!   Your tastebuds will not be bored! I loved how the buffet items changed from breakfast to lunch to dinner and even the next day there were items they didn't offer the prior day. Also during the champagne brunch they have a chocolate fountain!   They offer an all day pass Monday-Thursday for $25 and Friday-Sunday for $28...such an incredible deal! It's a great way to save money on food while in Vegas. I will definitely be returning!

z1ea7A5GR98TSsjz4iq7_w.text: Combination of food, price and service makes this buffet worthwhile.  Nice variety of selection.  Asian, Mexican, American, Southern, and Italian.  I particularly liked the Char Sui and Smoked spare ribs, as well as the desserts.  We also got a very pleasant surprise with the 2 for 1 promotion.

ICKgtsphh9ZuIaKktv2CSA.text: Have ate here regularly when I stay at The Orleans.  A typical Vegas style buffet with five culinary stations including Italian, Mexican, Chinese, Mongolian BBQ, and Southwest BBQ. There is also two carving stations with the usual prime rib, ham, turkey or beef brisket.  Large salad bar with a few soup of the day options.  And desserts include many sugar free cakes and pies, gelato and cookies.  Good price for decent quality food.

photos.caption: Photo of Medley Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Long awaited Thanksgiving dinner plate!

SeQtvtMPywSmsLWXqm5K6Q.text: Avoid this place....the only thing good was the omelette & beef ribs. Bland fried rice, salty biscuits & gravy, & a cardboard tasting rice Krispy treats.

SxW0PxyK2j-3SaK3XUd-rg.text: I had the worst experience at the French Market Buffet, the waitress (Judy) told our table to "shut up and listen so I don't repeat myself" then she said the drinks they carry.  I responded by asking her if she was in a bad mood? She said no why!! Then I said because you're being very rude to us.  She stated I'm not being rude and said she will get someone else to serve us.  Then I followed her and she was talking to the hostess Ana and they both were laughing, so I approached both of them and said I don't think it's funny.  Ana responded and said "oh we are not laughing at you", I then said I needed to speak to management.   I got to speak to the supervisor who had me and my friend write a report.  We then were approached by the manager (Rhonda Turner) who I feel was very professional in handling such situation.  I also want to state that the waiter they sent (Felipe) was very attentive and super polite.  Kudos to them both!!!  I can't believe the bad service we received here and won't be returning.  I still left a tip because Felipe gave us good service the remaining of the time.   One star as we waited 40 minutes for our drinks and the terrible experience from the first waitress Judy!!!!

I should have gone to TGIF, which is also located in the Orleans.  The food was sub-par. The only two items that were tasty were the ribs and the gelato (+ for this), both of which you had to ask a server for. There are different food stations, but their themed dishes were not worthy. Customer service was great, but there was still nothing memorable about this location.   Please save your $$$ and try another buffet.

vcBJ3bx1FVjSMzPG0LiQFQ.text: This review is based on lunch dining - I would've never though to go here, but it was a work stop, so here goes my review.   It's $7.99 for lunch and it's quick, its food and whare more would you expect given those two things.  It doesn't compare to many of the strip buffets in terms of the quality of food, but I don't think it tries to.    There is quite a large variety of options organized by cuisine.  I had a few things from the american and chinese section and a salad.  I did see pizza, pasta, potatos, fried chicken, meatloaf, mac-n-cheese, a mexican spread of tortillas and taco shells with the fixin's, and salmon that was actually pretty tasty!  There are quite a few dessert options to go with the many food options and there is hard scoop ice cream and I am a sucker for hard scoop ice cream!  The soft serve machine stuff doesn't cut it.  The coconut cream pie was probably the best tasting thing I had during my trip there, definitely recommend it.   Btw, THERE IS NO ROMAINE - it's an iceberg lettuce kind of place, but that sums it up.  That should be the title of this review. :)

geA685VxcPyd9Qd1mQDXag.text: No great stand outs here. Nothing that I wanted to go back for - sad. Crab, crayfish, salmon (maybe the best item I ate), ribs - bland, prime rib - overcooked.  Desserts were run of the mill high production type desserts.  My lemon meringue pie meringue was so hard I couldn't cut it without a knife.

2nzR8KDjR5Gn3gV0bSGsyQ.text: Mediocre food. You get $1 off up to two buffets with one player card. The prime rib was super rare, pork loin was dry. Peel and eat shrimp were good, but too much work. Desserts were pretty good, loved the chocolate cake and various gelatos. Service was basic, the table was dirty and server took forever to clear our stacked plates.

WeCoJfa28FP3plbegJ12TQ.text: Prime rib that melts in your mouth. And a good price with your connected card. Vegas really is a foodie paradise

ZPVwjOauOVU0xMNKkVBxNg.text: Met some friends here for dinner tonight and most things were done OK for a buffet.  However, two things caught my eye.  1)  Perogies larger than 2 raviolis combined and sitting in tomato sauce; and 2) Stuffed cabbage with a sweet raisin sauce.  Who on Earth ever added these tender morsels to the lineup? Certainly not a Top Chef contestant.  I didn't try either of these, but one member of our party tried the stuffed cabbage, but didn't know what it was.  He remarked as to how sweet it was.  I did try some of the red cabbage and that had been sugared too!  It doesn't need to be that way.  The rest of the things I tried were good especially, to my surprise, the Osso Buco.

jWI1BKxD8amSP8BH8_O7Jw.text: I'm extremely easy to please so this is my first 1-star review and let me just tell you it's for a reason. There was not a single item here that had flavor or wasn't dried out. Lowest quality food I've ever put in my mouth and I feel disgusting right now.

8fanD4PYz9JZJ5Qv7xbafw.text: Food was very bland and poorly put together. Everything tasted old and not fresh. Weird smells from food lines. Omelette bar was gross. The only reason they are getting 2 stars  is because of the breakfast desert.

ZpPna83JQMP9xmF5oOGBVA.text: This is the cheapest place in Vegas to eat buffet...but you can see why. 14.99 gets you a bunch of crap food and unlimited champagne. I'd honestly rather pay 20 bucks more and try the Rio buffet instead, which is a whole better deal.  I'd get little foods here and there and take a bite out of everything but i wasn't impressed.  In fact, all I ended up doing was eating a bunch of bananas.

LTlPo-he75ZDbcQExYZ97A.text: This buffet is disgusting and not worth $20 a dinner at all! Do not waste your time!!!!! Go anywhere else and it will be better. The food is not fresh, all premade, even the dessert was bad. I mean how do you mess up a brownie?!

sb5eqnG_mLvLOOR33XLIGg.text: I came on Easter Sunday, which was the last day of Viva Las Vegas for the Champagne Seafood Brunch, and I was pretty pleased. The line to get in was pretty intense, but it went by fast so didn't wait longer than 20 minutes to get seated. The French Market has all sorts of food including: American, Italian, Mongolian, BBQ, Mexican, Chinese, and Seafood. They have 2 big salad bars and a pretty good dessert section, but seriously, who wastes time with salad at a buffet?!   The beef ribs and prime rib from the carvers station were pretty good, probably one of my favorite things there on that day. I mostly took my chances with the huge variety of seafood there was to offer. The salmon, the king crab, snow crab, shrimp, craw fish, mussels and clams were all very good. The craw fish is sort of complicated to eat and so are the crab legs, which there was a crazy long line to get, haha. Fine, maybe I'm just dumb and don't know how to eat, but still I was getting impatient with the craw fish and crab legs. It's too much work for not that much meat, haha.   They had an omelet station where you had omelets made for you after picking out what you want in it. It was whatever, not too impressed, takes too long and isn't the best omelet ever. The whole USA section of the buffet is pretty bland, very typical breakfast foods, but boring and flavorless. and I love breakfast foods, but that was a fail. The deserts looked so awesome, but I just had a little bit of ice cream, didn't want to go into food coma after.  Too bad I was driving home after otherwise I would've taken advantage of the unlimited Champagne and made them fill up my Viva boot for me, haha. I really wanted to eat their usual Sunday night dinner which is rib night, but since it was Easter they had the Seafood Brunch special, oh well maybe next year.

JqaEzi4rz3qU9oENaOky_g.text: I want to give this buffet more stars but my honesty won't allow me. The price and quality of food go hand and hand in this establishment. This is a place I would eat with my friends when hungover and dehydration has set in. This a wonderful casino with great service but the quality of food is fair at best. I've been here 2-3 times and have always walked away full. I stick to all of the food that looks and smells hot and fresh. Seafood here may be a gamble but I enjoy gambling at the Orleans. I have never gotten sick because I take my time to eat food that looks of good quality. The dessert bar was forgettable. The breakfast buffet is well worth the price. All in all, I would have to say the breakfast buffet is Key.

Tc0ql3e_W6WDOy0JIiILoA.text: This was probably the worst food I have ever eaten in my entire life. The roast beef tasted like they put poultry seasoning on it the chinese food was over deep fried and when I finally tried the prime rib it tasted like it was rotten. The only good thing on the buffet was the Mexican food and the desserts were good. I stayed at the Orleans for a month and I wouldn't give them another dime to eat there that horrible buffet could be complimentary with your stay and I still wouldn't eat there again.

CAzawVrKF2pABFrkm0A-GQ.text: I've been here now for breakfast and for lunch, and I gotta admit, they were pretty good.  Not every item was great or anything, but over all I definitely enjoyed both meals. This place is DEFINITELY better then suncoast buffet. That place went down hill YEARS ago and is gross.  I will definitely be back to this place and just fyi, not only did this buffet have a crowd of people, so did the casino area too.  So people are comin here for a reason. ;-)

Dd-QHgN60S-cnxKKGi0UnQ.text: As of today, it is the Medley Buffet. A real big step in the wrong direction, IMHO. Whoever was in charge of this remodel was very foolish! Gone is the festive, colorful feel of the old buffet. Welcome to the dreary somber feel of corporate gloom. There are grey walls all over the seating area that separate you from the food and other diners. There is literally nothing to look at. I'll miss the whimsical signs directing you to the various types of food they serve. Still no restroom in the buffet.  I was there for lunch today and found that even though they raised the entry price, I didn't see any roast beef, turkey, shrimp or craw fish like at the old buffet. Perhaps I missed them because the food area is more spread out and there are no signs.  They also eliminated any dedicated line for disabled people which shows me that they don't realize that they have a much older customer base than most casinos. Maybe they just don't care. Remember, I said whoever is in charge was foolish and inconsiderate of customer needs!  Whoever made up the new pricing is also foolish as they post on the website and at door that breakfast is from 8am to 10am and lunch is from 11am to 3 pm. What happens between 10am and 11am? I called and asked and was told that if you come after 10am you will be charged the lunch price ($3 more) BUT you won't get any lunch items until 11am when they start putting it out! Who made this ripoff deal up? Maybe they were rushed to come up with this new ridiculous pricing. They only had 4 long months before they reopened. READ UPDATE BELOW...  To sum up, a cold dreary atmosphere, raised prices but fewer pricey foods, no accommodations  for handicapped people, unnecessary walls all around, still no restrooms in the buffet, and unreasonable high pricing etc., a definite step in the wrong direction for me. I much preferred it the way it used to be!  UPDATE: I went back today to the new buffet to take another look and found that I was given incorrect information yesterday. The reason for lack of pricing between 10am and 11am is that they actually close and stop admitting customers for that hour! They do the same thing from 3pm to 4pm. I'm retired and don't keep track of time anymore. I go to the Orleans to gamble and as soon as I either run out of money or get hungry, I head for the buffet. Now I have to worry if it'll be open since they close twice for two hours a day during the daytime. I guess I'll have to find somewhere else to gamble and eat.

LakJGzdcVaFf2bExAiDkCA.text: I tried the new Orleans Medley buffet after the major renovation of the hotel, including the restaurants. Although the prices doubled, I was pleased with the quality of the dishes and the pastry section. A couple of months ago, I started going to the buffet about twice a month and it's been a hit and miss situation. One time, the ham was delicious, not salty and I could taste the caramelized sugar on the fat covering the ham, then other times it's inedible due to too much salt and hard meat. The brisket always taste like sawdust and fuel, over grilled. I used to love the corn on the cob, it was soaked in milk and butter but lately it's just in water, no taste. Most of the deserts taste like they were made of inferior ingredients. I'm so disappointed, there is no reason for Orleans with the money they make in their casino to cheapen again in their buffet. Now it's just like old times, only more than double the price...........sad! I'll never come back

5LQ5hSn5x01ZTHSj0Fz8ZA.text: Orleans has stepped up their buffet since the previous one! The food was delicious and fresh! Each time I would get up to get more food, the seafood dishes would restock like the crawfish, oysters, and mussels. The waiter was polite and very attentive towards each table with their needs. The only thing disappointing from this seafood dinner was the crab. Usually the crab would be snow crab legs however today was dungeons crab legs which doesn't have too much meat in them.

85tAwBE6gABLFtNhzb73dg.text: The date of this review is December 25, 2016.  This French Market Buffet is located inside the Orleans Hotel and Casino. It is on Tropicana Avenue and it is a little distance from Las Vegas Blvd. (The Strip). They offer very reasonably priced food with great taste!   On Tuesday, December 20, 2016, we had lunch. On Wednesday, December 21, 2016 and Thursday, December 22, 2016 we had dinner. Each time we have been at the French Market Buffet there was a large selection of buffet items.  They offer several types of food, Italian (pasta, pizza, etc.), Mexican (enchiladas, salsa, beans, etc.) Chinese (sweet and sour, fried rice, egg rolls, etc.), American (turkey, chicken, biscuit, gravy, etc.), Mongolian (stir fried noodles, etc.), Seafood (crawfish, shrimp, etc. (sorry, no crab legs!)), and BBQ (Prime rib roast, BBQ beef ribs, boiled corn, etc.) A standard salad bar and a dessert bar (cakes, ice cream, pies, cheesecake, etc.) are also provided.  The chefs are very cordial and accommodating. We asked the BBQ chef for two generous prime rib roast meat to be grilled on the BBQ. He gladly obliged and served us.  The lunch is $11.99 and the dinner is $18.99, each very much worth the price. My wife and I both enjoyed our meals.

ZgfWKI5jp_fJPTZ0miS0Rw.text: Since they've done the redesign it seems their food menu was also redesigned. The selection has decreased but the quality has increased. We've gone several times four different meals and I can now say I'm happy with their breakfast! Someone finally learned how to cook scrambled eggs!! Salad bar is decent but it seems like they took out a lot of the other salad types to choose from. Steak options are good but they're always overcooked. I would suggest making them medium-rare and then grill a little longer for those who want thoroughly cooked meat, I prefer medium, the Mister likes medium rare - unfortunately we don't get that option here, it's either well-done or well-done. Dessert area is definitely lacking options, and flavor. Seems to be easier to get in these days though, as we haven't waited more than 10 minutes in line. It still could use a little more improvement in food quality/quantity, but a definite step up from where it was!

hoayELPQCu1tbzmyannf7g.text: Recent upgrade ( place looks nice ) with usual consequence of price hike and less people. We came because of our 2 for 1 coupon. Great selections for those who love Asian food ( which I do ). Their brisket was tender but the flavor was bland- needs some salt and some spice. Love the omelette station btw. Cashier told us they stopped their seafood night because of lack of guests and our server told us they have been cutting servers hours because of lack of business. Are we coming back? Not without a 2 for 1 coupon. I told our server South Point has the best food out of all our local casinos and only costs $10. I bet if they charge $10-11, they would see more traffic. Not everything is about the ambience, buffet is all about food and price.

H1LzEzdMp1p4KfrEP83ouQ.text: This is the second time coming to this buffet and the food was pretty okay; however, I asked about the time this buffet was supposed to close.  The buffet was closed at 0900pm and it was a little bit after that time so I wanted to get some dessert before I left.  I went over to the dessert place and the worker was hollerin' out.."we're closed!!" Then, he proceeds to turn out the light so I walked away very disappointed.  After spending $159...really?  Not sure if it was worth it to come back.

gZ5zyVfYFCqhAUfuD4kFtg.text: I would give this a 3.5 actually because of the outstanding remodel and much improvement in food quality ! Here's what I liked. There was more salad variety, like seafood, edamame, cucumber. The hit items like Asian and Mexican fare look more fresh and appetizing  .We also noticed more of a variety in desserts as well. My favorites, oxtail soup , edamame salad, and Mexican corn !  Very very good !  layout is more spacious without the stations in the middle for cold items like it was before. What I couldn't understand was the Caesar salad station placed far away from the others and the breakfast was still being served at 1230pm. I feel like they were just there to fill space . Otherwise,  I still suggest you check it out !

FmKC49iZzL2o98sTOK0-Aw.text: A couple friends were in town and they were staying at the New Orleans. We were going to head to that other restaurant that serves mainly seafood, and I'm allergic.  And the story gets written err typed from there...  No line, walked straight to the cashier, and in...that had to have been record time for a buffet line! Lunch was on my friend so I don't even know how much it came out to nor did I bother to read how much. Probably wasnt interested as I could forsee myself never coming back anyway.  There are buffets you may try and know...just know...once you have your plate in hand and start doing the slow zombie walk as your eyes wait for something from the warmers to jump out at you...and nothing doesn't. So you forcefully tell yourself, just get something. And I did...  Everything aside from salads because I swear you almost can't go wrong with salads unless the dressing is gross or the salads are wilted...and buffets never screw up on salads...regressing here, okay...everything I had was bland, boring, and dry. That was me trying a dish from every country they offered. I even had a simple rye grilled cheese sandwich or something like that...and THAT was bland, boring, and dry. What the?! Service was typical of a buffet one so no comment. As long as we got our drinks refilled without asking, good enough.  So before I make this long and repetitive, unless you get your food comped here, or you don't want to leave the casino...then by all means. However, if you are coming here from elsewhere looking to eat at a buffet, I won't say DONT...but uhh....you know there are a lot of good places to eat out here.  It is kid friendly (but if you don't want the smoke smell since you do have to go through the casino then not so kid friendly) and stroller friendly.  Enjoy!

2YqRuNuUqtWUJAXzWPIuYQ.text: After the renovation, it looks modern. Perfect customer service & great selection of food. Delicious!!!

RMa0Yj1BqbQMC2bOp6eSnQ.text: My visit to Medley Buffet was such a great experience.  Our fist visit to this place was an experience to boast. We have been to many buffets but  our server Amy Fetene gave us the best experience that we definitely want to come back.  The food was excellent and thanks again to Amy. Kudos to you for your great service.

VA--UVge2wju7ywJtJIIbQ.text: This place is awesome. We usually come here to have breakfast or lunch after my husband's doctor's appointment. It's delicious. We love our waiter. He is attentive and helpful. Thank you so much for your Excellent Service. We will see you again soon.

y6FQlv2jjyF5YAdILHzoOg.text: Remodelled Orleans Buffet now called MEDLEY BUFFET. Ox tail melts in your mouth and loved the steamed dumpling. duck was tasteful.  Very modern feel and spacious. Great selection.  Sign up with their players card and you get a different discount

ju1EtneFpFF7gw3omg_0AQ.text: This is a big step up from the old place. Lots of choices with good flavor. I would go back again

yV0FMjwEMN-k4TF5mUvJrA.text: First time trying out this buffet at New Orleans Casino. Coming here on friday night for seafood buffet. This is surprisingly good and beyond my expectation. It is inexpensive as well for $27.99 per person. A lot of crab legs from both areas for hot and cold. They got the raw oysters, shrimps, big mussels, whole fish, prime rib and full rack of beef short ribs. Love the beef short ribs. It was so juicy and so good. Absolutely a very good quality of foods. I'll definitely be back next time soon whenever I were in Vegas.
