nBeoog8Sefwd6xvqu5SEdA.text: The food was good, but it was not worth the high cost. I feel like it could use a bit more flavoring in its foods, and the overall area to dine should be remodeled to be better and more sanitary. Sometimes, Medley Buffet just seems a bit simple, with everything you can get from a normal much cheaper buffet, and I don't think it stands out from others. Don't get me wrong, good food, but just not worth the high cost. Vegas has other great buffets; Medley Buffet just isn't a great one to go to unless your happy to spend money.   Use the Boyd Gaming Card or BConnected Card to get discounts; If you don't use them, the cost will jack up faster than you think it will, and soon you'll have an empty pocket.  Overall an icky buffet to go to, an I probably don't want to go there ever again.....  Last thing, don't get too much of the Pho. It is basically Cup Noodles and it will fill you up before you get to eat anything else. Try not to eat the noodles, rice, fried things, pizzas, or any other wheat products cause they will fill you up completely. How do I know that? From personal experience that you don't want to know exactly what happened.   List of better Las Vegas Buffets in Strip Hotels: 1) Flamingo 2) South Point 3) MGM 4) JUST DON'T EAT THE OVERPRICED STRIP HOTEL BUFFETS!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

7x6hkvvisGYJc4S2gV3vNg.text: I arrived a minute or two before they opened at 8am on a Saturday and waited about 7 minutes in line which isn't too bad.   The cost is only $9.99 (11 something with Tax) - which is actually a great price - not all of the food on the breakfast buffet is good but there are some hidden gems   DOs - bacon - it's extra crispy !         - tater tots - cannot screw these up!         - hash browns - crisp not soggy         - multi-grain waffle w/strawberry sauce         - pancakes - not super awesome but probably IHOP quality         - omelette bar - customize just ask for less oil so it isn't saturated.   DO NOTS - eggs Benedict - disastrous                   - standard eggs - just bad                Service is very friendly. The person assigned to my table came back frequently to check my coffee and water to see if I needed more and took my plates away.   Coffee is a go!  I only rank this 3 stars BC I've hit just about every buffet in Vegas and even with the $9.99 cost this one isn't rated up super high... But if you are staying at the Orleans you can get an omelette, waffle, pancakes, hash browns, toast, juice w coffee for around 11 bucks and if you got all that a joint it would cost like $30 so it's more of a bargain spot than one you would enjoy the food a lot!

photos.caption: Photo of Medley Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Here is the short line right at 8am

7_bZWzFSArd10OWGjRVKzw.text: Decent buffet for the price.  Crawfish, shrimp, deserts could use improvement. Wait staff was very good.  Line took 30 min to get in with empty tables inside. Salads, shrimp and meats were all very good as well. The Oyster Bar in The Orleans is fantastic.

7jMLJUekaopQUkUo2-BL_g.text: Food was just plain, not of a lot of variety either. Not a place I'd be eager to come back too.

hq52ijqKguRZLORPNdL_hw.text: The food was good but not memorable.  The staff was accommodating.  The dessert counter was very good. They offered gluten-fee desserts, some healthy options, but I went for the cannoli's.  They offered a wide variety of options (oriental, Italian, Mexican).  The servers were quick to clear out  our plates & replenish drinks.  At times the line was long to get in. I wished I had noticed the $33 a day price earlier during my stay at the Orleans Hotel.  I would have taken advantage of it.  Overall a decent experience.

CnpGtAxmerRGIlGmxw8D3A.text: Living in Las Vegas, I've been to quite a few buffets at both the big hotels and Station Casinos. This one is definitely one of your best deals (about $16.99 for dinner, $3 discount with BConnected card) for the mid-priced buffets. The prime rib was excellent, and the other offerings included Mexican, Asian, Mongolian, pasta station, delicious dessert station.

-pU5GZn-qdLJcSiq9qUyxA.text: This is not one of the best places for a buffet, but if you want to save money and go to one for the basics, this is it.  They don't offer fried shrimp, crab legs, etc., but they do have prime rib and roasted chicken. Yay.

MpVT2ALa-JaEkZIFuQJ7RA.text: Buffet isn't my thing but my girl was having a craving.. So we searched around and saw that the Orleans has what is said to be a good buffet. Good is subjective and lets just say there were lots of people that seemed to be enjoying themselves there.. I just wasn't one of them..   Options.. Seafood.. American.. Mexican.. Pasta (Italian I guess) Chinese, and big ol desert bar. Well It was all very plain Jane and wasnt something I would partake in again.  Buffet food is generally low end but this was really just the bare basics of buffet food. Lots of starches and low quality proteins. I guess that's how they make money but it was all very average and pretty sucky. The Chinese food was really bad.. nothing Chinese about it.. unless u figure Panda Express is from the mainland.. but PE blows this away in spades.. American.. was just crappy dried up prime rib.. with lows of bread and fillers.. Salad bar didnt even have seafood.. like shrimp etc..  I wouldn't recommend.. was just too low quality.. price was low.. like the quality.. $28 for two of us.. lol.. should have known..

myLVf0a4uDcvYM6eplpoZA.text: My husband and I tagged along to my mom's high school reunion.  They invited us to have dinner at The French Market in The Orleans.  The buffet here is ok.  I had a hard time getting something that I liked.  The only thing that I remembered were crab legs and the soup.  Other then that...everything else was bleh...

wA__FTSfXkfqfnDiRmddeQ.text: I don't think so.   This "buffet" is probably one of the worst buffets I've ever eaten at. The food was bland, the staff was rowdy, and the utensils were dirty. When you eat corn that tastes like nothing, you know this is a waste of 14 dollars.   Just don't come here at all.

kzjTnKHYzZ5gufPHA3aiiA.text: While waiting to watch a transformers 3, me and my fiancee was hit by a hungry monster. So we decided to take the later show and fill our tummy with some monster food.   The wait wasnt that long and they have some special for $13 perperson at 4 pm everyday except wednesday and friday I guess. All and all the food was considerably yummy although I only like a very few items.   Service are ok and I dont even bother to get myself a second serving. A-ok for moi!

Y6H6RmDAYV3lIVXYimjG9w.text: Oh my goodness my mouth is watering just thinking about this buffet  Its located in New Orleans, a little off the strip, but it is well worth the drive. The price is unbelievable! $7.99 for lunch on a weekday! For a buffet! With seafood! and steak and dessert! I don't understand how they are even making a profit!  For seafood, they have fish, crayfish, shrimp and KING CRAB LEGS. They have a variety of american food (steak, mac n cheese, grilled cheese), chinese food, mexican food, italian food (pasta, lasagna, pizza), BBQ (mongolian BBQ and baby back ribs) and over 25 varieties of desserts.   Everytime I go to Vegas, I come here and eat my heart out like a little fatty.   Highly recommended for a casual lunch and a great cure for hangovers :)

4QMEv8cKc6SZ5dWaFydUwQ.text: A buffet is a buffet is a buffet (unless you are willing to spend the BIG dollars to dine at the Bellagio buffet...THAT one is amazing.  But I digress...).  We came here with some free buffet tickets in hand (you've GOT to love free Vegas!) and without much of an appetite so we didn't try much.  Overall, the French Market Buffet isn't anything amazing, BUT it does have everything.  There were sections of food "types":  American, Mexican, Seafood, Asian, Italian and they each had a really decent selection.  The food was okay, the service was actually pretty good, and the atmosphere was typical buffet.  I think this is definitely a decent choice if you are staying here and want to eat on the cheap or with a lot of choices, but I wouldn't go out of my way to come here if I wasn't (especially with the other [better] choices that The Orleans offers).

HTy13WJT75FBvXGlyyoL_A.text: Excellent buffet for the price!  They have all sort of different foods to choose from, and not the long over crowded buffet like the ones on the strip.  Also sign up for there free B-Connect card and you get a discount on the buffet.  Well worth the trip and price.

3HTzWyT3HzG-sU4qDOjWrg.text: This is for the Breakfast buffet.   I'm not a fan of the all you can eat, and this one reminded my why.   Everything on my plate was cold and tasteless. Next time my family wants breakfast, we will go down the street to Jack in the box.

hv09My27pHp-WimRBAL7lQ.text: I went to the French Market for the all you can eat BBQ beef ribs.   First of all, even though they call it BBQ it's not.  The ribs are roasted in an oven, and then just before serving the cook slathers some BBQ sauce on the ribs, puts them on the fire for 60 seconds and then serves them.  There is no BBQ flavor, no smoke, no spice rub, no falling off the bone tender.  They don't give you a steak knife so eating them is a pain.  The ribs have been cut so that the only meat is the little strip of meat between the bones.  Very disappointing - but all you can eat - for about $10 if you are a member of the players club.     The salad bar had the bare minimum ingredients to call it a salad.  The deserts were more looks than taste.  Tasteless meringue in the lemon meringue pie, tasteless pumpkin pie, cannolli with barely any filling.  Best desert was the cream puff.  There are much better buffets in LV (but they don't have beef ribs).

pUd8nbJltGTl6QdxK2gFfg.text: Can't say much about lunch but definitely come here for breakfast. My friends and I came here for lunch and was not impressed but received a $2 off coupon for breakfast. So the next morning we came and ate breakfast at about $4 a person. Only in Vegas can you find prices like these for the food you get. The breakfast is a fat kid's dream come True complete with pancakes, waffles, desserts, you name it.  By the way if you go a little later say around 10:15 you get to start off eating breakfast and end the meal with a little bit of lunch (spoken like a True fatass). When we got there breakfast was being served but they changed everything into the lunch menu not too long later.  This place makes losing money in Vegas worthwhile. And this is why I love Vegas. People think I come here to gamble but I secretly come because of the food.

YUU0ni0ysg1YMckSeN1KoA.text: Went here at the French Market buffet in the Orleans for lunch on a Christmas Monday, didn't have to wait long. Everything looks and tastes fresh. I especially love the Korean short ribs and rotisserie chicken which they served! They are both to die for! Would love to come back for more. Please save me a seat. Thank u. Almost forgot to mention. The cost is average! Only $10 per person without club card. Worth every pennies. So, What are u waitin for?

tHq2Q97scYJOLb0v8zkeZg.text: First of all, bad news for you crawfish fanatics - they have a notice saying they won't be serving them for the foreseeable future.   I stay at the Orleans a lot because of the gambling and because I get comped (although I'm not exactly a whale - more like a minnow). So I often eat here. This trip I discovered Anton's Secret to Buffeting: try having a meal more like you would in a regular restaurant, that is by courses, or by themes. Usually I sample a bit of everything to make sure I don't miss anything good, but really, this isn't the only time I'm ever going to eat here, so why not be a little more discriminating?   For example, on this visit I had dinner here twice. The first night I did it strictly Mexican. It was not bad but not memorable - maybe the double tequila had something to do with that. On the second night, I had a full course meal: a seafood appetizer - shrimp and clams, a salad, and an entree of sliced-to-order roast beef with vegetables (although I did sneak  in a yummy rib). And pecan pie for dessert (ok - I also had some bread pudding - but how can you go to Las Vegas and not have bread pudding?). All was certainly as good as your average restaurant, but a lot cheaper.

tIFFeOcdKnPqtvawr3K--w.text: I'll keep it short. Crawfish (fresh) and Beef Ribs (fall off the bone goodness). YUM! And for less than $10/person for lunch? That's a steal!  oh, and desserts were great too :)

a_qljfeXREn9Mcdj8GtMYA.text: We will keep this one simple Went on two different nights, comped so we thought we would take advantage. Seafood night was somewhat phoned in. It just strikes me as an old folks home buffet. Bland and brown. Oh well if it's free it's worth it. The stars are all for the service.

QgXLuDgMjRRCHkabPxQ53Q.text: The most horrible food quality - save your money. Dont know how anybody could give this place the many positive reviews seen here.

INA3C7vSB2U1h8shZ-bzvQ.text: Fairly good food.  Unpeeled shrimp.  No turkey.   Good breakfast stuff still out at noon. Would not be my first choice, but not to bad.  Overall the hotel and casino are fine.  Other restaurants  here are very good.

iLD3wxQymrlmd_PPRHkWKg.text: it's a buffet.  good variety of usa, bbq, chinese, seafood, mexican, italian represented.

_oGZdVlbjA1QylT4idM3Xw.text: Great buffet for the price!  We ate here twice in the 4 days we were here.

2ry4qyWVf9NXTrVU_9uf1Q.text: The food was cheap value. Not worth $10.00 yet alone the $$$it cost to get in.  As a local I'll say many better other buffets

aSY9wKtPqFs7euIyoneigA.text: Medley Buffet is the name of the Orleans new buffet. It replaces the French Market Buffet which had been the casino's buffet since they first opened some 20 years ago. It's theme matched the casino. I actually liked the French Market Buffet and had been going for years. It had a very casual atmosphere and it was decorative, the Mexican food section had a Mexican theme decor, the Chinese food section had a Chinese theme decor, and so on. It had character. I liked the layout. One big section in the middle for desserts. Matching fruits, salad, and soup sections on each side of the buffet. And a row of everything else stretching across the entire length of the buffet starting. Most of the food wasn't the greatest but their BBQ section had to be one my favorites.  This new buffet is a lot brighter and a lot "fancier" looking than before. The layout is just one long row stretched across the length of the buffet. They have the usual Asian, Italian, BBQ, and Mexican sections with various items changed and even improved. The dessert section is a lot smaller but offered some better items. The soups, salads, and fruits section is ok. There's grilled steak. There's these thick short ribs which was my favorite item. I ate a bunch of them. The BBQ section seemed smaller but they still had the BBQ beef ribs which was good. They have crepes, pho, el pastor tacos, and those Mexican corn on the cob.  Overall it's not bad of a buffet though I've had better in the price range. It was about $20 for regular dinner, non-seafood night.

yLTnuuNm_ZPyXe_7wVO0Gw.text: UPDATE 1/29/19: I stay here about one week per month...sorry to say it but look somewhere else for breakfast. So sad, don't know what has happened, but everything is just awful. Runny watered down oatmeal, powdered eggs for scrambled eggs, burnt black hash browns, omelet station burning everything, I think the guacamole is actually rotten..,not really any nutritious gluten free stuff unless you count the melon or canned fruit and ice cream, but the machine was broke...leaving hungry. Oh and the orange flavored gluten free muffin is the best if you knock off the hard lump of frosting. And there were no placemat menus for gluten free items.   Previous review: Gluten Free Buffet! Sweet! Paper placemat has gluten free items listed on it right at table so you can preview the available menu items. You can order your own gluten free pizza...although I didn't care for the crust. For those who are truly gluten free, guess what? The staff is KNOWLEDGEABLE ( imagine that!), about the ingredients in the food!  Only four stars because of pizza crust...hopefully they find a better alternative as mine fell apart and I had to eat it with a fork but the toppings were

0wO8PLKGh26ORIvURG1q7A.text: Please note that this buffet has been remodeled so be careful of older reviews.   I was pretty impressed with this buffet, honestly. I went for lunch on a Saturday since we happened to be here. Line was fairly long but kept moving quickly. Be mindful that lunch ends at 3:30 but they stop ringing people up at 3:00.   The place has a very nice variety of food, especially for a frequent buffet lover like myself. They had some odd noodle dishes, fresh pork tacos, a noodle station.  They also had the requisite omelet station and three pans - which means the line moves pretty quickly. I felt like overall the food was pretty fresh and wasn't sitting out.   I wouldn't go out of my way for this buffet, but if you're already at the Orleans it's worth a visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Medley Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Three fresh meats
Photo of Medley Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Some interesting noodle dishes
Photo of Medley Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. More yummy desserts you have to wait for a server to grab

tBiF5ZXJiHu4BehEQxwsFQ.text: The reviews seemed good but when my family and I went inside it was not what we expected. Dirty table, floor, and overall the area we were seated wasn't appealing to the eye. Wood hard bench for a seat. The table was dirty that we were sat at. Obviously, we left. I do not take chances with my food if the location looks unsanitary.

8QynIDY4e_UQuuhbHLYriA.text: This was our dinner the second night we were in Vegas. It's located in The Orleans, which was super close to the place we were staying at. There was a parking garage at the casino, so that was cool. We followed the overhead signs as we walked through the casino to get to the buffet. We only had about a ten minute wait in line on a Saturday evening. The buffet there is very reasonably priced. They didn't even charge our three year old grandson. I guess they know a three year old eats about fifty cents worth of food, then a small ice cream cone. I started with some peel and eat shrimp. They were medium sized, fresh and tasty. When I finished my shrimp, I got a slice of prime rib and a little salad. The prime rib was just OK, not really tender. The salad bar had a decent selection and good ranch dressing. The family tried a variety of different foods and everyone was happy. When my family members came back to the table with desserts, I had to go peek at the expansive selection. I noticed sugar free strawberry ice cream and got a small scoop. It was delicious! I thought it was just me, but everyone else in our party noticed what a sourpuss our server was, too. Maybe she was just having a bad day. Overall, a nice dining experience. And I was able to go to a buffet and eat keto.

MPy_ZQ0j7oIv6pAe9YJ2iA.text: Food is ok. Service is not very good. We had Tiffany and she full of empty promises. Tiffany took forever to get our drinks and once she came, she said she'd bring napkins but she forgot. I would have given her a break had I seen her busy.....but she was standing there bragging how Sunday night was her "Friday". Victoria however who was not even our server, saw us sitting there with no drinks and offered to assist, even though Tiffany was assigned to us. I'd say get rid of Tiffany, she's lazy and get 2 more of Victoria's. Victoria was awesome and such a hard worker!

paEE5niBO5H0SC2zdsV-QA.text: There's A LOT of food to choose from, but personally I didn't find any of it worth having seconds of. There's a salad bar, lots of types of meat, Mexican, Italian, and Asian sections. A wide variety of things to try. However, as I said, nothing is super amazing. Even with desserts, there's a lot, but nothing was worth getting again - except the ice cream that the employees scoop for you, with many flavors to choose from. Part of the dessert section is behind glass and you have to have an employee get it for you. However, the employee when I was there wasn't able to tell me what any of the desserts were when I asked! He apologetically replied, "I don't know. There's too many."

Z-GliJVilJD2-fbJmcASzw.text: If you are looking for a Cajun/Creole experience, it's better to avoid this place. The food was fairly good; it's fresh and warm. Generally, the flavors are average; but not stellar. The service was good and the decor has been kept updated and clean. I understand that the "Vegas of old" is long gone; taken over by corporations that are more interested in their bottom line than providing a good guest experience or customer service. It's just too bad that "average" and "adequate" are acceptable in a town that built it's reputation on being better than everything else out there. Sadly, I won't be coming here again.

RcCPkHiYDcyjE9lEByS2Gw.text: I've eaten here a few times, usually on off nights (Tues or Thurs). Larger than usual mid-priced buffet.  Wide range of food choices.  Most of the food is good.  I've had no problems with service or price.

nfSKe_sZ9t7T6BQHieeSIA.text: For $21 buffet, it's really not too shabby at all.  The variety of food and quality is worthy of another trip.  We came on Friday night, which was steak & shrimp night.  From what I could gather, there is no more seafood night.  There were so much shrimp dishes- butterflied shrimp, shrimp over ice, popcorn shrimp, deep fried shrimp, shrimp linguini, and a few more shrimp dishes in sauces and broth.  I'm starting to sound like Bubba Gump, so you get my drift.  The variety of soup like clam chowder, sweet & spicy, menudo and even pho were all represented with a few more that I can't quite remember. The pork ribs, beef ribs, the variety of meats on the carving board will satiate any carnivore eating habits.   This is our first time and we were so impressed with the clean decor, excellent service that was provided throughout the floor.    Stay for the gelato, the bite-size dessert and if you could believe it, their decaf Folgers coffee was pretty darn good.  To each's own, this place was a pleasant surprise for a buffet.

79PO6UChYpeb7WNui6PUXw.text: I loved the Sunday menu! Loved the beef ribs, smoked salmon and the crawfish! I would recommend if you want an amazing lunch for $20.99 you go on a Sunday! My son is 3 and they didn't charge me for him!!!! Best experience ever! At station casinos they charge kids that are 2 years and up... and how much do you think a 2 year old eats NOT much!

4_5uEbBAoFodm4MLfGueOQ.text: It was not better than average, the food was very plentiful.  My favorite might be the elote.  Then the lemon sorbet and passion fruit sorbet.   Service is okay we pretty much just get our own stuff.  I head the only get didn't like asiabs.  Interesting.

vdDTmcKpGHxpP-coUjZLeQ.text: This buffet is ok... it's hit or miss... they do have a lot of food and stuff to choice from if you want lots of options but doesn't always taste good.. little over priced. Sunday is always Brunch and it is expensive but you can have champagne . Not much to say, it's a buffet!

_NyrgjKCuJ98EErreyz-yw.text: So they closed it down and remolded. Bringing the buffet up to par with most of the other casino properties.  It has a modern vibe, with muted earthen tones, browns, grays and golds.   They spread the buffet line from one end to the other without the middle salad bar. One cool feature I really enjoyed was the middle of the line a made to order crepe station with fresh fruit. My husband kicked it a notch and made himself a bowl of ice cream topped off with fresh bananas and banana foster sauce he then added to his crepe!   The salad end if facing the line is on the left, everything was fresh and the staff kept it that way while we where there. I even saw them change out the rolls with fresh ones! The opposite end is the desserts and the strawberry sorbet was way too good! Cleaned the palate.  There where several soups, it was seafood night so there where two gumbos. Sushi was decent for a buffet. I wasn't a fan of the warm crab legs, they seemed to be a bit over cooked, but I loved the fish taco. The filet was crispy and love the combination slaw with it. There is cold crab legs, oysters, muscles and clams as well as the peel and eat shrimp and crawfish!  It's been improved for sure. Clean, servers keeping up with refills and the line monitored for freshness! Friday night, seafood night. You gotta try it.

vs30yUnAHyN5HSZHJzhnwQ.text: Pretty good buffet and a good price of $14.99 for lunch on a weekday. We have not dine here for a while.   Our friendly cashier was Lisa.  The great customer service continued on with our Hostess, Maribel.  She was excellent!  Our Server Chon was good too.  Good variety of comfort food.  Pork ribs were tender and tasty.  I like the pre-made tacos and homemade menudo. Desserts were okay.

k6HtnGwsK6Qjs9njHDNjjw.text: Our first time back since they remodeled the buffet. Don't believe any poor reviews this place is fabulous. The food was great and their are so many choices. The facility is new fresh and sleek.  The shrimp was excellent as was the prime rib and New York strip steak. They had craw fish which every one loved. So many choices you can't go wrong.  The desert area was great. Ice cream ,sherbet and gelato. Cakes pies cookies and more. The staff is excellent but get their early because the line is long

photos.caption: Photo of Medley Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Medley Buffet Las Vegas

h-OAT_l3Q73ntewZD5zzPQ.text: Wow, this place is so much better that the buffets at Luxor and Excalibur... and it's literally 5 minutes away by car. It's not great but the selection is huge compared to the two buffets just mentioned.  The food is dry and bland like most low end buffets but they offer free champagne (I was there on a Sunday). Somehow that makes everything bland go down a bit easier.

WgvHw34xvI5nyfawaEvBUw.text: Food taste: 4/5 Food variety: 5/5 Food quality: 5/5 Service quality: 4/5 Price: 4/5 Restaurant cleanliness: 4/5  Overall, it's one of my top three buffets in LV.

UDjz0m4X_VO61ivrXyrPIA.text: first impression asked the lady who assigned  our table to move to another and said no, 2nd we were told we can't stay 2 hours limit and it say it in my receipt, less than an hour they telling us we can't get food because they changing to dinner, without warning us that lunch was over, then a lady come to us and told lunch is over you guys has to leave, and my husband had asked  the manager  at the front when we paid and they said yes you have enoght time to eat, we explain the lady that nobody told us the policies of the buffet and show the  receipt that said 2 hours limit,  and she said ok, our manager said you guys can stay another 20 minutes at dinner time, we decided to leave. sfABBwAteh-kD7RHO242_w.text: So I was visiting the family for the holidays.I use to frequent the buffet at the Orleans and it was a good deal. I took my 7 year old daughter who eats like a bird. I went up to pay full price is charged for children ,that's ridiculous! I ponied up $30 for 1 and a quarter of us ok i bit the bullet and paid. So i guess the buffet was recently renovated great, too bad the choices and quality of food went way down. They use to have babyback ribs now they put out the cheap country style that are all fat. I tried some roastbeef,baked chicken nothing was great.We got in right before lunch closed so thought we could get something edible on the dinner .We waited a short while got up served ourselves and came back to a cleared table . A worker came up with attitude and said i would have to pay the extra $17 a head to have what's on the dinner menu. Unbelievable these greedy bastards no way that's worth $32 .They made it seem like I was a criminal stealing food,can't believe they kick people out .fuck this place now!

NVQ_7L39TWgsq5DUf8ksjA.text: Decent prime rib buffet for the price. Food quality is better than some of the other buffets in this price range. The place was very busy around 8 pm on a weeknight. Oddly, I really liked the sushi - shrimp tempura and various CA rolls. And the prime rib was good too. Southern food was good - collard greens, black-eye peas, etc. Salad bar wasn't the best - iceburg lettuce mix and not many toppers. Large variety of desserts but none were great.    Server was great - very attentive and friendly.  My only complaint is that the hosts took a long time to seat people and did not prioritize those in the handicap line. And they were not super friendly.

8pspXRi-pup_3af2UXQvYg.text: I sincerely hope some manager of Orleans Casino or Boyd Gambling reads reviews cause they need to. I have been going to Orleans Casino for almost as long as it has existed. Great hotel, great pool, great everything despite it being off the strip. Best has been the buffet. It's was inexpensive and good. The locals loved it. Now with a new name and new look called Medley Buffet, it's the same food but much more expensive. Not a good idea. And if management reads this, your American flag flying above the entrance is totally torn up. Replace it please

jFfwz38WlTwTtA6u9e5e9w.text: First off...I'm just going to say this buffet have a pretty great dessert section for a "off the strip" property. So definitely save room for dessert. They got endless flavors of gelato, different kinds of cakes and pastries (some are sugar free as well).  Second...they have a good variety of food items available with a small salad bar, Mexican, Italian, Chinese, and a BBQ station. I'm a simple kind of girl when it comes to buffets. I really don't care for the seafood and all that "fancy smancy" stuff. Just give me the basics of  spaghetti and meatballs, eggrolls, enchiladas, dumplings, BBQ meats and sausages etc etc...you get the idea. For $8.99 per person on a weekday lunch...you can't beat that.

8d_EC0TEWuG1BzAyjrd05w.text: For an off the strip buffet that only does breakfast & lunch I'd say it's good value for the money. The offerings are certainly less diverse than at other buffets in town, but what do you expect for $12. The staff was friendly and my water glass stayed mostly full. What higher praise could be given.

7jC5wv00HA1RH2XhzwYHGw.text: New remodel but same type of food.  Overpriced breakfast (11.99, 9.99 with card).  Food was cold.  Cold eggs, cold gravy, cold ham.  Only good item was the bread pudding.  Go around the corner to Palms or even The Orleans sister property (Gold Coast) for better food or pricing.

pK6spd7klzTb-ykX3weIsA.text: Boy do you get your money's worth here. Great pricing and service gets you seated quickly. And the seafood buffet rivals those on the strip but at half the cost. A great hidden gem in Las Vegas.

MOFXvOsake1zstFzkcQmeg.text: Located at the Orleans Hotel & Casino in Las Vegas... 15 minutes til closing time and the food was STILL the bomb!!! My friend didn't agree, but I don't care... I'm sure there's better buffet's in Vegas. But they're AREN'T better buffet's in Illinois... So with that, I'm giving these guys 4 stars... The food was fresh even though they were closing... The food tasted great even though they didn't have a great selection... The Chinese was better than anything you get at home. The Italian pasta??? Same thing... A selection of ribs from different regions. And all were good... Round that out with all you can eat Prime Rib??? And I'm happy... The only downside was??? Where was the Cajun fair????? They had crawfish. And my buddy told me they had Gumbo... But I expected Louisiana southern cuisine. And it wasn't there... Oh, did I mention the fried chicken???

s3r6JvFJhOgN5jQC-9IfEg.text: Came here at 9am for the breakfast buffet on a Monday morning. The line looked long but it moved very fast.  The buffet has all the breakfast basics: eggs, bacon, sausage, etc. The price was fair at $8.99, but you get a discount depending on level of players card.  Highlights:  1) The Omelet guy- he was making five at a time. There was hardly any wait time. In addition, the ingredients are laid out like a Mongolian BBQ station. I liked being able to choose how meaty I wanted my omelet. I piled up bacon, sausage, mushrooms, spinach, and had him top it with jack cheese.   2) One of the trays had spam. Being Asian, this was a plus for me since I had it with fried rice.  Minus one star because the server took a while for the drinks and rarely checked on us. Other than that, it was a great value for the price.

R6i7ggmE3MYZi4KiqUUxPA.text: There are better deals in other hotels/casino but this one is convenient and you can't ruin breakfast after all. Service is good, fruits are fresh and the breakfast buffet adequate.

yg8AdJhQAM2zpZSHjcd08Q.text: For myself I'm kinda a picky eater but French Market Buffet in Orleans Casino blew my expectations. Most of these cooks in each stations from Asian to Italian and Mexican makes Table Mountain and  Chuckchansi buffet very forgettable. Also their server was really efficient and nice refilling my drinks. Every stations was really good it wasn't bland, it had the right amount of sodium the only thing I didn't like was their seafood soup with tomatoe sauce and their "dirty rice" dish. They even have BBQ beef ribs along with prime roast beef you can't beat that for only under $20.00 for AYCE. The buffet is nothing fancy but they have decent foods and good service also their desert slections is awesome so be sure to leave room for that. If you're complaining about paying under $20.00 for decent AYCE buffet I suggest you shut up and go to McDonald's or Burger King for you cheapskates.

FDow960y6Pmf4-mQxPxgdA.text: No French food here but the Mexican food was great! Hubby went for a second serving of Menudo!

FflilcH5ozAodIgXqZ2z_A.text: We came here for dinner and breakfast this time. Both times were satisfying and everything tasted delicious. Dinner was $19.99 but you get $5 off if you're a member (players card). Breakfast was around  $9.00 per person. We really enjoyed it! It's nothing fancy but everything tasted great. We will definitely come back again! And the people that work in the hotel were all very polite.

rIWlHX39vdeu8CXL5r1HSw.text: Best selection of food ..bbq is amazing and a variety for every taste. Chocolate fountain too..would recccomend.

fCuu3uCjV9WcjpwTFun3FA.text: Really more of a 3.5, but I digress.  So, let's say your family gambles at The Orleans so much that they get dining comps from them all the time, right? Since that describes my family to a T, lately, we've been going here about once per month thanks to comps that allow us to eat here for basically free.   Is it the best buffet in town? Not quite, but it ranks pretty high up there among locals places at least. As a matter of fact, the Feast Buffets at the Stations are the only ones that give this joint a run for it's money.   There are numerous Creole, Cajun and other southern-style touches scattered throughout. Most notable is the fact that it's probably the only buffet in town that serves crayfish. And eight times out of ten, gumbo is included as one of the daily soup options. Everything else is pretty standard fare, but most of it is done fairly well. The chicken wings in particular are always tender, well-seasoned and tend to fall right off the bone.   One major gripe I have about this place is how certain things aren't seasoned up to par. The last time I came I tried to do some makeshift Hoppin' John with black eyed peas and smoked sausage and it just ended up tasting like a bland, soggy mess. Another one is that desserts tend to be pretty hit and miss. The ribs are also tough as nails but I've found that to be True of ribs at literally EVERY buffet so that's just a universal complaint right there.  They also have a "Mongolian" section which is probably the most useless section to have in a buffet ever. Other than that though, you do get your money's worth here. Especially if you're able to eat her for essentially free. *Wink Wink*  The Final Verdict  Pros: Generous comp provided by The Orleans. One of the better locals casino buffets. Wide variety of cajun and creole delicacies available. Diverse selection of seafood as well.  Usually friendly service. Probably one of the fastest moving lines for a buffet I've ever seen.  Cons: Occasionally a little deficient in the seasoning department. Sometimes great desserts, sometimes not.  Decor in dire need of updating.  Huh?: Why is there a Mongolian section? Like, for real?  Suggestions: Replace that Mongolian section with either 1. A crepe making station or 2. A full-fledged Cajun/Creole/Soul Food section. Also, beignets in the dessert section! That way the theme comes full circle!  Return factor: 10/10. We're probably going to get another comp in the mail anyway.

JLLp82xxht3PgPZAS5iPDQ.text: This buffet is currently being remodeled. A temporary buffet is open 8am-2pm. The food is banquet style. Not hot or fresh. Beef ribs cold and dry. Waited 30 minutes for an omelet on wedesday. Not much selection. Very unorganized. Not happy at all.

_aLdhDq-X-UvbJKCP4gTRw.text: Food is decent enough, not worth the price but. will try other places before i hit this one again

6nsAgqnMabD-1_MHT-Yr5Q.text: The very definition of "A-ok." You get what you pay for at this buffet. But even then, it's still miles ahead of what you'd find at Circus Circus or something. For $12 at lunch time, you can't go wrong with cafeteria-style enchiladas and pasta, and while it isn't as luxurious as Bellagio Buffet or quirky like Wicked Spoon, it gets the job done.

photos.caption: Photo of Medley Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp (of which I had already eaten a few), mashed potatoes and gravy, and country fried steak.
Photo of Medley Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baked pasta, cheese enchilada, fried rice, chicken potstickers, fried chicken wing, and pepperoni pizza.

LXk_eyxyAEKF0HuT9CDp8A.text: Very good selection, and good tasting. Healthy choices too at almost every station. My daughter says to avoid the canolis. The pizza was actually very good. Be sure to watch their close times (lunch ends at 3), but better value for lunch over dinner.

iV3BBo8ieMI6ISxYsh3NJw.text: How do I even start?   Line was lonng, considering it was Labor Day and they had wrestlers in town.  Here, some workers just looked Unhappy with their job. It was packed and it was noticeable on their face at their frustration, especially with some cooks in the back. When a customer tried to make small talk and ask about the food the cook just gave him a nasty glare and shrugged. I don't expect the cooks to be all jolly, but it just felt since they aren't acknowledging guests then how can I expect them to make tasty quality food if they don't give a f$!k?! Plus, our waiter needed an attitude adjustment. I asked for sprite and she rolled her eyes.   Honestly, I only enjoyed the spring rolls and salad bar. I took a leap of faith with the passionfruit "gelato" (It looks like the gelato melts and they just refreeze it).   I was disappointed in the fried rice *sad face* and their sub sandwhich. The bread tasted rubbery and very dry while the fried rice was REALLY PLAIN. I felt like whoever prepared the fried rice did NOT know what they were doing. Now I understand why it was barely touched.   If I were to come back I would visit the BBQ spot. The guy on that side seemed very attentive and the food looked DELISH.   But I will returning when I have an appetite for that side.

Xeah-CnZfKrgs_9N-bzt7g.text: 2.5 is a more appropriate rating.  We haven't visited this buffet in a number of years due to past quality/turnover issues, but we decided to give another try after I won two free buffets.  Most of the buffet employees were dressed in Halloween garb and they seemed to be in a particularly cheery mood.  Also, the buffet was very busy which no doubt had a positive impact on turnover.  I had my usual huevos rancheros, fruit and OJ.  The quality and variety of the food was a notch above those at both the South Point, Sunset Staion, Aliante and Gold Coast on this trip.

kUzmbacMXOHfYx1X6eTBdw.text: The Orleans buffet it just average if you ask me. Of course its above any other buffets you have anyways else (thats not on the Vegas Strip). But to me its like your hometown/JJ North/ Chinese Buffet that offers maybe better seafood of course.  Well, I've come here for breakfast and dinner and let me tell you that right now, I give them a 3. Of course I am comparing it to the Mandalay Bay, Bellagio and Wynn buffet. When you have those, you cannot compare these buffets. Of course, you pay for what you get and comparing a 14 dollar buffet to a near 40 dollar buffet, you will get quality and choices. Service is alright, food could be a little better of course. Crab legs, reminiscent of those you can find at Todai's.  But yes, if you looking to not paying too much, or if your looking to not wait in long lines, or if you are looking to get away from the strip, then come on down to the French Market Buffet at The Orleans.

4b0wNecjb8jngGnuiF-Ecw.text: The Orleans is always a place I like to frequent when I am in Vegas.  For some reason, I find their buffet to be a good value, and call me crazy, but they make a crazy-good tuna salad!! Yes, of all those options (including crawfish-not for me), I return again and again for some of that tuna!  Not the biggest or brightest buffet, but I am still a fan and will return each and every time.

96W_Vz8h3rKHGm4VimucCw.text: I was in vegas for Viva and we stayed at the Orleans. I went to this buffet on Easter for brunch  I must say the food was delish the fruit was fresh and the pastries were divine for a buffet it was good

XA5WMBbBv3jwULrm8lDIdg.text: I love this buffet for one reason - all you can eat crab legs for less than $20 on Friday nights!  If you get the players card you can save $1/person.  Most of the other food on the buffet is mediocre - but if you love crab legs as much as I do you don't have any problem!  Great price!

6_8MyBEqmpWc5QqOZTdGDg.text: Just awful.   We've been eating here for years and it just keeps getting worse and worse.  Nothing new, nothing different, just poorer and poorer quality food.  From the beef that can't be chewed, to the ham with no flavor, to the dried-out turkey and the watery so-called gelato.....everything is barely even edible these days.   Had a great breakfast/brunch at the Sunset Station in Henderson and we're going to start staying there in the future as the food prices are reasonable and the quality is much much better.  Too bad, because Orleans used to have one of the better buffets.

KSf5B3eqBmLDqm-9FL0AIQ.text: So we promised the kids we'd  have a  buffet on this past trip to Vegas.  Just didn't want to break the bank to do it.  French Market Buffet was perfect for this situation.  Can't beat the $15.99 per person price for Champagne Sunday Brunch.  We were so happy that we could have peel and eat shrimp, crab legs and crawfish at this price.  The quality of the food is good, not great.  Definitely not the same quality that you'd find at a five star on the strip hotel, but if you are looking for good variety at a reasonable price, this is the place.  There was a carving station, great BBQ options, Mexican selections, Chinese Food , salad bar and standard breakfast fare.  The best part by far was the desserts.  Got our money's worth there alone....there was a huge selection of french pasteries, gelato, cakes, cobblers and other goodies.  If I was looking for top quality food/impressive selections, not sure this is the buffet I'd choose, but especially if you have kids, this is a wonderful option.

dZR-JNqzmmylkNShIOb_cQ.text: The food was disgusting and the service is one the worst. We went during lunch time and it was like 7.99 but man, even with the cheap price comes with cheap ass food. The only good thing was the french fries and the soda -.-

fSs8ttCtFmMzTjE2Hd3QHg.text: Came here for breakfast. It ha decent variety of food and snacks. One negative is that it open at 8am and those of us on business trip need to eat earlier.

i_0hyPHl1n-KO_sd-oVKRQ.text: went here for Sunday brunch. For about $15 per person quality should b better. The pork ribs tasted like it was re-heats. Osso bucco was tender but sauce it up so it looks appetizing  not like it was  the heat lamp all day, the sad thing was we were here when it just opened. Crawfish and ham were good, desserts looked good but I was lo carbing it. I'm not a salad person but the grilled veges, cheese platter at sPalad bar was nice. Maybe the m resort spoiled me, but was not impressed With the orleans buffet .

RTqtlKUe_IeAeiLQz8mPkg.text: If I could give the FMB 3.5 stars I would. However, because I think when it comes to buffets they are about as good as you can get in  regards to bang for your buck. The French Market Buffet along with the Garden Buffet at South Point are my two go to buffets for the price, especially when eating with the family. I will clarify though, we RARELY eat the buffet because it is not always worth it when you aren't meat eaters. That being said - the French Market provides more veggie options than many other higher priced buffets at similar casinos, and they have a lot more seasonal fresh fruit than some strip buffets.  We happened to go for dinner on Saturday after seeing a movie. It was about  6pm, there was no line, and we paid about $30 (including tip) which is about the same as we'd pay at another restaurant. I usually stick to Chinese and Mexican with the addition of fruit and veggies, and this night was no different. Everything seemed pretty fresh,  except for some roasted potatoes. The fruit (mostly melons) was fresh and juicy. As always the desserts were good.I think the secret to buffets is as Anton mentions - eat in courses. That is definitely the way.  What you really must know about this buffet, and any of the non-strip buffets is that the food is not the best you'd find, but not bad at all. Don't expect the best Vegas chef's but you will get a meal here that rivals the restaurants in this and other local casinos.  On this particular occasion our service sucked, but that really was the worst we'd ever had at the this buffet. Since we don't eat the buffets often, it probably won't be until we have family in town to go back, but they are always satisfied, and so are we.

cEqtNmwNpOrHtaLCK8mv0g.text: This is my favorite buffet in Vegas.  Cheap, No Lines and all you can eat Crawfish.  Has almost the same selection of food as the Rio Buffet and you'll never find a line here.  The desserts are delicious too, plenty of southern favorites.  But yeah I cant say enough about the all you can eat crawfish.  You pile a plate full of crayfish, clean them, eat them, and go back for more.  So remember this place if your in Vegas and its lunch time and you dont want to wait in a long line to eat.  Oh yeah did I say they had crayfish?

yB4-TKlG7JS71KYn61rA5g.text: Good food, great atmosphere for a good price.  Drawbacks: Very crowded, which is actually a good sign.  We ate here for lunch 3/5 days one week b/c that is where we received tickets from training.  Worth the price. Good presentation.  Good food.  The only negative food experience was the roast beef was a bit bloody for me, but I just didn't eat it.

mTRCJgGvYjoS8Bc6RcKjlw.text: Been going here for 15 Yrs Plus. Best Food, Quality Selection, Great Fresh Flavors, Many Stations to choose from, and very reasonably priced. Forget about the big Casino Over Priced Crap. Great Deal Right Here.

Oh3oHdYVzL28naMTmh3cTQ.text: Slightly better than average.  Pros: Even though the line can get long, they always manage to keep it movin'. Reasonable price. It's in The Orleans(which is the casino I go to the most after The Palms). Decent variety.  Cons: A lot of the food is pretty bland so every time I go here I end up getting the same things over and over again... The ~Mongolian section is random and weird(how about having an Indian, Caribbean or Mediterranean section instead?) Not enough Cajun/Creole/Soul Food, disappointing for a place which is always tooting it's "VIVA NEW ORLEANS" horn.  This is probably the buffet I've been to the most out of all the Vegas buffet, and it does it's job. It definitely hits the spot, but it's sorely lacking in many areas unfortunately.

7QjicJ5BqzFJ4yiMOe4N6w.text: This Review is for the Friday Seafood Buffet. $ 18.00 per person  Peel and Eat Shrimp, Hot and Cold Crab Legs, Tuna in Dill Sauce, Fried Shrimp Patties, Craw-fish, Clams, Oysters on the half shell, Salmon on a wooden plank, and several additional seafood selections. Many traditional Buffet items were also to be found.  Average quality seafood with poor to average preparation. Some items were over fried and tough - other fried items were barely cooked enough. Crab-legs were small - ensuring lots of work. A seafood stew was mainly mushrooms. The Clam Chowder soup was very thick with only a promise of clams. The Seafood Buffet was Pricey for the quality of the food. Very good service by the wait staff.   I would suggest this buffet for Breakfast or Lunch - or even better with a Comp or Coupon.  If you're playing tables always ask the Pit Boss for a comp - they will rarely(if ever) volunteer one. On Slots ask the Players Club what it takes - Before you spend your money here.

zGhhQIdD5HkGatFwgbGewg.text: 3.5 Been here a ton of times...with tax it's only $7.45 or something like that for the breakfast..show up near the end of it and you get to eat all the lunch stuff as it comes out.  It's not the best buffet but when it comes to getting your moneys worth it might be! I prefer this place over the Caesars dinner actually....the best deal on the strip is probably the $35 unlimited buffet for 24 hours offering 7 different casinos...PH. Cesars, Imperial, Paris, Harrahs, Rio and a couple others...but if are in the hole from gambling bad, the buffet at Orleans is a good way to feel like you won some of it back.

CN7CbMnU8Bi_AepeQhDYlw.text: On a whim, I ended up spending Easter in Vegas.  In search of an Easter-worthy buffet, we ended up at French Market Buffet in the Orleans.  I anticipated the worst, knowing that buffets can often be filled with steamed scrambled eggs and microwaved ham.  Much to my pleasant surprise (a la the Easter Bunny bringing me a basketball hoop when I was 12 years old), the food was absolutely delicious.  The buffet has food stations for different types of food, and they all have cooks behind them doing it up right.  The food was average priced, but so much better than any of the others I've had in Vegas (even the ones I did like).  Although there was a huge line, it went by surprisingly quickly because they had plenty of tables to seat everyone.  I took a chance on them for Easter, and I will absolutely be back on my next trip out.

bm-9ncAuQvKM-qo0_vPGug.text: this is a cheaper version of bellagio, if you ask me.  The food is good, and though their dessert selection is average, it definitely exceeds my expectations based on their price.  Though i dont like it, my parents always get plates and plates of craw fish...no thanks.  i like the variety and especially the price.  were were lucky enough to grab a bunch of $5 coupons and ended up paying $8 for the meal per person....but yeah..if youre on a budget, and want to eat at a buffet, skip the rio because this is the place to go.  one of my favs!

QAi9cEnkt7XEbpmnjn7D7Q.text: I just went to this buffet this last weekend and boy was it worth it! The buffet was around $15 per person for dinner which wasn't too bad compared to all the other buffets esp. on the strip. They served all kinds of food like: italian, mexican, u.s.a., mongolian, chinese, bbq and delicious desserts. I was pleased with the variety of food and service was great. It was so much better than the Bellagio buffet. I totally recommend this place!

FdpbBJUE2dTcZTOf5utZkw.text: Good food, friendly staff don't see something you like? Ask!!, they"ll make it for you! Or at lest they did for me.  Didn't really do the all to you can eat just ate once and it's great for it's price.  Came here 2 weekends in a row for the Viva rockabilly fest. Wasn't disappointing with the food ever. Really cheap and worth for what you get.

re5J1G-nB93XqzYiTTwmjw.text: Super mediocre. This place was maybe 2 steps above Hometown Buffett.  But for 8 dollars, you get what you pay for.    Me thinks this will only be good for people who are crawfish fanatics.  Something about sucking a crawfishes ass I can't get with.    Everything was so bland and basic. The only thing I liked was the pizza because it was fresh out the oven.  The shrimp had that old smell to it. The fried rice was bland and dry.  I hear that their breakfast and dinner is delicious. But lunch was not.  They have a gelato bar. I think this is the direction dessert is going in Vegas buffets and i dig it.

Ga8c_sH-epn8i-LJ6zvo3A.text: my favorite buffet in  the city. i use to go all the time on saturday night when it was steak and shrimp scampi night. make sure you get the players card. it cost around 17. well worth it the food is amazing and the selection is just great.

K7IWruTkLJW67JDYuUsk5Q.text: Came here during Mother's day.  Cost was about $19-20.  They served Mexican, Chinese, sushi, dessert (cake and ice cream), breakfast, salad/veggies, and seafood.  Drinks served were soda, coffee, and champagne.  Overall, the food was just okay.

egtESBch9tW4C7S1V5w-mg.text: This is my favorite cheap buffet in Vegas! It's a really good deal to eat here and good food. There is a wide selection of food. The line can get long but not long as it does on The Strip or at the Rio. I think the food here is much better than at the Rio buffet. Can't wait to eat here again!

afXRWNnwtTh7Ich3jCrbPA.text: i'm not a buffet person....and am very snobby about what i eat.  so with that said, i wasn't really able to find much that i would actually eat here.    although i'm glad the french market buffet's conquistadors invaded a crawfish colony and massacred all its inhabitants, and probably kept some alive for breeding purposes to feed us gluttonous vegas patrons...because all you can eat crawfish made me feel like i ate my money's worth.

iSYO_3hcFBYzVa7W9zPuYA.text: Have been in Vegas for 5 days and the Orleans is right down the road.  We've eaten at the buffet 3 times and have enjoyed the lunch and dinner.  The staff is always checking for drinks and keeping the table clean. Ate 90% salad bar and loved the selections. Found the smoked ribs and that became our desert. Really tasty. Ate at 2 of there other properties and would give the Gold Coast a three star and the Main Street a two star.

8JyWpq4exBBHzgGo4Yq6uQ.text: They have improved over the years.  They are actually  one of my favorite places now.  The price is right and the food is good.  Sometimes the lines are super long so dont go when they initially open.

VNNXzjbPehmJZIaiK6lAlw.text: AWESOME! Affordable, delicious, tons to choose from. Ate here multiple times and always had a good meal. Breakfast is my fave and if you go around 10am, they switch to lunch about 10:30/45 so you can get those choices too!  Don't try taking a piece of fruit with you to go though. They'll stop you! :-P

aU9SL5KDENpbwJO9JzZNhg.text: I was in Vegas for 4 days and ate here twice. First time was for breakfast, a decent selection of stuff to choose from; you have fruit, waffles, pancakes, bacon, sausage (normal breakfast foods). Nothing to spectacular on that end considering the biscuits and gravy they had was below my expectations (gravy lacked flavor almost as if they were afraid to make that traditional peppery white gravy you crave with biscuits and gravy), drink service was also a little slow but it was to be expected for a Saturday. But then you get to the desserts which were available during breakfast; not only did they have donuts but they also had cake and pie. I'm a sweets fanatic but have a pretty severe nut allergy and the lady working there (I can't remember her name but super sweet and a little older lady with brown hair in a bun) was very understanding of that and gave me a full list of everything with nuts, cooked near nuts, and may possibly be contaminated with nuts. I was pretty happy with that since I got a fresh slice of the most delicious peach caramel cake I've ever eaten and convinced me to give the buffet another go but at lunch to see if it was better than breakfast. Second time was for lunch and lets say I was left feeling a little disappointed. The cooks  behind the buffet prepping food didn't seem to know much about the foods and had to go track down other chefs to ask if anything contained nuts or was cooked in peanut oil; while nothing was prepared in peanut oil other foods "could have nuts". Disappointing since they couldn't name anything that had nuts at all and I had to guess at what would or wouldn't be safe to try and eat. The lunch options were not very impressive either, the fried fish was kind of "meh" the pasta at the American station was very oily/greasy almost as if they had only boiled the noodles and melted butter onto them. Italian food left A LOT to be desired, the pizza wasn't very great but even bad pizza is good pizza, but there were not many pasta options. Plain noodles and only meat or marina sauce, a few options for various different pastas (none of which really stood out) and one sad looking vegetable lasagna. Drinks this time were quicker to arrive and be refilled. And then we get to desserts, whoever makes these do a superb job and they ladies who work in that area (the one from Saturday was there again) are the nicest workers I have ever met. They saved what would have been a disappointing lunch with the offering of a delicious blueberry cheesecake that I had two pieces of.  Overall: very average quality food offerings, except desserts those are superb; but the price is pretty decent compared to the other buffets.

g7ERxAhHPYKc6Y9NO8CZEQ.text: The buffet is located at the Orleans hotel.  We came here for Sunday brunch which was about $14 per person.  They charge adult prices for any kid 8 years or older even though they don't eat like adults.  They separate their food by regions, American, Asian, Mexican and Italian.  They also has a separate section for desserts. This was typical buffet food, the ribs were my favorite.  The omelet station is a little different.  The ingredients for your omelet are in a salad bar and you grab what you want and place it in a bowl.  You then give the bowl to the cook who then makes your omelet.  Overall, food was decent for the price you pay.

IJZgGuOIRbVItgTmSfQ94Q.text: Good food good prices for the family. Service is really great food is fresh. Don't pass up the ice cream bar.

sXjM6k3usUqZnoYu6LkIhw.text: The food was passable, but nothing extraordinary.  The salad bar is small, the selections at the other themed areas are strange... like why are there BBQ ribs on the Asian section when there are already 2 different kinds of ribs at the BBQ section, and look over here at the USA section... more ribs.  Ilike ribs well enough, but I was almost afraid to go to the Italian section for fear of seeing BBQ Rib Pizza.  The dessert bar is okay.  None of the pastries were phenomenal, the cheesecake was heavy and not at all creamy, and the blueberry topping on it had the consistency of drywall spackle.  Our drink-getter was pretty awesome, though.  She did a great job.  The best thing I can say about this buffet is that the lines are short and it's better than the buffet at a lot of the hotels on the strip, expecially those at the castle and pyramid... names omitted to keep from hurting King Arthur's and Pharaoh's feelings.

7bwqYqalfCBSvizlbT7Jfw.text: I don't honestly see what all the hype is about this place. I went after seeing numerous reviews in the past few weeks about how great this place is, how great the food is, how excellent the service is...   The best part of the buffet... new york strip steak, onion rings and some beef lasagna.   Other than that the food was mediocre at best, the desserts were kinda junky tasting and dry, and the service was very slow/rude. Our server was quite ornery and took almost 10 minutes to get steak knives for us after being asked. Never showed up with A1 sauce either. (She told us after the 10 mins and bringing back 1 knife... not 2...that she couldn't find any steak sauce.)   The guy who was supposed to be carving the chicken/prime rib at the station wandered off for over 5 minutes, and there was quite a few people standing there waiting for service behind me... I was about ready to cut the bloody meat myself for everyone else who was waiting.  So while the three foods I listed earlier were worth 5 stars (The new york steak is only on thursday) the rest of the service and food was only worth 1 or less.   Tragic...

St2IJ9vZCAvcZPW5IWS5BA.text: Best Price in Las Vegas for lunch Buffet.  I love eating at an all you can eat buffet.  I think this place is very good. I just come here to eat and save some money on my trip to vegas.  They have a wide variety of food to choose from.  They even have mongolian grill.  Is just 1.5 miles off the strip.

0rDQF9qP-6CIpEzxgL0avw.text: went there for dinner because I like to try different buffet. food is really not good. just OK. barely edible. food really deserve 2 stars but they made it up with the ice cream selection. I really like the peanut butter flavor and other flavor. I forgot what. this buffet price is really cheap so just come in to eat a few items and the ice cream will be worth it.

_icdb9_vrnPej_8tx3c7jA.text: This place is AWESOME! The price is right and the quality and variety of food here is great.  They have different stations with different types of food from Italian, Asian, American, to Mexican.  Their desserts are decent.  There was this special where you pay $22 for all day buffet privileges.  I would have done that if I weren't already all burnt out on buffets during my trip to Vegas.  It's a smokin' deal!  If you're staying at the Orleans, take advantage of this hidden gem in your hotel.  It blew away the other buffet I went to on the strip.

2dL8k0sIY-pQ10G1wEEFiw.text: After a canceled flight, I wound up spending my airline meal vouchers here for dinner and a breakfast. The prices for dinner change daily, depending on the night's theme cuisine. My night was BBQ and it cost about $15.  Like a lot of sub $20 buffets, the food offerings here need to be attacked with a strategy in mind. I have my own system for deciding what to pick, but the most important buffet rule is to immediately stop eating anything that isn't GOOD. There's a lot of crap at this buffet and a lot of stuff that's so-so, but there's some real good stuff to be eaten, as long as you're not busy chowing down on dried-out, fake, instant, imitation, bland funk.  I found the roasted chicken to be excellent, like actually worthy of being on a plate being served in a regular restaurant. The crawdads were unique and it was my first time trying them. I didn't care for the taste, but I don't have anything to compare them to, so I switched over to the peel and eat shrimp. The salad bar was decent enough. The bread pudding was amazingly good. The service sucked, as my water was never refilled, I had to scrounge for a second napkin, and at one point my table was totally cleared while I was up getting more food.  Breakfast was about $8. The OJ was fake and tasted funny. The coffee was not bad, but not good. Skip scrambled eggs as they're fake too. Instead, get your eggs off the top off the Benedict offerings. You don't want to eat the whole Benedict, just the egg, as the rest is gross. I have a weakness for cheap-o breakfast sausage with syrup on top and I wasn't disappointed. Don't bother hoping for a nice pastry to pair with your last cup of coffee because they're all pretty horrible.  Overall, FMB is worth the price it seems, but don't think you're going to get the variety of a full buffet, as most of the food is no good. Be picky and search out the few gems to be found, then jump in with both feet.

xLT9ITOESAgbserqA2h8JA.text: This place is an awesome value for the money. It was cheap to begin with, but they recently lowered prices and you still get a discount with a Coast Card, even if you have no points on your card. A lot of people seem to just go for the crawfish, which were OK, but nothing special since they appear to have just been boiled in water. I'm used to them being boiled in seasoning so I don't really like them plain. However, there is so much more to eat than the crawfish. The salad bar is nothing special, but they had watermelon. I think they are just coming into season since I didn't see them at too many other buffets. There were lines for the watermelon here. I was lucky to grab some just as they were restocking.  My friends reported the BBQ station was very good, but I mostly skipped it since we had Brazilian BBQ the night before and I wasn't really in the mood for more meat. I ended up eating a lot from the Cajun station and the USA station. The Asian station had stuff for Mongolian BBQ, but I didn't see too many people take advantage of it. I should have since I love Mongolian BBQ, but I really couldn't take too much grease that day. The Mexican station had stuff for DIY tacos, but I was too lazy. The pasta station was probably the most disappointing. The pizza was OK, but the other items were either horribly mislabeled or complete failures. It could have been the former since they did have Salisbury steaks in the USA section labeled as terriyaki chicken.  The dessert section is a big surprise. Not only did they have some pretty good cakes and rolls, they also had a good gelato selection. Overall, I really enjoyed this buffet. I honestly could have paid twice as much and still be fairly satisfied. They also have beer and wine specials ($6 bottle of wine) for those who are interested. The only negative was our server seemed kind of upset the whole time, although she did occasionally refill our drinks and take our plates.

G3cP3SddbK5N_DGF8neSFg.text: Since I stayed at The Orleans last weekend, I thought I would give this place a try. This is definitely one of the better casino buffets I've eaten at in Vegas, if not the best (I have to admit, the only buffets I've tried on the strip were at Excalibur's which was pretty bad and The Stardust which was terrible, the worst buffet I've ever had anywhere, even though that's a moot point now since it's no longer there. I also tried the much-hyped Carnival Buffet at The Rio a few years ago and thought for the money it was a rip-off).  The surroundings were nicer than average for a buffet and they had a tremendous variety of food. They have a deal for $21.00 in which you can eat breakfast, lunch, and dinner there. I only had lunch there once ($8.00), but because of the huge variety of items, I'm sure it would be no problem to eat all three meals there and never have a single item twice if you didn't want to.   The quality of the food was above average for a buffet. There were a few things I tried I did not like, but there was more I liked than disliked. The beef back ribs, in fact, were by far the best I've had at any buffet and they had a braised oxtail stew which was very good, not as good as top quality homemade, but very good nevertheless, probably the single best item I've ever had at a buffet. The mashed potatoes, usually just fair or mediocre at most buffets, were also first rate.  The lines moved quickly and the service was good, although I couldn't understand why you couldn't just get your own water and napkins instead of having to get the attention of a server to do it for you. Also, there didn't seem to be any rhyme or reason to the order or location of the various food stations, i.e. the ribs were two or three stations from the American food station whereas it seems more logical they should have been next to each other. That's a minor thing, though.  In terms of overall value for what you get this place is an easy four stars, although I could not quite bring myself to give it five due to the items I did not care for and most of the stuff just being decent. If I ever go to The Orleans again, though, which is quite likely, I will definitely go to this place again.

vyxnY070jrYPBwXqMFD9sA.text: THIS BUFFET was a total waste of $20 it included DRY MEAT, sloppy shrimp scampi, most of the food was uneatable !!!!! I got full off eating vegetable spring rolls and salad because it was the only thing I could stomach. Not to mention I didn't come on Seafood night and I was craving crab kings. The ice cream was good and the Fruit was fresh but I would Never Ever eat @ THE FRENCH MARKET BUFFET AGAIN. People must be writing fake reviews to gives this dump 4 or 5 stars!

3vQBStIs_aLPcw9kgxXJJA.text: Decent, clean and fair qaulity! Large variety of options.  Not like most buffets were they place more sides then main staple items.

fKpqdbA6p-Nt-WeAXc6XVA.text: Everything we ate was either over-salted or bland.  Enchiladas, eggplant Parmesan, Chinese spicy shrimp, steamed pollack, stuffing, all way too salty. Crawfish, egg drop soup, hot and sour soup, egg rolls all bland, no flavor at all. Everything else didn't really look appetizing. The ribs were tough to eat. The Chinese ribs, too dry. Chicken gumbo was ok. They had Cajun style offerings like fried catfish and hush puppies, but it looked like it had been sitting there for too long, so I avoided it. The only thing that tasted great was their prime rib and mashed potatoes. Dessert selection was nice. They had gelato and sorbet as well as soft serve. Lots of cakes and pies, but didn't try. They have a chocolate fountain where you can dip fruit and cream puff in. Kids loved that part. Our meal was a decent value only for the prime rib. Our waiter Manny did a great job at taking care of us.

lOjbIJlR6wR3tHkT5a3fGg.text: Haven't been to this buffet for many years because while it was of my favorites it went downhill a bit.  Returned on the last trip and not only was the whole place renovated but the staff was wonderful and accommodating, especially the host, but the food was fabulous!  Would def return again

-MJ855GA2u__vvblFfMv1w.text: No, it's not high class buffet like Caesar or Wicked Spoon. But then again, you're comparing $45 to $15. Lines are never to long for the buffet, even during prime dinner time. Most days, there are prime rib that is decent. Succulent meat and taste is there. I also like eating their shrimp with cocktail sauce here. Unlike some other buffets in Vegas, the cocktail shrimp here taste fresh and have that good seafood taste. I do enjoy the simpler American side dishes here. Mac and cheese, baked beans, mashed potatoes, etc. Dessert is nice as well. They have a gelatin bar that they serve you and cheesecake is creamy with a good crust.   Don't bother with the Chinese food. Maybe I'm super critical because I'm Chinese, but that hot and sour soup is a joke -  taste nothing like it. Egg rolls inside is too soggy.  I give this 3 stars because for $15 and the lack of waiting in line, it's hard to beat in Vegas. As long as you enter knowing full well what you paid, you'll have a good time.

B81WK9K2rw1l8_GxPiC-WQ.text: Disgusting food! Nice new remodeling though . Not worth eating here for the price . $14.99 for brunch per adult . Flies were on the cookies and desserts section . Stale bread. Just gross!

OQKlGNrdbkECC0ezSAa-OA.text: I have been here 10+ times. The restaurant is located inside the Orleans casino that is a smoking lounge.  Cheap buffet, average quality. Large selection. There is no item at this joint that makes me crave for. I came here just to load up on fiber and protein between business dealings.   Service is always good. Discounts for members of Boyd gaming.

BFQfIex7QFvImhxHsF815Q.text: For the price you pay, this buffet is a good deal.  :)  It's $12 for lunch, or $1 off with a club card, and you get a nice variety of food.  The best section for me is the Cajun section with the smoked ribs and the beef ribs and the gumbo, its all pretty good.  I also actually thought their sushi was pretty descent for a buffet, I have ate sushi at probably about 50 buffets and I thought it actually tasted pretty good, it was a bit dry, but it was still fairly fresh and tasted like sushi, the problem I have with most buffet sushi is it just does not taste like Sushi, not even at Asian Buffet restaurants.   The sweet and sour pork was surprisingly good, the sauce was separate which was nice so the food was not at all soggy.  :) The craw fish is very tasty and well-cooked, love craw fish those alone are 5stars, and they also have a chocolate fountain, for dinner at least (can't remember if it's there for lunch too)!  Overall, for the price, I think it's pretty damn good.  I have been to a lot of Vegas Buffets and I would rate this higher than many of the buffets on the strip that cost 5-10 dollars more.  The staff was friendly, the food was pretty fresh considering they were pretty dead, and I nothing was poor quality, even if not all the dishes are exceptional, they are at least decent.  God Bless ~Amy

UTfEYmnKyX6u8t2kBX_6UQ.text: One of the best value buffets in Vegas!  Not on the strip, so it's not so crowded, and I've eaten here twice without ever having to wait in line.  Good variety too - for lunch and dinner, they categorize the food: USA, Italian, Chinese, Mexican, Seafood, Mongolian, BBQ, and a huge dessert section in the middle.  A lot of the food is pretty decent, though I didn't think the ribs were that great. The shrimp cocktails were fresh, and I liked the Mexican and Seafood sections the most.  The dessert section also had no-sugar desserts!  Super cheap, we came here for lunch on a Friday and it was only $10/person, without any kind of membership or anything.  It's not the Bellagio or anything but French Market Buffet at the Orleans offers great value in terms of quality and variety!
