k4daAxUgSjeNlOb0ciUmEw.text: This is a typical casino buffet, a bit of a crap-shoot. Most of the food is pretty good, not spectacular. It's probably as good as you can make at home, but we do enjoy the variety.  In the past, we thought the desserts were particularly good here, but they weren't this time, which was very disappointing.   However, IT IS A GOOD VALUE and you get plenty of food choices. I would not discourage you from going here, just don't expect fine dining. It's a good dinner though. (or lunch)

ZKNXx849vzdfdfZ9BN6BAA.text: This buffet is always good  food is always fresh and hot even between change overs,  but the waitresses and waiters here are lazy sacks of shit at a buffet pretty much all you have to do is bus your tables an refill drinks and they can't do that i am a a huge tipper this is the only place i never tip

photos.caption: Photo of Medley Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast Buffet at the Orleans somewhat over priced 9.99

AfiQ-Ow-XiGhQOEMRKyUuA.text: Came to The Orleans strictly for the French Market Buffet! To my surprise the remodel was complete and now open as the Medley Buffet. The staff was amazing in accommodating our large party  and Miss Peggy was our waitress and she was awesome! The Buffet itself left a little to be desired but I still got my money's worth. It's going to run you about $12/ per person for  breakfast, $15 per person for lunch, and $20/ per person for dinner . What I remember starting from the left to the right: Salad  bar with traditional items and pasta salads, soup bar with about 3-4 options, southern type food like black eyed peas and greens, Asian American food, sushi bar , omelette bar with breakfast items, rotisserie chicken, ham, roast beef, then enchiladas and a nacho bar and a taco bar, with traditional Mexican soups. Lastly was the  Italian section with vegetarian lasagna, pasta bar, ceased salad with house made dressing, and three types of pizza . Finally we have reached the  dessert  section that was home to three types of freshly baked cookies , about 10 flavors of gelato , individual mini dessert and cakes . Fountain drinks are included in your price with free refills so don't be afraid to quench your thrust! Plan to spend an hour and a half 2 hours dining at a pace that ensures getting your money's worth. In case you need to drop and reload midsession the restrooms are located right outside of the venue across the casino.

v1cw26XlStyW3R4dS7zWzg.text: I ate here with my family for breakfast. It cost around $9 a person. Pretty cheap for a breakfast buffet. There wasn't that long of a wait. This was my first time here. They had pretty normal/expected breakfast foods like pancakes, waffles, eggs, bacon, hashbrowns, etc. The food was ok. Nothing great that stands out that makes me want to eat here again. We ate here because one of my relatives were staying at The Orleans so we just ate the breakfast buffet here.  The food is ok for the price. If you're in the area and looking for a decent priced breakfast buffet, try this place out.

GooxYb3IXkgea2G8CM0lTA.text: The buffet has plenty of choices and options of food to choose from. Me and my son come here almost every week. The waitress and waiters are very nice and helpful.

photos.caption: Photo of Medley Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. He is full and happy
Photo of Medley Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My son at buffet

BMw9KBfl1ssBnPE5kwLCoA.text: Yelps 365 Review Challenge 2014 - Los Angeles #65 - #365  Don't expect 5 star quality, it's more like 4 star quality with 2 star pricing. I'd honestly rate the Luxor and Excalibur buffets a 1 - 2 stars. The food here is not the greatest compared to the strip buffets but it gets the job done.   What i liked about the buffet was the prime rib, crab legs, cocktail shrimp, and the crawfish (New Orleans Style). They also had different sections of food, like;  -American -Italian -Seafood  -Mexican -BBQ -Cooking Stations -Dessert   I would come back to save some extra money if I'm ever in town to save some money from the strip buffets and restaurants. Anything to save a buck from the tourist trap areas.

eXJIyedizHS4kEJG7PDTDw.text: The food is mostly dry. I had one tamale and it was horrible I was only able to eat the meat. Some of their food is doughy as though it's not cooked all the way. Their pies are very dry. The ribs were not eatable, they were so dried out I couldn't even chew it. The best part is the ice cream swirl. I wished this place was better. Circus Circus has one of the best buffets. Also our waiter Tony, no personality. I don't like when someone is talking to you without looking at you instead they look over your head. What happened to friendly staff that smile?

0Mq_xSFEkCQn-pcO1HU_ng.text: Wow, what a treat. Yes not on the strip, but there lies the charm. After a dismal buffet at a pretentious  strip hotel, this buffet renewed my faith that there are still inexpensive finds in Vegas. I had the Sunday brunch buffet. It was a couple of bucks more than their normal breakfast, but the selections were phenomenal. Flat iron steaks cooked perfectly, pork onion gravy for the chicken fried steaks, gumbo, jumbalaya, ribs and more ribs. Crawfish! Every dish I tried felt the gave it special attention. Their gelato dessert area rivals the Rio. And for sunday brunch, there's a chocolate fountain and sparkling wine. Kudos Orleans! 4 stars to food, bumped to 5 for cost and service

8-B712-wQVjgSy92HFQd9g.text: Come on a Thursday to try their dinner buffet, they have a huge dessert island, all different kinds of ice cream, cakes and pies, the food is pretty basic, has Italian, which has pasta and pizza, chinese has spring roll, chow fun, fried rice, american has fried chicken, ham, pork spareribs, slider, mexican has tacos, enchiladas, seafood has fried cat fish, crawdad, fried tilapia, the mongolian section, you can cook your choice of food and vegetables on a hot iron griddle, and for the meat lovers, they have roast beef and smoke spareribs, and don't forget to get the shrimp cocktail from the salute bar too....service is on par, the place is huge, so it is pretty roomy, you won't feel it is too crowded....overall it is okay, nothing special, for the price, it is a lot better than the strip casino buffet..

VNLm68S1e6xSzehkmwkMlg.text: Has been eat in at the Orleans Casino French Market Buffet for quite some time now.  I can confidently say it is one of the most consistent buffet in Las Vegas. Their food selections r quite fresh n huge! With your typical basic Salad Bars, Mexican, Chinese, Italian, American, BBQ n Seafood and also an above average dessert section with Cakes, Pies, Gelatos, Soft Cones n some French Finger Pastries. I believe Wicked Spoon n Studio B is still the reigning chanp of dessert decadence! But Orlean's French Market Buffet is still one of the few most value honest deal buffet in Las Vegas! Your hard earn dollars will go along way by eat in here!

Photo of Medley Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pies n eclairs. Oh my!
Photo of Medley Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Give me all them finger lickin good ribs!

Q7-PT62iLfqr8h5BBXSG3g.text: I honestly gave it 2 stars because it's $21. So if your short on cash and want edible food this is your place. The warmest food we had was the tacos they made fresh and those were room temperature. Pork ribs were bloody and when I brought it to the cooks attention he told me that was smoke, yep cause now smoke runs out of meat, sure!!! The prime rib was cold and tough and this was the "new" piece of meat he was cutting. Manapua was bomb!!! Best thing about the buffet.

4grZF3bNTv_2Er-yjf4HAQ.text: What buffet closes at 8pm and Yelp lies about they're hours. My grandma is awake longer than this buffet. You know who's open until a decent hour, the Bacchanal Buffet.

fsFN_IiKkeuE-wSEO3Sz1w.text: If you've had bariatric surgery, STAY AWAY FROM THIS PLACE!! They do not honor your bariatric surgery card, which clearly states you've had bariatric surgery and it severely limits the amount of food you can eat. This is the FIRST and ONLY buffet in town that has refused to accept this card. Getting charged FULL ADULT BUFFET PRICE for eating 3/4's of one enchilada and 2 pieces of generic sushi?!?!? Gotta love the GREED that some of these places have. I WILL NEVER be back here and I advise other bariatric patients to do so as well. Oh, you've had surgery, why are you at a buffet?! Its my mother-in-laws birthday. The manager here wouldn't even let me sit with my family without being charged FULL PRICE. RIDICULOUS!!! Monday-August 5, 2019. We came in at 7pm.

2wXjzvr9tsoYLkXjo6SewQ.text: Nice place to eat we went for our Valentine's Day delicious  Loved the dessert  The salads are delicious

9cpDkIExT7DVMHK3fEkAFA.text: Don't go for the dessert, and you'll be alright. (It all looks good but very mediocre.) Exceptions: chocolate ice cream and peach cobbler are passable.  The savory food on the whole is quite good, especially for the price. Will be back.  Plus, barely any line at all.

Jln7oM_3eBlokvMxWrLh-Q.text: The cost needs to be set to 4 $'s. These guys charge $24 per person for a breakfast buffet that's essentially denny's caliber.

5nyvZ5akuCcTsfuOah7uUg.text: We were here 10yrs ago and we are here again. I love their food servings. You can't go wrong. Thumbs up here.

ScVbID4_jmvufJTn4AFawA.text: Boy, was I surprised when I walked by and saw this completely remodeled buffet.  I've been staying at the Orleans for Vegas trips for the past 15 years.  I've had the old French Market Buffet more times than I can count and it has always been this drab depressing place with horrible food.  Well, all that has changed.  The Medley Buffet is all new and modernized!  I came for week day dinner and it was $18.99 with players club card.  They have extended the buffet line and there are so many more choices that look much more appetizing and inviting.  The food is overall much improved.  I really liked their smoked pork spare ribs, the braised oxtail, and the menudo.  The old New Orleans items are still there, so rest assured you can still get chicken and sausage gumbo as well as red beans and rice.  The gumbo seems less spicy than it used to be, but nothing a little Tabasco can't fix.  I also really liked the al pastor tacos with the meat actually being cut from the rotating spit.  They also serve crawfish, although when we went they were frozen crawfish from last season.  They were gigantic in size and tasted quite good for being frozen.  They were cooked well enough that you could still take the first ring off and pinch the tail to get the meat to come out all at once.  I hope as crawfish season picks up, they switch over to the live stuff.  It's happened in the past at French Market Buffet, so no reason it can't happen at the upgraded Medley Buffet.  Some items have not changed.  The hushpuppies and fried catfish are pretty dry.  The pizzas look anemic and greasy.  The desserts, while upgraded, are still stuff that's brought in instead of being made in-house.  The staff seem to have more of a spring in their steps and even the clientele seems upgraded.  No longer is this buffet just full of old locals eating for free after earning 200 points.  It felt like I was eating at M Resort.  With this new upgrade, Orleans leapfrogged many local buffets and even many strip buffets.  I'd say the order goes Bacchanal at Caesars, then Studio B at M Resort, then Medley Buffet in a tie with Feast Buffet at Red Rock, then Wynn, Bellagio, and the 3rd tier stuff at the Harrah's resorts.

MYA3piPON1GPpQORmW177g.text: The Medley  has been remodeled and food is really good...very pretty...the single star is not due  to that...but because of what I think is a lack of  common sense...I was invited to go to dinner by a chinese national who received a comp mailer for BOGO.  Not speaking English well and certainly not reading it...they did not get that it should be the name on the coupon...they were refused the BOGO deal...when they attempted to explain and show ID that they lived at the address and it was their family member....it became corporate...we are trying to protect our gamblers was the explanation ...Josh. ..corporate. ..was nice but if you are attempting to draw local traffic and someone is from the household and in fact gamblers there...why would you not honor the offer...never the less food was good...waitress good..the poor cashier got good tip due to her consternation...I paid for the meal..which caused embarrassment...please reprint your mailer

Fi8k5ONe3kpJm4xBconwXg.text: A huge food selection and lots of tables for a large party. Came here with eight and we were seated right away. You pay first before entering - be mindful of the breakfast hours since we missed it on the first day. Lots of foods to choose from, even gluten free options and Mimosa's, also a coffee bar that you can choose to have your own made. From waffles to fruits to so many more options, it's definitely the right choice when you're staying in the Orleans!

Photo of Medley Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

laK6X3raF0afCrOBX3wNgg.text: This was a surprise. I didn't expect much from the Medley Buffet. I've been to a bunch of Vegas buffers especially the big name ones and the Medley actually stood toe to toe with them. The carving station was actually very good with beef ribs and even rotisserie chicken. The prime rib was actually very tender and juicy as well. I was also surprised to see a crepe station and the dessert crepes were fantastic. I'd give them five stars but the dessert station wasn't the best. Especially for the price though you really can't beat this place and it seemed to be a big favorite amongst the locals.

vAo7N-6GyRKdiS6HxBVD6g.text: Wow!  After the remodel of this buffet late last year, I give it a nudge to a 4 star rating!  Look, I realize these buffets in Vegas are par for the course...so I go with what the buffet is doing to improve themselves, to make it a better experience.  With the newly named Medley Buffet at The Orleans, they seem to have gone all-out with a total makeover!  The old buffet is unnoticeable - new walls, new stations, new decor, new seating, new carpet...new everything!  Their buffet was due for a nice change, and it seems to be all the better for visitors new & old to Vegas.  I think many would be pleased with its new looks!  I'm not really gonna complain about the food either!  No, it's not really competing with the likes of Bacchanal or Wynn or Cosmo when it comes to really high-end buffets...but it gives many of the local player buffets a run for their money!  We went on their most expensive meal night (Friday's Steak & Shrimp is $25.99 per person) and had many selections to eat:  -Prime Rib -Al Pastor Tacos -BBQ Beef Ribs -Shrimp & Pork Shumai -NY Steak -Assorted Meat & Cheese Platter -Kalbi Ribs -Fish & Chips -Crepes  Overall, mostly good!  Some of the items were on the overdone side, like the NY steak.  Some were not flavored the way I prefer, like the Kalbi ribs.  The BBQ beef ribs are tasty but they do tend to get stuck in your teeth & get very messy!  The crepes were not my favorite - batter is a bit too thick and more pancake like.  But I give them an A for effort on those.  The station selections were varied and there are more offerings than ever before.  Choices people, choices!  So while you may not like everything you try, there must be something you can agree with!  For me, the best selection they had that night was a HUGE pot of Oxtails they brought out!  We Asians know!  The minute I saw those glistening oxtails I knew I had something special.  Right after I got my large bowl (OK 3 large bowls), all my Asian peeps followed suit.  One little Chinese lady actually came to our table and asked exactly where those oxtails were on the service line!  Popular to say the least!  Great experience at the all-new Medley Buffet with my family!  Good eats with good company always makes for a good time!  Don't forget your FREE B Connected players card when you visit the buffet, discounts galore depending on your player level.    We'll be back Medley Buffet!

photos.caption: Photo of Medley Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Medley Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

x7YJEOfdlhOQQBAjO-MU7Q.text: Came here at the suggestion of a friend for AYCE crawfish... secretly I'm a crawfish junky and after learning about this place, I don't think I'll ever go back to the Hot N' Juicy or Boiling Crab ever again!  The downside to it being a buffet is that they have to cater to the masses, so definitely no extra garlicky or extra spicy options available. However, find a willing cook and give them a tip and I'm sure you can get it flavored how you'd like.   Their crawfish looks like it was on steroids with how big they were and I had to stop after 3 huge piled high plates of just crawfish alone! My friends and I were THOSE people that would basically pile up a lot of crawfish on our plates to the point where other people behind is would give us the stink eye... excuse it, it's an AYCE, don't get your knickers in a twist, they will replenish it haha. I even had to give my friends the side eye and sh1t talking at the table because they emptied out the pan when they went before me haha.  Their barbecue station was amazing. The pork and beef ribs were fall of the bone tender.   Their made to order crepes were decent. I mean, yes they don't have the crepe pan to ensure it's a thin crepe, but the filling of fresh pineapple and blueberries made up for it.  Here's a tip: Tip your cooks who do a made to order anything in a buffet. Even a $1 is better than nothing. They were down to the last 2 crepes and the cook serviced me first because he knew I tipped him over the other person who was plain rude and didn't give them anything. It's kind of an unspoken rule seeing as you know, they're serving you something fresh and not just something in a pan that's been sitting in their warmer in the back.   Seeing as this trip was all about the crawfish, I didn't really try anything else. That'll be for the next visit. But definitely one of the better buffets in town that's off the strip.

vQrU0gr_L85gWGhbu-yVpg.text: Since the renovation, 1 year ago...the food or the chef really sucks!!! Prime rib, DRY!, Chicken in southern flavors, DRY!! new look good...come on Boyd!,! New look,make the food match the look... all my favorites are all dry. Orleans use to be awesome, now I say the quality of.food is more like the employee dining room...BLAH!.......

5ZKArknuW7uDgYfKPQN_sg.text: Nicer than what it was, but not nearly as great as the strip buffets or my favorite local buffet, Studio B at the M Resort.  Not vegan friendly.  Barely vegetarian friendly. Meat lovers can find some tasty stuff here at the carving station and bbq area.  Foodies will not enjoy this spot.  Martha the server is great at her job   Talkative, amiable, efficient, considerate, no unnecessary conversation.  Recognize her.  She makes you money.  Give her days off, a raise and a promotion.  Service here is actually the highlight.  I enjoy being seated or the overall refills and customer satisfaction that they focus on here.  No bathroom inside but it's a casino, they want you to go to through the casino.  However, the nearest one is visible from.the buffet and fairly close.  Cups and mugs they use are all okay, nothing special.  Coffee is decent.  They offer the usual condiments and   Coffee could be better, fish was never great here.  The pollock and few other dishes they had were always dry and flavorless.  Chowmein, and breakfast items all tasted like microwave pantry products.  Kimchi was eh.  Mushrooms were okay.  Veggie spring roll was actually cool too.  The pho station and noodle station was kinda neat.  Yet, was still subpar.  The egg flower soup didnt have the right viscosity or thickness to it.  Tasted bland too.   The tables and tacos were decent.  Though they tasted like Latin food it was only okay.    Will do a more decent review in the near future.  For 15 bucks for lunch and your starving.  The place is aight.  But for that price you're better eating at Studio B Buffet with unlimited beer and wine with better food.

zlbtyPHsUYhgR4_JMfNppQ.text: Tbh I had very low expectations heading into this food experience. I haven't had a good experience at The Orleans so far. HOWEVER!!! We went for lunch, wait was very short & we were promptly seated. Our waitress was AMAZING! She was very helpful & was willing to bring us drinks from the bar.   Onto the food... The variety was outstanding! They had pho, bbq, Japanese, Chinese, Italian, Mexican, pizza & breakfast food (I know the last 2 aren't ethnicities). I had the sushi, bbq & an omelette & all were really good! I'd highly recommend the kielbasa and prime rib. Their bbq sauces go really well with their ribs too!   My omelette (with everything) was awesome as well. Had that with some hash browns and was SUPER impressed. Sushi was pretty good too!   Dessert I had the bread pudding. It was really good!   Would I come here again? Absolutely! Was better than Red Rock's buffet and it wasn't even close!!

lGVWGEWBAPMg_JtqNzSD_Q.text: We received amazing customer service from Kathy, our server. We were greeted by her very warmly and she went above and beyond to serve our table and exceeded our expectations! Our family always hopes to see her whenever we come here because we are always wowed by her diligence, work ethic, and kindness!

aN6NYOakr3o0211pEeIrSw.text: I loved that this buffet was inside our hotel! We decided to try it on a Sunday just before heading out. They had brunch Sundays so the selection included breakfast affordable lunch fare.    They a lot of stuff from pasta to steak to tacos. Loved the tacos and the dessert wing and the unlimited orange juice! Just giving them 4 stars though because I didn't see any shrimp dishes or fried chicken - two items I always look for at any buffet place.  Amazing that they had a day pass for just $33.00!!! Will definitely be back!

CG9YKpq4dLqNzNk62awoZw.text: My wife and I traveled to Las Vegas every month for 10 years for work and fell in love with the buffet at the Orleans. This is our first time back since 2009. Before today, we loved the Creole/Cajun offerings and especially the gumbo, snow crab and especially, the crawfish. Sadly, any reference to the name on the marquee has been thoroughly washed away. It's not as bad as Hometown Buffet (or worse yet, Golden Corral) but it's heading in that direction. You can definitely fill your pie hole, but it's pretty unremarkable, given the myriad of choices that abound in the Vegas area. On the bright side, the service was prompt, efficient and friendly. Sad.

wKn1KPpAq-OgkSE5Iobhew.text: Figured I had to hit the remodeled buffet before leaving Vegas.... Oh wait, I live here.. Prices are about where the near strip buffets run. Personally I wouldn't come back without another BOGO or better yet a free coupon.  To start it took forever to get in, line didn't move for 10-15 minutes and then would crawl for a dozen feet. We get to the register eventually after cranking the wheelchair through the chute. Name removed to protect is running the register, well I mean he is there. X loves his job so much he os dancing and bopping and spending little to no attention to his customers. MIL told him she was paying for two and points to herself and FIL that is on the wheelchair. I hear and I am twice as far from her as he is. We proceed to use the other register that opened up and complete our order and X is still working on MIL ticket.  There is a make your own Pho station. Can honestly say this is the first time I have seen that and hopefully the last. The water you are supposed to cook or reheat your noodles in is maybe luke warm, needs to be close to a boil of you plan on heating it up in less than 15 minutes.  Took a bowl of the gumbo since it came up in one of the many reviews I read while waiting. It was rather good, better than my cold Pho.  The Mexican section is pretty nice. Al pastor tacos were delish, wife thought they were too spicy. The elotes were okay, but you know how ow buffet corn on the cob is.  The Asian section was good, pork and shrimp shu mai were very flavorful and not dried out. The pork bun were good. The duck didn't have the duckiness of flavor I was hoping for. I skipped the sushi, I'll go to a sushi place for that.  Pork ribs were good, beef ribs were mostly fat. Has some steak that had some moisture left and tasted good.   They have a crepe station in the middle instead of with desserts, I didn't partake but my wife liked hers.   Blueberry cobbler is where I went even though I knew it was probably just pie filling.  Server was attentive and kept the table clear of dirty dishes and empty glasses.   So standard buffet with it's hits and misses

DhYZ2RNn1VDifhZEpxnoGw.text: It's always bright and clean. They gave lots of choices so I'm sure you'll find something you'll like the service gas always been good. The prices have gone up after they remodeled but I'm a big guy and I always get my money's worth. There's so many options it's hard to write a review on the food I would say it's worth going to if your in the area. I do think the Friday seafood buffet is over priced but breakfast is a good deal.  Get the casino players club for a couple dollars off the price.

E-WGT6Id5BrtE94mFMLQ1w.text: Terrible, bland food and even worse service if you can even call it that. First of all, the buffet was half empty and yet we had to wait 10-15 min in line to even pay and then another 10 min to be seated. Once we got in, we got no service at all once our initial drinks came. It seemed like the waiter had some type of issue with us even though we said nothing to him besides what we wanted to drink. Something was clearly wrong though because he never came back to our table, despite walking by a hundred times during our meal. He walked with his head up but whenever he got close to our table, he would look in the other direction as if to ignore us and continue serving the other tables around us. Is it a crime to be Asian now? WTF. This was very offensive and that's not even considering that we never got refills, napkins or service whatsoever.  The food isn't much better. Everything that I tried was either overcooked or bland except for the fried chicken wings and ice cream which ended up being most of what I ate. Healthy right? The entire Asian section was terrible and I was forced to waste an entire plate of food. How do you over cook broccoli beef or forget to season chow mein so that it tastes like nothing? I just don't get it. Worst buffet experience I've had in Vegas and I've been to some seedy and dirty looking buffets...Will not be back and would not recommend

jiRFhzPoS33_YDbhMAw57w.text: Much improvement since the renovation in food and atmosphere. However, of course, prices have gone up to help pay for the cost of the renovation.

qLdLseJG5uoAA0gzuuoEZg.text: Hands down better food than the Bellagio or the cosmopolitan. I would take the bus here from my resort, and then walk back to try and burn off some of the calories. it was so good I went twice.  Directions from the Las Vegas Strip at Tropicana. cross the street to the north side of of Tropicana. there you will find a bus stop. Take any bus going East, but there is usually only just one. get off one the Orleans is anounced.  Mike starting to get a Players Club card as this will give you one to two dollars off.  Directions to French Market is very well marked.  Once you pay and are stated the choices are unlimited. come prepared with what food styles you are looking for. the good stuff like the sea food and barbecue, it's at the far left. this is also where things get very exciting and tantalizing.  At least four different types of ribs in addition to a large carving station, with some of the largest portions of smoked brisket you can imagine. perfectly seasoned, with many rings of smoke, and a fatty bark if you request that. I always request fatty bark pieces. my serving was at least a half pound.  it's a good point to remember that it in a buffet like this, to take advantage of things that you don't normally get to eat so skip the salad bar and go for the expensive things like shrimp and grilled vegetables.  Shock and awe on the dessert station. the tiramisu was so good I went back for thirds.  but in addition there were several varieties of gelato as well as sugar free desserts.  Service was five-star five-diamond. but my diet Pepsi and my water never went empty and I did not have to ask. licked clean plates were whisked away unobtrusively when you would come back to the buffet. From the cashiers to the cleaning crew, everyone greeted you with a sincere smile and kind words.  What really stood out was the number of regulars and locals, that have a choice of hundreds of buffets. What keeps them coming back is the delicious food and service. and I do not have to reply on cheap gimmicks like the Cosmopolitan....stop putting food in different containers such as miniature skillets. this is nothing more than a gimmick to get you to eat less.  I would recommend French market to anyone visiting Las Vegas.

Photo of Medley Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegatabe lasagna and seafood enchiladas...pork nibbles!
Photo of Medley Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. MEAT

f7rOd5h19leK_Wm0WkLKPg.text: I went here for lunch this afternoon.I had seen photos of the newly renovated buffet and I was curious to see if it looked as good as the photos.I am happy to say that it did.It is one of the most modern,beautiful and aesthetically appealing buffets I have ever been to.The lighting and colors have a really positive feel to them.To use an Asian term,it had a real good Feng Shui,IMHO.The servers were quite good,coming over frequently to remove empty plates and refilling beverages.The dessert selection seemed quite good,although I only availed myself of a couple of items as I am trying to restrict my sugar intake.Having said all of the above,I must say that I wasn't really impressed with the overall quality of the main food items.Don't get me wrong.I'm not saying that I didn't enjoy the meal or that it was industrial sewage like you would get at Circus Circus.It was probably a bit better then than the offerings at the old French Market buffet that the Orleans used to have.It's just that a lot of the dishes just seemed to be lacking in a certain pizzazz.I would not have a problem coming here again for another meal as long as it was discounted like the one I had today.To me,their prices are about $5.00 more per meal then what I would ideally like to pay.But if you do choose to eat here,I doubt that you'll be disappointed.There is such a large selection that you should get a full meal.Just don't expect really incredible food.Of course,you're also not paying a really exorbitant price.Enjoy.

HETY3B0w6v1zPZibcmx8bw.text: This is a great buffet with a clean, very nice atmosphere. The drink servers are very attentive and friendly. All food items labeled accurately. A little pricey, yet I would go here again.

YdzDO26Ks0WddKOrSTXWlA.text: Breakfast buffet costs only $8.99 per person with a Players' Club card.  Including drink, this is a deal!  The food tastes good and there is plenty of variety:  omelettes, chocolate waffles, doughnuts, cereal, fruit, sausage, and much more.  If you come near the end of breakfast hours you can get the best of both worlds when they switch to lunch fare, including seafood, BBQ, Mongolian, and more.  My friends also loved the AYCE seafood dinner buffet -- the cost is a little bit more, maybe $15, but they quickly ate more than that in crab legs, mussels, clams, and shrimp.  Come early in the morning to avoid any lines.  This represents superior value compared to the Courtyard Cafe, which is also in the Orleans, though that Cafe is 24 hours.  There an entree plus drink could easily cost you $12 or more.

O9TXCnD9yXRt6K9S3nBiVg.text: Went to the newly renovated Medley Buffet November 21, 2017 for lunch. We have been coming here for years and the buffet was renovated very nice, was really impressed. That's the GOOD news, now the BAD news.  The food didn't meet our expectations from past years.  My friend got food poisoning eating the spoiled shrimp cocktail and was sick for five days, it messed up our entire trip. He was the only one in our party that ate shrimp and I remember him commenting the shrimp wasn't firm and was soft. Hope they get their act together and improve on their food preparation and their menu.

BFZopCxVtyViSmX0izISNg.text: I've been coming to this buffet for over a decade just for the BBQ station and the  ribs! They have a fair selection of foods to keep you happy and its all very tasty.   Dont tell anyone ......but i heard they added a new chocolate fountain.....*wink wink*

3IKCwZfMbOrQ8dUThfbpXA.text: The seafood is what gives it 3 stars, the service wasn't courteous and it was messy everywhere. It's a decent buffet, desert is ok, price is ok, hot chocolate is good,  I see myself going again, only for the seafood (:

3_wFTkcFn6BbkMdjnKzsAQ.text: I don't love Vegas for its gambling or partying, well I do  but mainly for its FOOD!!!  Every time I come to Vegas I must try a new buffet or restaurant. And this time it wasn't the  exception.  So, I gave this place a try. They literally deserve 3 stars. Everything, including ambiance is MEH. Idk if we were here on a bad day but their employees  seem barely alive to say the least. They have a variety of food, which I gave everything a try and it wasn't horrible but it wasn't good.
