wGiD8HjoLf74WCgzfWPszg.text: Awful and over priced! We come to Vegas every year and we drive to the Orleans hotel and Casino for their amazing breakfast Buffet.  We arrived to the Buffet to find that it was closed and under construction. There was the other breakfast buffet inside the same hotel. It was 13 dollars per person which was more than we were used to paying at this type of venue but we were there and hungry so we gave it a shot. We were so disappointed. Firstly we were there at 9 am. Not anywhere close to lunch and there we more dinner food items then there were breakfast....crawfish, ribs and salad bar. Don't get me wrong I don't have a problem with that except that there was no yogurt, fruit, grits,ect. The only bread they had was held in an area that you had to wait in line for an employee to make toast. Our 7 year old got pizza which looked and tastes like it sat for two days. We had to pay full price for a 7 year old which made the experience that much worse.   The wait staff brings you drinks. Ours was was not friendly and when she asked if We needed refills she didn't even wait for an answer and had already walked away.  Don't waste your money at this place.

EP8iCbLl6qkmt52DvF4zyw.text: Price was good for what you get. Did not have to wait in line long only 17 mins., place was already full. I especially enjoyed the German food. You could tell a lot of time and thought was put into these dishes at the Hofbrau station. The Wait service met my every needs, I never had to ask for anything. Very tasty and delicious!

j4frjCvWwNiY_5SQDSkz7g.text: Garbage!!! Same old crap guys. Don't be fooled in business we call it old lady wearing new dress. Same odor same food and textures.  Unimpressed!!

a_Bz6RxtPlw1D22nBRpA6Q.text: This review is for December 22, 2016. This buffet is located inside the Orleans Casino. If you have a players card, there is a BOGO deal.   The customer service, particularly the front, I was not satisfied with. The woman who rung me up had an attitude the whole time. I asked her how the BOGO deal worked because my dad did not know, she rolled her eyes at him and ignored him. I had to ask another hostess.   The variety of choices of the buffet was amazing. They had USA, Asian, Mongolian, Seafood and Barbecue. The chefs were fast paced ensuring each tray was stocked. The quality was great as well. I'm very particular with how I like my barbecue, but none of the meats were too salty or underdone. I appreciated that.

JzI51S-W0WOudKj1U_swjA.text: Probably the most food I've wasted at a buffet and I hate wasting food.  Quality was not good as a few things were inedible.  Chewy shredded hash browns, hard coated chicken fried steak, face clenching sour pineapples, and overly fat and greasy sausage.  Now at $7.50 you would think it is a value meal but I would not come back if it was free.

EifABpBqvgjXTjejiLri1A.text: Eating here will make you sick.  I eat here once a month and I always eat so much food I leave feeling sick, but still have a gelato cone in my hand. The food is good, the just changed the price structure so breakfast and lunch are $1 more and dinner is $1 less.  I usually only go here because I have free offers or 2 for 1.  The dinner is now $22 on Friday for crab night, so even with a 2-1 is more expensive then many dinners you can get.  You will always leave full, but you will also get full at a stations at half the price.

photos.caption: Photo of Medley Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Desert case

mF53soa7DitiZkeFwGEX2g.text: I loved the price for the buffet, they have Italian, Mexican, American. Chinese, BBQ, Mongolian, seafood and dessert with gelato and a few others I missed. The place is a little run down, torn booths and sunk in. Took a while to get my drink, but the waitress was extremely attentive afterwards she explained she had a large party upstairs.  The Mexican food was meh, the taco shells weren't crunchy and it fell apart as I was about to take a bite. Ribs were excellent from the BBQ stand and Mac n cheese was yummy. Seafood was good except I hated the fact that I had to peel my shrimp.   Dessert station was good, I recommend the gelato and cream puffs.   I give four stars because of cleanliness, the dessert station was a mess and I seen a lot of different foods mixed with others.   I encountered a group of tourists with strong body odor (not the hotels fault) but it made me lose my appetite.

w9zJ1L6xe9tqAD4H9FErsg.text: The new remodel is absolutely stunning! The whole feel of the buffet is completely different. You feel as if you are in a hotel on the strip. The decor is absolutely beautiful and the colors that were chose were perfect. The food was organized perfectly as someone would order a meal. Salads,deli meat, cubes cheeses , fruit and bread all beautifully arranged in the far left corner with the food selection flowing into American BBQ,Chinese,Italian ect. The food was excellent. I usually don't eat everything I get on my plate from buffets as it's mostly trial and error but I finished everything I chose. The prime rib was cooked perfectly and was no where near dry. The pasta station was incredible. The El Pastor tacos were to die for. Dessert was was good, the normal ice cream and pies. The service was outstanding! Our server was very polite and our drinks were never empty. Out plates were taken as soon as we finished. I have to say I really enjoyed the new atmosphere and attitude that the entire place gives off. We will be visiting again soon :)

0TuC7zRpi9lkRjsV2QJOFw.text: Don't come here until they are done with renovations! Currently the buffet is located in a temporary location until renovations are complete. The selection is much smaller & not quality food. Normally this is a great spot, but not right now

dFidiPmF5M6vJ7iDEFn1Sg.text: I am sorry to give two star to Buffet, food is really not so good, dishes are cold, food is blend and without flavor . Desert bar is much better, they deserve four stars at least. On the other hand costumer service is flawless . They truly deserve five star.  I had some issues with a food, they took care everything in very professional way. Security took my report very seriously, buser( Tony)  was on the point, server nice and manager Ana sweetest person I ever met in my life. Thank you for taking care me and give me feeling that I am special guest not just number. Hopefully next time food is going to be better and warmer but I wish service stay always so good and nice.

photos.caption: Photo of Medley Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7i4vi17W5J2ikOjoZNvefw.text: So finally after a couple of days of trying Indian breakfast at the strip, we get to try out this lavish buffet at the hotel where we stayed. This is located in The Orleans hotel which is a couple of miles away from the Vegas strip. Buffet starts around 9am and I am not sure when it ends. They have couple of options to try their buffet. One ticket or all day pass. We opted for one but if you're in there to gamble then get the all day pass so that you can hop in whenever you're hungry.   We tried breakfast and lunch buffet on different days. Weekend breakfast buffet had all the breakfast option that you could imagine. In addition to that they had some great barbecue food like ribs, smoked chicken, ham. Since this hotel is Orleans style so I wasn't surprised to see crawfish. Unfortunately, the only reason I gave one star less is because the crawfish was so bad that I had to spit it out immediately. That left a bad taste in my mouth that I had to rush to the restroom. I have had some amazing crawfish in New Orleans so my expectation is very high.   They also have live omelette section. There's no breakfast/brunch buffet without a good live omelette section. Various cuisines include Mexican, Italian, French, American, British, Asian and Jamaican.   Dessert section is really good. Ice creams, sorbets, cheese cakes, carrot cake. Service is great! Do tip the servers as they work very hard cleaning the table every time you get up to get another round of serving. If you're a fan of ice tea then ask for cranberry ice tea. It's really good.   Cost of a weekend brunch was $20 each and weekday lunch was around $15. Prices is pretty nominal. Restaurant is very clean.

photos.caption: Photo of Medley Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Medley Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pho
Photo of Medley Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

HimmDIgAQHLau5MI3gpzrQ.text: The Medley Buffet is located at The Orleans in Las Vegas. They have a wide selection of food including salad bar, soups, fresh fruits, seafood, meats, ribs, a dessert bar including sorbetto and soft serve ice cream.   The food was tasty and decent and pretty typical for a buffet. We ate here for breakfast and dinner. Prices are very reasonable. Compared to another buffet (The Garden Buffet at another hotel-see my review), this was definitely much better.

photos.caption: Photo of Medley Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Qc3oCp4-JT5BiNRyud0ETA.text: It seems this venue was remodeled and refreshed in the past year or two.... as a result I can say we Approve!  We dined here last Friday for their steak and shrimp evening at $25.95..  Our table was waited on by "Manny" and he was on the bounce checking, refilling beverages and clearing out plates.  The dining fare was varied and judged a good value.  I particularly liked the hand carved prime rib, BBQ ribs, plus oddly enough the Crawfish.  Not so great was the ciopinno and soft serve desert.  Otherwise I really liked it here.  So why 4 stars?  Why not 4 stars for a good spread, good stuff and good service!?

photos.caption: Photo of Medley Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Medley Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Medley Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6QEGHdh3aN77BCcTPFXtQA.text: Pleasantly surprised.  We had the Orleans buffet for the first time in years.  It used to be so-so but they have remodeled and given the menu an update also.  We had breakfast and there were tiny potato pancakes , eggs benedict, etc.; all done perfectly.  I dont know if they have a new chef or not but I enjoyed this very much!  Kudos to the chef!

af3Q05Mj3stlws7ooX1S4w.text: We came in 30 min before closing for the lunch buffet. A long buffet line of foods filled with the basic variety of round-the-world Vegas fare.  Noticed some items, like the meats and some veggies were a little dry and tough. Guess it didn't move too fast on a Monday.  The Mexican corn on a stick was the highlight for me.  Our server oddly didn't acknowledge, look or ask me if I wanted any drinks, steak knife or coffee. By the way, I wanted those things and even yelled "coffee please!!" while he hurriedly walked away after asking pal if he wanted anything else. Pretty funny now that I see it in writing!

photos.caption: Photo of Medley Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mexican corn can!
Photo of Medley Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Applicable to all buffets, plze.

TV6sksUzLBXjidzoaVcVdQ.text: We rolled in right before noon on a Saturday morning. The queue was set up like they expected a crowd, but we walked right up to the register, paid for two, and then were shown to a table right away.  They have quite the spread of items, ranging from fruit and salads to omelet and taco stations to carving stations and sushi. It was still breakfast time in my mind, but the second I spied the sushi, I knew that'd be my first stop.  The hubs and I did the obligatory walk-through, browsing the available food items, before splitting up to get our food. As mentioned, I went straight to the sushi station - grabbing 3 pieces of each of the options - and topping off with gyoza, a pile of noodles and a steamed bao.  I got back to the table before my husband (who had gone for breakfast foods - biscuits and gravy, bacon, sausage, and eggs). The best thing on my plate was the bao - it was perfectly steamed and soft, and the char siu inside was delightful. That was about the only thing I liked. The chow mein was cold, and the rice in the sushi was hard and crispy. In every piece from each roll! It was disgusting and inedible. The gyoza was okay, but over-steamed in my opinion, as the casings fell off when I tried to get it out of the tray.  Refusing to let that be the meal that stayed with me for the rest of the day, I headed back to the buffet for round 2, which was much better. I grabbed a biscuit and poured some gravy on top, then went and snagged a mini waffle, lathering that with whipped butter. I made one more pass, grabbing a couple bits of bacon, a smattering of hashbrowns and an Eggs Benedict in a bowl.  As I said, this round was much better. The biscuit was fluffy and the gravy was just a bit too salty (which I liked at that moment). The bacon was a little too limp, but edible. The hashbrowns were perfect (for me), but then I *did* seek out the bits that looked overcooked. The Benedict was surprisingly good - the egg was actually still perfectly poached and runny by the time I picked it up. The hubs went back for two more rounds after me, and really enjoyed the Chili Colorado and the mini taco station.   Our waitress was nice and friendly, as well. She even complimented me for my style. =)

photos.caption: Photo of Medley Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Second round - much better spread of breakfast foods
Photo of Medley Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. First round - disgusting sushi, fabulous bao, and mediocre dumplings and chow mein

bfjFvjGfpKvWorXaTcJL1w.text: I'm grading up on the curve scale mainly because of the price, and the quality of food. With the vast options of buffets in Vegas the Medley Buffet at the Orleans casino is a solid mid level buffet. But with the quality of food at most buffets (like the crappy mgm buffet) going down, and up in price makes this place stand out more.   For about 21 bucks they have a wide variety of good food. If you're a member of the B Connected players club you get a discount on your buffet depending on what level you are. This for sure will be my go to buffet next time I'm in Vegas & I don't want to break the bank in something to eat.

62lZHzyp2QqljUGtEfzxiA.text: 4 stars in the Boyd Hotel Group of Buffets.  If you are a kama'aina, it's $5 with your dinner coupon so it's worth it.  There are more choices than any other Boyd properties.  Its way better than the Freemont Paradise Buffet and due to the higher ceilings, less smoke inhalation.  And that's a plus!  Nice selection of desserts.  The turkey and the ham are the best proteins.  The steak is okay, the prime rib is okay, the oxtail was a bit tough.  Loved the salad selections.  I skipped the seafood.  The shrimp scampi seemed the most popular tonight.    Loved the espresso  menu selections.  I made myself an affogado with a double shot espresso.  Which just made me so happy at the end.  The hot crepe is a great selection too.  This is an overall good buffet for anyone that won't cost you an arm and a leg.   Don't expect bone marrow or A5 here.

photos.caption: Photo of Medley Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Medley Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

juuAzabUtPzlHiJW9zVgBw.text: The new buffet is horrible, lots of food, but bad quality. No vegetarian options available, if you don't eat meat don't go here

Z7B_tR9ra21YaR70byqwfA.text: Going to make this short and painless because I had so much high hopes for this buffet . For a buffet they had a large selection which is good but the food is not good . I honestly hate saying it but I think hometown buffet or Golden Corral might be better .

bP1fZg25gQIKljBkR8kCpg.text: Best buffet in this price range!   FOOD SELECTION: HUGE! Different stations, big salad bar, tons of deli meats cheese and fruits, pasta salads, chicken salads, seafood salads, DELICIOUS TENDER RIBS, all bbq and carving station items are amazing.   Asian station, Mexican station, Italian station, Classic American station.  Six or more soup selections including pho.   I saw people with huge plates of crawfish.   I usually never eat pizza at buffets but the PIZZA here was thick, fresh, and full of toppings.  DESSERTS are of great quality here. The lil round cheese cakes are so dense and decadent. The mango sorbet tastes just like frozen juicy sweet pure mango pulp heaven!   WAIT TIME/LINE: There was a rather big line. Took us about an hour to get seated but there is a lot of seating. Some area had tables free that hadn't been cleared maybe they had someone call out so I don't know if the wait is usual or just because of the call out because another day we came we walked right in.   PRICE: $20 some for dinner but if you play they often give out buy one get one or get one 50% off vou

photos.caption: Photo of Medley Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Medley Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Medley Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ZfYUVaYM2VApLnun6Ev3hw.text: I wish I had five colorful paragraphs to share about Medley Buffet, but do not. It's just... eh.  The interior is nice to look at, and definitely the strong point. I never had a chance to eat at the French Market Buffet, but I've heard Boyd did a decent job with the remodel. I don't go to buffets for the decorations, though, and Medley doesn't deliver on the food -- especially not during the weekend Champagne Brunch.   The breakfast options are good-not-great standard fare and the mimosas included with our meal came out to little more than a shot of liquid in a plastic cup. Our waiter promised us more mimosas after we'd finished our first round, but they never came.  The Pepsi barbecue sauce was great and the sushi was fine, but I don't go to brunch to eat sushi and I don't spend $20 on a buffet for a dipping sauce to be the highlight. Pass on the Medley Buffet. If you're Boyd-loyal and don't mind going out of the way, opt for Sam's Town's buffet instead.

-ljfjwpZMBvZJ5ktS9O-lg.text: Stopped by for lunch with my sister around 1:45pm on a Monday...and there was no line! I love when there is no waiting. Lunch options are very diverse and interesting. Lots of food stations to chose from. Everything looked really good. I enjoyed their fresh salad bar, some Chinese cuisine and the second plate was Mexican enchiladas with fresh chips and salsa. Customer service was really pleasant and the server 'Dana' checked on us often.  Definitely recommend for lunch if you're in the area or staying at the hotel.

photos.caption: Photo of Medley Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yum! Collage of lunch food.

F4KENmMIVrIfLu7o0na2qw.text: The buffet itself is appealing to the eyes.  Nice carpet, simple yet colorful accent decor. etc...  It reminds me of the biffet at the Red Rock, in terms of decor and layout.    Its spacious and not cramped.  The food is decent.  There is a good selection of food from all over the world.  The desserts are minimal but delicious.  The gelato and cheesecake were surprizingly good.  I also enjoyed the ice cream sandwhich.  Its a bit pricey when considering the offerings but if you like crawfish, this is the place to be on Friday Night.  The peel and eat shrimp was a bit on the smalle  The Mexican Station was really tasty.    Their Mexican Style Street corn and tacos were on point.  I went back for more.  Service was excellent and the plce was clean.  I'll be back again when at the Orleans.

photos.caption: Photo of Medley Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Medley Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Medley Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

i6GKZXHkMEwqxfCl2c2esg.text: The food was great but this honestly was bogged down by the really inconsiderate and rude service from FOH (front of the house) staff.  My family was visiting for a get-together and birthday celebration. Cashier yelled at us in front of customers "Hey, you have to pay first", when we've already paid with tips earlier. Hostess, on the other hand, arrogantly  insisted on splitting our party into two tables under two wait staff Manny (3 adults+ baby) and Tiffany (2 adults) instead of trying to accommodate our request to seat our party altogether in one table, reasoning that it would move the service from Manny to Tiffany, when their proposed seating already does that. Celebrations are special.  Splitting our party defeats togetherness. Rude, boorish approach leaves a very bad taste in the mouth.   Uncouth, ill-mannered, strangely arrogant. Need to polish on courtesy, kindness, hospitality. After all, this is the hospitality business.

W0bLmcq4eg6xip8Vs4C1XA.text: I was excited to try this place as it was relatively new and renovated. Went early last year and the price is about $20 per person with a players card. They have a wide variety of food options. The food looks alot better than it tastes as everything was very bland. Was hoping dessert would at least save the day, but their dessert section was bad too. How do you mess up ice cream?

photos.caption: Photo of Medley Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prime rib, mac and cheese and mashed potatoes. Everything looked great but was so bland. This place has potential if they put in the effort.

w6tAIlITagGwT48zn8sNlA.text: First time here after the renovations from the old Orleans buffet. The ambiance is modern. The food was good.

photos.caption: Photo of Medley Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Buffet offers gluten free options

KlcYohBfyqlDcmS8qg_fSA.text: Compared to other polish buffets in the off Vegas Strip area, this one is the best. The food for the buffet is brought out in small portions instead of giant tubs, so you know what you're selecting is fresh and hasn't been sitting around for a while. Food isn't overly greasy like any other Vegas buffet. The waitresses are very kind and attentive. I love this place and go as often as I can for some comforting polish food that gramma used to make. Asking if we ever needed anything, or any recommendation for us to try out. Really made us felt like apart of their family. It is an all cash only! Be kind to them and revive kindness back.

XX2DqA1N9Uc7Nu79J9WKhQ.text: Tony B was amazing!! He was really fast and customer service was on point! The food was delicious! Wish there was more pasta options and mc & cheese.

7Aad751NppHUfd5Tybr_Bg.text: Let's be clear, this is a buffet. People who expect gourmet food at a buffet can't be trusted. You're coming here for variety, massive amounts of food intake and a decent price for it all. We came here on Friday night, steak and shrimp night, for $27. Breakfast and weekday buffet prices are quite a bit lower.   For the price, it was a good meal. Plenty of options, steak, ribs, peel n eat shrimp, shrimp salad, shrimp scampi, etc (every option you can think like Bubba says in Forrest Gump). They also have sushi, Asian, Mexican, pasta, salad, desserts, ice cream and more.   The entire buffet was clean, both around the food and the tables. Waitstaff was friendly and present. I'd return if hungry and gambling here. I wouldn't make a special trip just for the food.

nX6IwjzM1b_lt07lnOkJhA.text: When I came into this buffet, I thought it must be just as good as the Ports O'Call Buffet at Gold Coast because of the set up and it did offer the same foods. However, I was wrong. French Market Buffet was just alright. I found a couple things I could eat, but overall, this place was a dud. I found myself placing a lot of salt and pepper on my plate just to give my meal a little bit of flavor. They are definitely other places to go for off the Strip buffets.

lSQ5dnle_FVXOfrIvylCog.text: I stayed at the hotel, that portion was great. However their buffet is probably one of the worse ones I had while I was in Vegas. The dinner buffet was about 15$ which is cheap for dinner, but the food wasn't all there, the beef was dry, the desserts seemed old and it tasted like it' sbeen sitting out there for a while. The best part was that they had italian meat balls that were tender because they were overcooked in the sauce. I would say avoid this buffet and goto in and out about 4 blocks towards the strip.

8taxvJdkHoYVlckBnsyw8g.text: For $13.99 is OK for a buffet. The food was decent but everything tasted too salty even the fried catfish(?). The best part of this buffet is the crawfish. You can get a huge plate of them unlike some other buffets. A pound or two of them is worth the price. Service was slow but we ordered extra drinks early and they accommodated that with out trouble.

f4axK52dkcD1KtqWjQGo0g.text: Bad, bad, bad.  Poor service, flavor was off on almost all of the food, we both ended up with a horrid stomach ache the next day.  Quantity  Quality. This place is overpriced for what they offer.

XZQpIgiJI7BtluG3NabqOg.text: I was there for the Christmas brunch. The crab was good, the selection of dessert was vast, and the coffee was great with the dessert. Everything else was... meh... But at this price, there's not much you can complain about.

TFq53hjyRMDw_Fam4wRzcQ.text: Pretty decent food I mean I went for lunch buffet and had some discount coupons so got it all for a five spot. Can't beat that I am sure it was the same food offered on their dinner menu but just at the reduced rate. I sure was hungry the day I was here too. I put away some food and kept smiling. I liked the BBQ ribs here, Prime Rib and fried shrimp.

dqUJ5RrxD-rDMe3R5OZfJQ.text: What a disappointment! This will be our 4th time here. Usually my husband and I are very pleased but after today's visit we won't be back! It started in line, on Sundays it's $13.99 or $12.99 with your players card. Usually I carry my card since I have a purse. Never has it been an issue where they only give one of us the discount but today the sassy grouch at the counter wanted my husbands card too. Oh well it's just $1. So we are seated at a table with no place settings and a bowl with one coffee creamer. I was waiting for a family to return to their table as if it was in use. the waitress comes and gets us silverware. She takes our order. Me: coffee and a water, him: champagne and an orange juice. She rolled her effin eyes at him! Really Zoraya? Is his order  really going to ruin your day with your busy section of 4 tables? She didn't even refill our drinks. We are good tippers since we both are in the service industry but this lazy horrible waitress got $0.00! like I said before usually the service is great, even on champagne brunch day. Today it looked like everyone was on the same cycle.

r-plu5N2Yah8kHfyyQbkVg.text: Grossest buffet I have ever been to! After seeing a nasty wirey white hair in the chorizo, I thought I was going to throw up. Then a lady came around me and grabbed a bunch of them on her plate, I was going to tell her but I froze because of shock.  I tried to force my self to eat since I was starving, but just couldn't do it. The price was $7.99 per person and supposedly included champagne but we were never offered any and no one around us had any so we just assumed it it was just the name for a breakfast during the weekend.  The price was low enough for me to just sit there and drink coffee while my hubby had a plate of french toast and an omelet. We went to eat elsewhere right after since I hadn't eaten. The staff is rude but what do you except from a cheap buffet. They couldn't pay me enough to step foot in there again, well maybe a million dollars, ha ha. It sure does remind you that paying more for quality food and service is worth it.

0PCrDylb8Ga20b3WAG3eZA.text: The best spot for getting your grub in vegas, especially if your on a budget. Can't complain, all you can eat crawfish + only $11 for dinner. This isn't some fancy fusion bellagio $50 buffet, this is just good simple affordable food. Been here many times with family, many of the locals go here too. Compared to the price of other buffets, can't complain, service is always average and better. When you spent all your cash on clubs, crap tables, and your drunk off your a$$ this hits the spot.

N6wbYiV49V-OU5OB_I9m6w.text: The food was really good and different than the other buffets. my only complaint was that the crawfish was plain. and for a place that is supposed to resemble new orleans they should have put creole seasoning on it. i didn't like how the server was rushing us to get out of the place since it was mother's day and a line. overall most of the food was very good and the price was great.

yBGhjLXkhgsC3BxNGnyI9w.text: Went here for the Sunday champagne brunch. My family and I paid $13.99 per person. And we were promptly seated. There is quite a variety of food. There are smoked salmon, primed ribs, crab cakes, breakfast foods (i.e. blintz, pancakes, waffles, and bacon), an Asian food station (i.e. Kung Pao chicken), cheeses, a Mexican food station (with churros!), an omlette station, some crab legs, shrimp, veggies and fruits, and finally, dessert. Overall, the food tastes great. I love it. The only things I do not like are: 1) the tiny, cheap, plastic champagne glasses and 2) the infrequency of waiters/waitresses coming around asking if we were okay or if we needed anything. I waited forever to ask for more coffee or champagne. I wish there were more waiters or waitresses going around. And they also take a while to take our plates. But I am willing to look over these things because my tummy is nice and full because of French Market Buffet. And yes, I am willing to go there again.

3KM6SO5u9dyaBX3B4zGfLw.text: You can't beat this for $15.  It is worth the short drive off the strip.  Food is decent.  Staff is nice.  Great if you have a big group to feed and don't want to drop $20+ a head.

WBZYVRnkKIc1owjOFG5gNg.text: this is one of the "to go" buffet when I visit LV.  honey love their desert, especially pecan pie.  I love their craf fish and filled my plate with shrimp.  sometimes, their green chile pork stew or shredded beef for taco are really delicious.  I only go there for lunch which ends at 3pm, you can eat till 4pm before they removed everything and shifted it to dinner. with their player's card, it's only $7.99 for lunch.  No boby can beat the price for the variety of food you can get.  yes, when I went Wed lunch, they do have beef ribs, beef brisket, roast chicken at the craving table.  I mean for that price, it's much better than hometown buffet which is the only choice I have at home. not all the food taste great, just need to find what you like.  egg rolls are always fresh and crisp, they do have the mogolian dish, I never have a chance or room for that, eat too much shrimp.... anyway, as long as you set your expectation correctly, you will be happy.

sxJ7ZVvhZnljXY3j9-S_iw.text: The Orleans and Boyd did spend at lot of money to renovate the buffet.  It's too bad they put all the money into the building instead of the food.  About 5 years ago the food was good.  No I can't believe it passes the state requirements.  None of the hot food was hot.  All the food was bland.  The hubby loves the Mexican food at most buffets but everything here he said was cold and tasteless.  We had a buy one get one deal so at least it only cost us half to be so disappointed. We will not be returning to this Boyd establishment.

611KRDx6_YuPrC7U3Wbqmg.text: Fairly good place to eat. Service on drink refills was a bit slow that's why I gave it 4 stars.  Food was good and fresh.  Good selection of food.   A good place to eat if you have kids or a large group of people.  Everyone gets what they want and no waiting.

hqQI83WTTRfc0DGynfSv8w.text: I really wanted to try a buffet while in Vegas. It was New Year's Eve, so we wanted to avoid the madness of the strip until that night. We were staying fairly close to the Orleans Casino and decided to give this place a try. Many buffets off-strip didn't seem to have great reviews, and this place seemed decent while remaining reasonable priced. I don't want to spend tons of money, as I can't eat enough to properly take advantage of a buffet.  We were quite happy with the offerings at this buffet. After paying, we were seated at a table and received excellent service for drink refills and bussing. I started with some BBQ, trying the pork links, biscuit and gravy, and jerk chicken. I also tried some french fries and fish filet from the seafood section. From an American food section, I had mac and cheese. From the Asian section, I had sweet and sour chicken, potstickers, egg rolls, and lo mein. I also had a salad from the salad bar and gelato, a mini pecan pie, and a mini piece of chocolate cake for dessert. There was another Asian-inspired section and a Mexican section as well, although I didn't try those.  I liked everything that I had, with the exception of the mac and cheese. It was dry and flavorless, although others in my group seemed to like it. The biscuit for the biscuit and gravy was extremely dry, but the gravy softened it, in addition to being tasty. The Asian foods were typical, Americanized offerings but had good flavor. Everything available looked appetizing, even if it wasn't my cup of tea. The salad bar was small, but I enjoyed the balsamic vinegarette and the topping options. The balsamic and oil and vinegar were the only dressing options that weren't a fattier, mayo-based option.  I wish I could have eaten more, but there was simply wasn't enough time for us to linger to have more helpings. If you're in the area and looking for a good buffet, I don't think you'll be disappointed.

nFzWexxYiXGkGaJ_nQVEWA.text: After the NBA Summer League was over, me and a couple friends wanted to find a buffet that was decent & good priced despite being in VEGAS. I believe this hit the mark exactly. At $22, i thought this was a reasonably priced Buffet in the Orleans Hotel & Casino.  The food was A-OK in my opinion is slightly better than the average home town buffet in your local town. I got my fill and did not feel gross after lol. this Buffet worked out and 3 out of 5 is exactly the kind of food your getting. Nothing that makes you say this is good but will fill you properly.

QOSLM-Zr_UVLNfscvUA6fw.text: I would say FMB is in between  3.5 - 4 stars ~  We came here on a Sunday after much debate on what we wanted to eat and decided a buffet was perfect for a couple indecisive minds haha The price was $12.99 (with a player's card) for Sunday brunch which includes AYCD champagne~ The line moved super fast so we were happy about that and we both agreed that the food quality had improved from the last time we were here..  I really enjoyed the crawfish, prime rib, salmon filet, hot & sour soup, smoked salmon & cheese cubes.. My man couldn't get enough of the mustard hush puppy crab cakes things HAHA   The server was nice & let us know she was leaving. She also made sure we had all the drinks we needed before she left!  Nothing fancy here but you really can't beat the price and the food was actually good!   HOT TIP: Get a Player's Card!!! Price with * is with a Player's Card discount ;]]]   _Monday-Thursday Breakfast: 8:00am-10:00am  $6.99* ($7.99)   Lunch: 11:00am-3:00pm       $7.99* ($8.99)   Dinner: 4:00pm-9:00pm * Featuring Prime Rib & Shrimp Scampi $12.99*($15.99)   _Friday Breakfast: 8:00am-10:00am  $6.99* ($7.99)   Lunch: 11:00am-3:00pm       $7.99* ($8.99)   Dinner: 4:00pm-9:00pm * Featuring Prime Rib & Snow Crab   $15.99* ($20.99)   _Saturday Breakfast: 8:00am-10:00am * Featuring Champagne  $7.99* ($8.99)   Lunch: 11:00am-3:00pm * Featuring Champagne       $8.99* ($9.99)   Dinner: 4:00pm-9:00pm * Featuring Prime Rib & Snow Crab  $15.99* ($20.99)   _Sunday Brunch: 8:00am-3:00pm * Featuring Champagne  $11.99* ($13.99)   Dinner: 4:00pm-9:00pm * Featuring Prime Rib & Shrimp Scampi  $12.99* ($15.99)

Dty3PgXq_eLB0yra0ETDWQ.text: Ive eaten at a lot of the buffet's in Vegas, but this one at The Orleans is the best. All of their food was great, and I don't think I came across anything that i did not like. Service was also amazing, never had an empty glass. I definitely recommend this place! I will be coming back.

qy2wINI3-gYDY-VD5cu5gg.text: New Buffett at the Orleans. Newly remodeled and branded. It was a good solid Buffet experience.

n1P5BbT4Fv20exPETlLPew.text: Let's be honest here. This is not Caesars Palace but that doesn't mean that it's not a good buffet for the venue you're eating it at.  To start with, understand that this is actually owned by a corporation that owns several different casinos here in town most of them called Coast. For example Gold Coast, Suncoast.  Which means you're going to get simular quality at all of these buffets but the Orleans is actually slightly above the cut of the others.  I'm only going to be talking about the seafood night, because if you pay a few dollars more it's the only night that it makes sense to go.  So, Friday nights are Seafood night. Typically in Las Vegas this is the night that most of the hotels put out Seafood.  It makes sense doesn't it? People get paid on Fridays, Seafood is consumed when people get paid and have extra money, unlike the strip hotels which can jack their prices up and put the food out every day of the week this is how the local hotels and casinos operate for seafood.  Okay, so what are you getting here?  Well, in addition to the regular fare, you're also getting snow crap period The Orleans snow crab is pretty decent. It's not skinny and small and actually quite large compared to other hotels here in town.  It comes served cold but you can also take it over to the Mongolian cooking station and have it heated up for you with different spices which is something that no one else offers.  Word of warning though, if you're like me and you can't eat seafood then you should probably avoid the Mongolian station all together. They literally cross contaminate like crazy which is the only reason I can't give the early and so True 5 star review.  Everything else at the buffet is actually quite good. The food is fresh and turned over on a regular basis.  The dessert bar is actually great they have gelato and lots of different desserts for anybody's tastes. Make room for dessert when you go to this one.  I can only assume that the rest of the week is just like Friday nights but just without Seafood with the exception of shrimp. I highly recommend the Orleans versus the other local hotels here in Las Vegas because the quality is pretty darn good the wait times are low and the service is great.

cLTuWSXjw277DTxH6dkC4Q.text: The renovation looks good but the food is awful. If you're looking for bad food and bad service in a good looking buffet, this place will work for you.   I went to the renovated buffet the week they opened. While the food was disappointing, there were a few items that were edible and I thought it showed promise. I went back today and I could barely find anything worth eating.  Anything that cost more than a few pennies to slop up was removed since their grand opening.   They raised prices but lowered their food quality with the reopening.  In just a week food quality has fallen dramatically. If they keep this up they will just be serving ten versions of potatoes and twenty variations of cabbage  and some rice with nothing else soon. Instead of crispy fried chicken they had frozen pre-fried chicken wings which were cold, soggy and disgusting. Instead of a rich oxtail stew they had dried out "roasted" sweet potatoes. The clams and mussels were replaced with shells that were pretty much devoid of anything else. Their BBQ ribs were so over cooked and dry they were worse than jerky.    Service was terrible as well. Waitress was very nice but she could not keep up with all her tables and our dishes were piled high and sitting there throughout the meal.   It's such bad management to invest so much money and effort into creating a gorgeous new buffet only to ruin it by basically serving reheated the cheapest frozen foods out of some deep discount food warehouse.  I was really looking forward to this new buffet and utterly disappointed.  My review may be a bit harsh and overly critical but Ii really want management to fix this buffet.  There is so much potential to have a destination worthy buffet at the Orleans.   I hope management rethinks their strategy and decides they should do better ... it's hard to do worse.

jwgUGhClFu2LZQ-hCVb9Pw.text: You definitely get your money's worth here. It's clean, spacious, and there are a lot of great offerings. We were there for breakfast, and there was an omelette station, waffles, fresh fruits, blintzes, traditional breakfast meats, and also a mexican station.   I think all the Boyd properties have some great buffets, but this one is hands down a favorite. Definitely worth a short drive from the strip.

G_eiW_U2E6JOdzGbYwLRwg.text: This review is for the Friday night seafood buffet.  $31.99 for subpar food.  Before the renovation, the price was cheaper and the food was so much better.  King crab was also on the seafood buffet, but not anymore.  The crab legs were so skinny like the Chinese food buffet and the meat did not come out in 1-piece.  No matter what you did, the meat kept breaking apart and stuck in the shell.  The oysters had quite a bit of shell in the meat.  Luckily the crawfish was huge and the dungenous crab was pretty good.    Prime rib was non existent but roast beef was on the menu.  When the prime rib did come out, it looked very dry and unappealing.  Everything else was just "average."  If you are charging $31.99 premium price for a seafood buffet dinner, the food better be up to par with the price that is charged.  Unfortunately, you are paying for their renovations with a lower quality food product than when it was the French Market Buffet.  Sadly I uses to love this buffet, but now I will never frequent this place as the quality has gone downhill.  The breakfast buffet is just as bad.  Please make the necessary changes if you want to charge strip buffet prices.

tC3UDyWua1-IvRhsfGepYw.text: Meh! We went for lunch for the first time since the renovation. Large selection of food items with beef brisket and boneless ribs topping my personal favorites! Dessert Station is so so. I had a 2 for 1 coupon so the price was reasonable. Without the coupon I feel the price is too high for lunch.

zUWZ3X65dzi7x3MPvLr0AA.text: French Market Buffet at "The Orleans Hotel" Overall 4 Stars  Gold medal - BEST Fried Chicken Wings Silver medal - Great service Bronze medal - Great price  The name is a bit deceiving.  It is not french food, but a mixture of Mexican, Chinese, Italian, & American.  Lots to choose from!  They have the BEST fried chicken.  It was crispy and juicy!!  I want more!!  They also had like 4 other types of chicken items.  Lots of variety to choose from.  The service is really a hit or miss, but during this last visit......... It was a HIT.  The server was super fast, nice, and attentive.  Every time we were done with our dishes he was there to clean it up.  He came by offering refills without us having to flag him down.  He was great. I even over tipped him.  We went on Saturday during Memorial Day weekend.  They did not increase the price to Holiday pricing, which was nice.  It was still $10.99 for lunch.  If you have a players card you, +1 guest are $1 off each.  $9.99 for a HUGE buffet selection is not bad at all!  HAPPY OVEREATING!!

NMGNun1PafNbLKxKWf_E4Q.text: The worst buffet ever. Every single thing I have tried tasted so bad that I left it on the plate. I went in hungry I left hungry. I dont get all this good reviews about this place. Their food is tasteless, taste old, cold and just bland. Ah wait the only thing I ate was the watermelon and a piece of pineapple those were good. So, I pretty much paid 16 bucks for 2 pieces of water melon and 2 piece of pineapple oh well. Will not go back, there are so many good buffets with better food for the same price.

4MMwXvzU4X-sI0MDesyWCA.text: Food was mediocre at best. No way I'd ever go here to spend $45 on my wife and I again. I'd sooner go to Golden Corral or just about any other restaurant in Las Vegas. The fried chicken was dry and difficult to chew. The best desert was the ice cream, although the lady behind the counter was pretty rude. Their saving grace was that their steak was cooked pretty well but was bland and they had no A1 and the sauces they did have were disgusting. Especially their honey bourbon barbecue sauce tasted like it was 90% alcohol. I'm not usually a picky person but if I'm going to spend $22.50 a person the food has to be better than that.

VPpSrPUoCD8ok2xEPpCDNw.text: Rude cashiers and hosts, some grouchy (rib and meat cutters) and nice (ice cream server) people behind the food counter, nice server, okay food. Don't waste your time or go when you're super hungry.

ERvi6LWqJG0X5mAwa_Wejg.text: Well ... Went to vegas this weekend and always try to hit this buffet , but this trip the buffet went south. We went for the breakfast/brunch and were very hungry. The food was sub par to say the least ... Lousy flavor , bland.   The eggs benedict went right into the trash after the first bite . The corned beef hash was good , as were the bisquits and gravy , but that is where it stopped ... Everything else was horrid.   The link sausages tasted very strange and were pushed away from me.  I used to fatten up here and hit the dessert bar BUT after chewing on muck , i passed on dessert ( which i never do ! ). My appetite for later was ruined as i spent most of the day and evening grasping the sides of the toilet with fire ass !   Although i am kinda pissed , i hope in the future there is more care in the way food is made .....

s8CFO6JZLZx6b-1JauMw5w.text: Came here lunch time on a weekday. Surprisingly long wait in line (maybe ~20-30min) but the line moved fairly quickly.  Nothing too special about this buffet. There's a lot of different options but beyond that, the flavor does not call for a repeat visit....EXCEPT the beef brisket. That was fantastic and I was so surprised. Juicy, fatty, great flavor and seasoning. A MUST get before you fill up with everything else. Because everything else is standard and not great.  Pros: Selection. Each section has a different theme to it so you can pick and choose what you're feeling. Big dessert and salad islands in the middle, but nothing special about the desserts, just your standard selection. Service is good, they're attentive with clearing plates and getting refills. And to be fair, at ~$12 for a buffet, this place offers quite a lot, and is worth the costs.

qmh1R9kWEZNii_u6it0n9A.text: We came here to eat the Sunday Brunch and it didn't disappoint.  The line was not that long and the guy working the desk allowed us to go get a Players card and come back to the front of the line.  You get a dollar off just cause you have a players card.  The Sunday Brunch was from 8:00 am - 3:00 pm and it was only $16.99.  Free Champagne was Served to Guests throughout the meal.  The Buffet restaurant was packed and the price was worth every PENNY!  On the buffet line going from right to left he French Market Buffet had many different dishes to choose from.  I had to get two dishes, a plate of meat like i was on the atkins diet and one plate of everything else. They had Italian, Mongolian, Barbecue, American, Seafood, Mexican and Chinese food as well as an huge dessert bar with plenty of desserts to choose from.  They had some delicious bbq pork ribs and yummy smoked ribs.  The Smoked Ribs to me was the highlight of the meal.  The bacon was nice and crispy.   My lady had sushi and she hit the huge salad bar that they offered.  She also got her some sushi which she truly enjoyed.  Overall, One of the best buffets I have ever been too. I would have gave them a five.  My only complaint was that the Crawfish and jambalaya that they offered didn't taste like back home.  Need a little bit more salt but I will Definitely be visiting this casino and its buffet again in the future.

usHQJEi8Zqin5r7OUbH0Xg.text: I gave a 4 instead of 5 rating for the waitress not the food! She had a lousy attitude.   We Always make it to the French Market Buffet! Very tasty selections. Over the years have tried many Vegas Buffets..Aria, MGM, Mirage (when it was Great b4 Cravings) Bellagio, Caesar Palace on and on!  But we never leave Vegas without eating here. Sunday February 12th we tried their Sunday Brunch! OMG delicious! I never made it to the pancakes I came for! But the made to order Omelet and the Hush puppy Fried Shrimp were Ridiculously Fantastic....should have eaten more of them!

DoETgwUwepzGBT85Mah_cQ.text: The ratio of walkers to wheelchairs here is rather high.  That's not say that I'm against either.  Just that, I felt as if I was visiting my grandparents in their assisted-living home's restaurant.    The lasagna tasted like the best Chef Boy-Ar-Dee's I've ever had.    The cheese enchiladas were great until you tried the second one and realized that it's almost all sauce and the enchilada themselves have no True shape.  Rather, it's just a coagulated gelatinous glob of cheese and something that tries to be a sauce of some sort.    The shrimp are small and have all of their little shrimp feet intact.  If you enjoy using your napkin to often wipe the taste of the sad misery of the ocean floor off your fingers, this place is for you.  The top portion of the bread pudding tastes like bread pudding.  About a half inch down, though, it turns to jelly.  Jelly fused with a raisin or two.  Be sure to add lots of the vanilla sauce to mask the True flavor of this delicacy.  All of this for nearly $40.    Next time, I'll just skip a meal and weep quietly in darkness - that actually sounds like it might leave a better taste in my mouth.

XyjQdPrGmjs7mzkNar3gjw.text: French Market Buffet is located in The Orleans Casino Hotel. I had the Saturday Champagne Brunch for approx. $10/person. (There is a $1 discount if you have their player's card.) After seating me, the waitress promptly took my drink order.  You can order champagne from the waitress but I chose not to drink the champagne.    Buffet food selection: French Market Buffet offers a selection of food ranging from American to Asian.  As expected, the selection is not as grand as buffets located on the Strip; however, there was a good variety of food for the price paid.  The food was reasonably tasty.  There is also an omelet bar (my fav!) where one can order an omelet with ingredients that include ham, sausages, bacon, cheese, green peppers, mushrooms, etc.  My omelet was delectable!  Desserts: The coconut macaroons and chocolate cake was super delicious.  The waitress refilled my drink without me asking.  The facility was clean and well-kept.  Overall, I had a pleasant experience and will return mainly for the price.

oFZ2WwN2brbnJ9RiFHT82w.text: Yuck!  I would never visit this place again for dinner!  Food quality is poor, selection is okay, but the food is not that great.  The food was not hot - the desserts looked much better than they tasted.  We went as a family with 4 kids and 2 adults $103 for dinner...  We arrived at 3:05 PM, we were told it was too late for lunch, and were told they closed from 3-4PM (for dinner transition).  They would not let us in even though we did not care about dinner...  We ended up waiting it out at the bowling alley (non smoking area) and then came down at 4 PM and waited in line for 25 minutes!  When we finally got to eat we were very disappointed.  This place is much worse than our local casino back home at Tulalip!  Kids are FULL PRICE!  Food selection is well below average for a casino in Vegas, food quality was below average for Vegas...  I will not be back!  Very disappointed - I went there based on all of these reviews, sad I can't share the same positive feedback.  This place is only one step above old country buffet...  Save your money - eat elsewhere for dinner.

LQeVOk1XD41CyJvjm_4WqQ.text: Decent lunch buffet, with variety. Good price. Tried the beef brisket and ribs, which got great reviews from others--good flavor, but lots of fat on them. Most of the food was bland. Definitely save room for the dessert bar. Deep-dish pecan pie was quite tasty. Oreo cake was good too.

Z6mlQrWaUHB9iCkoyR_Iag.text: Went during lunch time. Wait was long to pay, and then another long wait to be seated. Food was average, there are better buffets to choose from if you are willing to pay a couple of extra bucks.  For the price, you get what you pay for.  Waitress was friendly.

y3UIVGUEK6UwNg100BQVkQ.text: You kind of have to go to a buffet while you're in Vegas, right? This one has a fantastic selection at a reasonable price: italian, mexican, asian, cajun, fried things, meat stuff, soups, salad, and an especially impressive dessert variety: ice cream, cakes, pies, danishes, all kinds of stuff! I went at breakfast, so they had breakfast things too like waffles, omeletes, and pancakes. The dishes were hit or miss quality wise, as generally to be expected at a buffet, but the majority of it was quite good, and the beauty of a buffet is that you can try all kinds of stuff and eat more of what you like! I think my favorite dishes were the shrimp/cheese enchilada, churros, mashed potatoes, crabcakes, and apple crumble. And convenient if you're staying in the hotel!

ZdaWrXw-JPtS0uizVjLGCw.text: The food here is "okay."  Ate here for breakfast and dinner and they definitely carry some items over from one meal to the other.  For example, the breakfast fruit (cantaloupe, honeydew, watermelon) will turn into a fruit salad for the dinner menu.  The menu offerings do not vary day after day.   Shrimp cocktail and crawdads are very popular as people take them by the platefuls back to their seats.  Most of the items I had were slightly warm at best, including the soups.   There are 2 salad bars that have different toppings and salad dressings.  The soups are the same on both sides though.    Best part of the meal is the gelato bar for lunch/dinner.  They offer about 8 different varieties including: mango, mint chocolate chip, lemon, raspberry , caramel, white chocolate, vanilla, etc...  Slightly disappointed that this place lacks any FRENCH food.  (French salad dressing doesn't count!)  After all, this is the French Market buffet, a crepe station or hot/fresh benets would be nice.

YOa4c3d2a7qB_Q6IiuecFQ.text: My favorite buffet in vegas, every time I come to vegas I make sure to stop by here. The food is really great and the prices arent too bad, especially for a buffet in vegas. Plus the dessert section is amazing.

H-V-plZF7SkzIeaIPvM0-w.text: Their quality has gotten better and this is a run of the mill average buffet. Neither good nor bad, and they often have coupons that come in the mail.

56YQsXG7XZPMufB-I4MJZA.text: Brunch gives you all the breakfast staples:  Corned beef hash = reminds me of dog food, but maybe that's just corned beef hash Eggs Benedict  Waffles/pancakes/French toast = really dry Omelets = dry and the "extras" didn't taste fresh  Bacon/sausage Scrambled eggs = Really runny, I could actually slurp it up Chicken fried steak = super dry, gravy mediocre  Sweet potato pancake = the one thing that is actually ok, best thing in the buffet Hash browns = ok, can't screw those up! Syrup = super thin and runny

2umle9i8TIk85ICbcwJQDQ.text: So I'm a fan of breakfast, aren't you? Well, $7.99 per person & all you can eat :D Mon-Sat 7am-10pm Sun 8am-10pm I came in around 9:45am & was lucky to get some lunch food with purchasing the breakfast price. (useful information, don't you agree?) ;) So on with the food... Yes, it does the stomach good. Chocolate waffles, make your own omelet, unlimited bacon. Yum! And the perfect drink to compliment your breakfast: O.J. There's a lot of selections and a fruit/dessert bar is available also. This place isn't one for top-notch, but it satisfies my pocket and tummy.

n-_9dAVIqr_3sDRGU_hjHA.text: Located inside the Orleans casino, the only reason I went was because I had a free comp. Asian, mexican, american, mongolian bbq are some of the varities of food available.  The quality and turn over of the buffets was so bad that I doubt I would go back even if I have another free comp. The best thing about dining here was that I got lucky at the craps table after dinner.

CpAD_nkm0idnZLhMEVgXFw.text: While working I was talking to a bus driver who I will call "JOE"( because THATS HIS NAME!!) & we were talking "Buffets" & he said I had to try this one. So to show what truly nice people I have encountered thus far in Las Vegas, Joe not only makes a recommendation to this place, BUT gives me a $4 off coupon & meets me on Tropicana Ave to give it to me and drives me there with his wife & daughter as they were on their way to run errands. HOW COOL IS THAT?? (Answer: VERY!!)   So I ended up paying $5 and change for this AWESOME Buffet using the coupon. And let me tell you now THIS PLACE IS HUGE!! The entire dining area has to be as big as a basketball court if not bigger. And for the size and the crowd on hand, it was a very nice and orderly atmosphere, well lit and pleasantly quiet with no crying babies and no standing up "Peekers" looking over the back of the booth I was sitting in. (I like to feed them string beans!!)  I asked to be seated in a booth and was gladly told to sit wherever I wanted. There are several stations = BBQ, American, Mongolian, Chinese, Mexican, Italian and a HUGE island of deserts.  I made a good attempt to try as many items from as many stations as I could and ended up liking the Chinese station the best that had spring noodles mixed wt vegetables & Beef  that was really fresh and good.  Joe had really pushed the BBQ Beef ribs saying they were the best but the selection the day I went had ALOT of fat on them and I had to pick at them to take it off. And while I'm complaining I might add that the onion rings, fried fish & chicken fried steak had ALOT of breading on them that had me picking at it as well. Other than that though I really cant complain and have to give this place 2 thumbs up.  The Mexican station was extremely good with beef tacos and all the toppings and a spicy shredded chicken that made nice tacos as well. There were other selections such as enchaladas etc and it all looked very good.  The Italian station had speghetti, lasagna, pizza that all looked really good too. I have a sliver of a slice and it was very good and crispy and I tried a couple pcs of eggplant parmesean and it was off the hook good .  There was also peel n eat shrimp wt tartar & cocktail sauce as well as crawfish which looked good and I had one and still cannot see what the draw to these things are as its alot of work for very little pay-off in the way of meat. I chose to stick wt the shrimp & mixed them in wt my Chinese noodles mix & sliced open a couple spring rolls and put them inside. I always "shrimp out" my spring rolls!!  The aforementioned Desert Island had a little of everything = soft serve ice cream, strawberry & whipped cream toppings, scooped Ice Cream, Gellato, Pies, Cakes, Cheesecake, & cobblers. I tried the Coconut Cream Pie and the filling was off the hook (I had 2 pcs and had to stop myself from getting more!!) but the crust was soft and mushy-like and not to my liking at all and I didnt eat it. I also tried some soft serve Vanilla Ice cream  wt whipped cream and the taste of the shortening in the whipped cream came through and more cream & sugar was needed.  The waitstaff seemed nice enough but my Ice Water was'nt refilled, nor was I asked if I needed a refill. I didn,t so it wasnt really a big deal. The girl taking the plates off the table seemed to be working the hardest and I felt bad for her and took my plates up myself several times. I also hid a dollar under my dish within a dish so she would find it and not the waiter as she deserved it more than the waiters did.  Overall I have to recommend this buffet not only for the wide variety and selection, but the quality and good food offered. I only paid $5, but had I paid full price it would have still been worth it.

kJkI4OcxRoQz0-bnDa_uEg.text: Cost considered, this place is a great bang for your buck.  Food tastes good,  surprisingly the coffee is high quality.

7xcnU6cQJ5bX9ily0Didag.text: 3.4  I've had better food and the same quality of food for way more money in Vegas buffets.  What this place supplies is reasonable food at a price point less than many of the other buffets around.  I went for their steak and crab Wednesday, $15,99 less a dollar discount for being a guest at the hotel.  The crab legs were spindly and the steak was a bit tough but cooked to the medium I asked for.  The swordfish wasn't bad and I noticed several folks with whole plates of crawfish.  Many of the folks seemed to be locals and although I had no wait at 5:00 by the time I was done the place was full and a long line had formed.  They do not rush the diners in the restaurant.  There were plenty of food choices.  I gave up after 4 plates, the last of which was desert.  Because of the number of people everything I tried was still hot or cold as needed.  The vanilla soft serve had given up so I had chocolate ice cream with my peach cobbler.  The service was really quick and I noticed those folks requiring bar service got their drinks quickly.  My one big complaint was my plates got cleared while I was getting another and my service, complete with whatever was on them, was set on the table rather than waiting for me to get back and transfer them to my new plate so I would get a separate plate to put them on on the first trip.    For the price this was an excellent value.

AA2y--crPk1yvBYbFqHs2w.text: I wondered why my dad took me here several years ago. Its because its cheap and almost a good competition to Rio's World Buffet. I think the price is $8 per person for lunch. I did not have a Orleans Club Card, but $8 is a deal. The Sahara Hotel has $8.99 Buffet with a Card, but with the Orleans, you probably would save $1 or $2. I remember my total was around $16. Very Good Deal!!  They had Salad, Mexican or Tex-Mex Station, Chinese Station, American, Italian, and their own big Dessert Station. I mainly went to American Station since I always fall in love with Mac N Cheese. I had sandwiches, and bunch of other Americana stuff. They had a lot of food, but I only had three plates. Like my headline says...I am a Big Guy, but I don't eat a lot.  Orleans is away from the strip, but somewhat is small scaled version of the Rio. Orleans has their French Market Buffet and Rio has their World Buffet. If you are on a budget and not wait a long line...go to the Orleans. Its pretty cheap for lunch without a Club Card and food is better than the Sahara Buffet and probably as close to the Rio Buffet without the high price.   Lunch Ends around 3:30pm. Not sure what time Dinner starts during the weekdays. Very reasonable and not too crowded, but the food is very good and not seem too be mass-produced.  Have Fun here and Keep Yelping!!

QUsBJTY9b3Ngd6moeSXT1g.text: It was Sunday and we didn't want Champagne brunch.  So, this buffet offered a regular breakfast buffet for less $$.  We happily dined here for our breakfast!    The food was decent.  The selection was pretty good for breakfast, they served the usual breakfast items but they also had Italian, Chinese, Seafood selections as well.  It was good!

lDzwUB2ZaMEnHOb2hWRyrw.text: For someone that enjoys the Vegas buffets and has been to 50 of them this is by far the worst one in did not like any of the food the clientele where the worst I have ever experience, if you want a cheap Buffett try Fremont.

0gpFzdvvJuHPr1IWBsqC5g.text: 3.45872 Stars.  This is by far the BEST of the ghetto (ahem) excuse me....economical casino buffets in town.  We get coupons here every once in a while and the champagne brunches and steak/seafood nights are decent but this is pretty much a place I would only go maybe every 3 months at best.  The BBQ station is probably my favorite.

A8fz_Ad7yrWO1CnOlhGz1Q.text: You will find a couple items you like here, but overall, this is only a buffet I would  go to if I was staying at the hotel and did not feel like heading out to a better one because it's pretty basic.  I found a couple items I enjoyed, namely this Hawaiian shredded pork dish.  But the salad bar is sad, no bread to speak of.  For the price, it's not bad, but it is worth spending more to experience better quality and selection.  Would have gotten a 2, but I recall they surprised me with a pretty good dessert item at the end.

m3b6j2Rw5ZR_aBuwJz6N8Q.text: Average is the best way to describe this buffet. It's reasonably priced. The service was fine. Of course there was a wide range of choices. The healthy options were actually pretty good. As were the desserts. The biggest disappointment was what they called brisket in the BBQ station. Basically it was awfully similar to eating at Golden Corral.

d8m8dPNez88xv8BreU_AXQ.text: It's not bad for the price. Lots of different choices, from around the world, including desserts. I always eat too much whenever I eat here. Bring your big appetite, Because there is so many choices. There is quite often a line, so be ready for that. It is inside the Orleans Hotel and Casino, if you're a guest here you get a discount on your meal here.

PkOEBbHc6GykeFNgnJegVQ.text: This place is pretty good and really good for the price. Compared to other places I've been that cost more or the food sucked I will come back here again the next time I'm in Vegas.

5qXiM998YNtbOV6XAt_DRA.text: Steak night buffet cost $21 + tax . The food and services were ok. I liked bean sup , it taste very good. Weekend come here with friend eating and gambling . Happpppyyyyy if you win..,,,,

photos.caption: Photo of Medley Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Medley Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

rJ54cSruFtoZ01pU84EzSg.text: Haven't been to the Orleans dinner buffet in quite a while...went there tonight, a Monday, for their prime rib featured buffet.  Guess the prices have recently been raised, with my club card, it still cost me $16.50.  Prime rib was dry (I tried it 2 or 3 times--the au jus didn't help...recovering from over eating while I type this), the rest of the selections were truly average and unremarkable.  Compared to other LAS buffets on a Monday night, there are much better (a) values and (b) quality to be had.  Very disappointed, unlikely I'll return to the Orleans feeding frenzy in the future.  Didn't use to be like this...

ADIin4g3iRoPSRT5_e_AQA.text: Nice spread with Mexican, Mangolian, Sea Food, Chinese, Omlete station, BBQ .. We had 3 days of lunch here. Beware of Sundays lol.. They charge double for Sunday Brunch which has few more dishes (Crab Cake, Salmon with stuffed crab, Steak)... This buffet is economy in mon-sat like 13$ per person and has good spread of dishes to try.  Try it.

S4AEa2Xg6IOTuCUP1WAUEQ.text: Went here tonight for the Saturday night BBQ Buffet. About $24 including tax and drink. So not bad on the wallet. Buffet overall was just OK. Not really a BBQ buffet as claimed but they did have a good variety of different ribs and some sausage. But no other True BBQ meats. For example when I think of BBQ I think of brisket, pulled pork, BBQ hot link, Yams, Sweet tea and banana pudding. Which they had none of.  I was actually happily surprised by the Craw fish they were huge. The rest of the buffet was just OK and As far as desserts they were terrible very cheap and very little quality.

DTcEfYgl7hzN-I2KVt-yRg.text: This buffet has gone downhill. The overall prices without discounts are 21.99, which is not worth your money because the food is less than ok. The fish tastes like its been frozen for months and the pastas are watery or too dry... the Chinese and Mexican food were ok and the American food was worse than mediocre. The desserts were good, especially the gelato. Overall, don't come here to eat unless you are dying of starvation!

Tfc9idNz4_9VeKyoz8aR0A.text: Rarely eat at buffets but we were seeing movie so seemed a good place for lunch. The wait to get in was awful. We could see plenty of empty tables and people leaving but they did not have enough staff. Food was so-so. Key lime pie and their gelato very good. Wouldn't do it again.

ZWjYNpvvX20FVu-Sf-xzoA.text: Went to the breakfast buffet around 10am. There were only five people in line ahead of myself and my guest and we were seated quickly. I got the usual: bacon, scrambled eggs, and ham. My guest had eggs Benedict and granola and fruit-- didn't like the fruit or the terrible tasting Benedict. The bacon was very salty. The ham was a little salty, and the eggs were just ok. Service was ok. I will probably go back for dinner sometime. But the breakfast is not the best. I remember it being better, but not this day. The price was good with a players discount, came to $15 for two.

RK0WGtCHI9D3oJfnTB53JA.text: This buffet is located in the Orleans hotel, which is not on the main strip.  My family introduced me to this place because it was a favorite of my grandmother's when she went to Vegas.  There's a free shuttle that takes off from Bill's Gamblin' Hall and brings you to Orleans.  It runs every 15 min from 9am to midnight.    The food is good!  I recommend going straight for the crawfish and beef ribs.  They are the "signature" items!  The crawfish is boiled in a cajun style broth has great flavor without being too spicy.  The beef is super tender and well seasoned.  The good thing is that because these are very popular items, they're constantly being replenished.  Aside from these two items, everything else was okay.  I sampled the gumbo, mushroom stir fry, and a few of their desserts.  All were good, but I spent most of my time eating crawfish!  At $7.99 for lunch and $13.99 for dinner, this place is one of the best buffet values I've seen.  I will definitely be a returning customer!

photos.caption: Photo of Medley Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Decor at Orleans
Photo of Medley Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crawfish and Beef Ribs!  Yum!

Jq4iOmD8MsUOj_YAUqNFUw.text: Went there an while back, had 2-1, The food was good, the service was great. Beats what is on the strip, and for half of the price. Been going back for at least an year at least 2 an month, never had nothing bad there.

ZlcQI4Hz08oqwvT4WKBJ6g.text: Great Value. When we lived in Vegas we ate here often and it remains one of the best buffets for the dollar in town.  There's a wide variety of foods to choose from.  The wait staff is fast, friendly and very efficient.

ZUbSz_oJ3fdE0qc6tOdNZQ.text: do not come here while under construction!!! i loved the buffet at the orleans but its under construction so yhey have us in a different place. i thought the place was under construction not the food. very disappointing, great serving, horrible food.

Z2FTiaiaoxJb3GZ17GwRJA.text: This was the first time I'd been to this buffet. Went for dinner and it wasn't bad for the price. Plenty of selections. Soft serve was a little too sweet, but there are plenty of other options.

19PRucS5vGkQ8Z6HUm0iFg.text: I would not recommend!  Nothing was exceptional at all. Lots of choices but nothing was great. Service was ok. Prime rib was raw.  Mexican food was not good.  Chinese was not good. Desserts were average. Pizza like frozen. Shrimp were tiny and peel and eat.  Workers behind Buffett seamed disinterested in their jobs.

2l5i3UmwX9IBL9po8wWfJg.text: we came for champagne brunch. $12.99 with my players card... not too shabby.   the menu items were diverse and bountiful. i was quite suprised, considering the "classic" stature of the hotel, how fresh and varied the food was. granted it was $3 champagne, it was still a great deal.   they offered all kinds of different cuisine. mexican, italian, american, asian, a good sized salad/grilled veggie bar and a huge dessert bar. they also had an omelet station. the sections had typical items, enchiladas, pastas, bbq, cornbeef hash, shrimp, mussels, ham, roast beef,, corn on the cob, kung pao beef and most anything you can think of. each section was very well tended and replenished. the areas were clean and all the food looked delicious. the champagne lady came around frequently too.   for the price and selection, this was an extremely awesome champagne brunch buffet.

photos.caption: Photo of Medley Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. dixie cups for champagne brunch

GViIezGBFf60fdDu749c6g.text: For the price this is a good buffet.  Everybody is friendly and the overall quality is good. They have several stations so the selection is good for enough to make my family happy.

Grij33AIEXFs98w1qskdIQ.text: Saturday is Seafood Night, no fried shrimp, no fried fish.  The vegetables were cold and the only thing worth eating were the shaved snow crab legs were good, but cold and the boiled shrimp was not peeled and cold too.   Desserts were sloppy looking and picked over ---we were there at 7 pm.  Waitress was slow and every time we got up seed to have a big cart in the one path in and out to our table area, which was piled with filthy dishes.  It was kinda disgusting.    My recommendation is to skip this buffet.

ZKVG0HTmMeneNYesi7XFXw.text: We had a large party of 13, so was a bit challenging getting us in, but we all waited for a few tables.  The selections are good, there is a BBQ section with beef ribs, chicken, bbq beans, corn bread, a New Orleans section with Jambalya, gumbo, collard greens, mud bugs and red beans and rice, a Chinese section of fried rice, noodles, char Sui, a carving board section of roasted chicken, turkey and roast beef, gravy mashed potatoes, an Italian section of pastas and pizzas.  A salad and soup bar and a dessert section with selections for diabetics.  Serve was nice, refilled our sodas, Walter and coffee.  There is just nothing that jumps out at you that says delicious, mediocre buffet food, the crawfish was good, collard greens good, hush puppies good, roasted turkey was dry, gravy ok, couldn't find the bread.  Ice cream or the gelato was very fluffy/airy, not a good texture, soft serve I passed, the cookies were ok.  Again, nothing stands out at this buffet.

LqgUCt9s8ITSxeUkChxRpA.text: Great buffet,  newly remodeled,  added more to the menu and better quality food! Big difference from before.. We caught the dinner buffet $18.99 with a player's card.. Well worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of Medley Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate cheesecake 5/5, fruit tart 5/5, blueberry cheesecake good but no crust,  and creme brulee needs caramelized sugar on top!
Photo of Medley Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menudo a little bland,  elotes 4/5
Photo of Medley Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef ribs,  potato salad,  and dinner roll all good!

gGFcB_0-T6igMQW5nEkV6A.text: I am not a big buffet fan in general, but I was told the breakfast was great so in I went. The wait to be seated seemed avoidable as there were open 4 seat tables and booths. We were seated and greeted by Nena who took our drink order and we were on our way. Alot of good looking options, 2 omlet bars and a carving station for ham, meatloaf and sausage. Most of the food I tried was great and tasted fresh. I tried the cheese blintsz, a mini waffle, pancake, 3 different sausages, bacon and french toast and I cleaned my plates. I went back an tried their mexican bar, I had a taco some refried beans, a few tornados, guac, chilaquiles and a basket of chips. This is where that one star faded away. The food from the mexican bar had no defining flavors, nothing memorable, everything in a way tasted the same. The sauces were tame and didn't highlight any tastes in any of the foods. The chips in the baskets were chewy. The service was phenomenal and the majority of the food was fresh tasting and great. Try it out you're bound to find something you like with so many choices.

photos.caption: Photo of Medley Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Most of the food I tried was great! I would come back.

5GQrqy-nJwq7b6l4nGSKFg.text: Good food. Good selection. Good  price The waitress we had was very slow we had to keep asking for things. That's the only bummer but the espresso bar and the ceviche is why I will keep going back

9B5G6PI9G9d9iroEBmvdnQ.text: This buffet does not go the extra mile for there guests if you ask them to rinse off a apple that is on the buffet they give you a weird look and pretend they don't understand what you are saying   I would not recommend this buffet

OaCgQ4EBWLLQcaS2bEduGw.text: PLEASE READ!  I went to the Medley Buffet last night (Nov. 2nd).  I don't generally go to buffets but our shuttle from the Worldmark on Tropicana makes two stops, one of which is the Orleans Hotel.  My friend and I ate different foods at the buffet, none of which seemed to have any flavor.  The NY strip steak was tough, the tacos were sitting under heating lamps and the sauce had soaked through the corn tortillas, the desserts lacked flavor, etc.  Within an hour of getting back to our hotel rooms, we were both sick and actually up all night.  Since we both ate different foods, I can't exactly say what it was.  Basically, I paid $50 for two people to get sick on vacation.  Please don't say I didn't warn you.

DQd61nns0U3-tgpa_y_r0Q.text: The food wasn't worth the price first of all and I found a hair on my sirloin Steak which was tough not even soft. I have been to cheaper buffets where the food is prepared better. When I spoke to a supervisor about the hair she said they can't control hair and there was nothing she could do about it. You would think as a paying customer, you would receive a refund but nope. Never coming bAck to this buffet definitely! I rather spend my money else where!

5jptI7nebkS1ScWQFJWWWQ.text: The Medley Buffet was average. We went for Sunday Brunch and it was ok. The food was good except the eggs benedict and shrimp pasta. The shrimp did not taste fresh. The mimosas were extremely weak. I question if there was any champagne. The decor was nice and the wait was short. I would go again but it was not 4 stars.

KyceiEcG8I2-gTfcGeUZMA.text: I had never been to the Orleans.  But my parents were in town and I agreed to meet them out in Vegas for Christmas.  Since they were staying there, we thought it would be great to try a different buffet.  They usually stay at the California and we always eat at the Main Street Station buffet.  The French Market is good...very good.  What I really like is the variety!  I tried a little of almost everything, but of the stuff that I like.  Yes, I managed to do three plates and a couple desserts.  The staff is very friendly which is great!  The woman who took care of us even joked around with me.  She: I forgot your mom's tea bags...they are on my station, can you go and get them? Me: Oh, okay...(as I start getting up) She: I'm just playing....I'll be right back  I was actually going to go and get them!  I wouldn't say that this buffet just knocked me off my feet (I have yet to find that one), but the food offerings are fresh, tasty, and plentiful.  I would definitely eat here again!
