ZbharNCT9Vt5Yv3ZQ3gBwQ.text: Very, very disappointed.  We frequented this buffet before the BIG CHANGE. The food was always good. Lunch or dinner. We went for lunch a few days ago. The food has changed drastically. The potatoes in the potato salad were CRUNCHY. Couldn't eat it. The greens were SUPER SALTY. Couldn't eat it. The black-eyed peas were CRUNCHY. Couldn't eat it.  No hush puppies or cornbread. NO CATFISH!!!  They offered planks of pollock that looked AND tasted like they came out of a box of a GENERIC brand of frozen fish!!!

CDye6xaAEMBPiLdmFsBU-w.text: We visited Medley Buffet while staying at The Orleans Resort and Casino in Las Vegas. We were given a Buy 1 Get 1 Comp on our gaming cards. This buffet runs $21 p/p & $32 p/p on Sunday's. John said it must be good. Let's try it. This buffet represented all ethnic cuisines. I know the stations took up a 1/2 mile. Not making this up. Full Salad Bar, Asian, Hawaiian, Italian, Mexican, American, Japanese and so forth. All had a menu option. The dessert bar was topped with fresh baked cookies, pies, cake slices and ice cream. I can see why they charge so much. The servers were attentive and helpful. They asked us about our stay and genuinely wanted to wait on us.  We will visit again soon.

bKNXlHNlScJlJklGWCSh7w.text: 4 stars for great value in terms of price vs quality and selection among near-strip buffets. Removing one star for making me poop longer than usual. But adding a star for nice decor. Removing another star for making me look fat. I'd also subtract couple stars for putting me into food comma for 2 hours, which makes this place a little more expensive as time is money. But the overall experience was very good and I'm giving it 5 stars to negate older reviews posted before remodeling, as this place now deserves much better rating. Anyway, I wasn't aware of the recent remodeling and was nicely surprised when visiting for Christmas Day dinner.  I usually don't care for expensive remodels that are often used to increase the price, but in this case it worked somewhat well and the Orleans buffet now deserves the place among the top buffets in Vegas, even though still far from perfect. There are no crab legs (except Friday nights) and therefore this buffet cannot be compared to the best ones that do serve them. Yet, the price reflects the lack of crab legs and justifies rating this location among the top of those that do not have them. The food quality and selection makes this place among the top 5 in Vegas on my list, little behind Bacchanal, M, and Wicked Spoon, while beating all of them on price. I was especially surprised with ribs, which were better than those served in many restaurants. They had good selection of other meats, although some could've been added only for Christmas. Green beans, sweet potatoes, and other vegetables were fresh and cooked well. Lots of other selections from various cuisines, at least during Christmas Day. Some things that I would like to see added would be mushrooms and au gratin potatoes. Desert selection not as amazing as top buffets but still along better ones in Vegas. The holiday price was the same as the regular price during nights and weekends ($19 with rewards card), therefore I'm assuming that the selection and quality may be similar every day. Nice decor and friendly waiter further helped providing great experience.

obk9Oh-BnQ9YCUT_bA0xeA.text: Took a December trip to Las Vegas for some family and friends fun time ! We visited the buffet at the Orleans hotel for dinner for the first time since it was remodeled. Standing outside the entrance - the remodeled buffet looks very nice and classy - quite a change from the old French Market Buffet. The name has also changed to the Medley Buffet. The buffet now has several cooking stations with much improved food ! The buffet was just OK before - now it's definitely gone up a notch ! Everything we had was very tasty and their selection was significantly improved ! I would now recommend the newly remodeled Medley Buffet at the Orleans !

Rx833NmfRDLdmnaqG1Xeog.text: They have gotba New York steak, short beef ribs, Chinese duck, little red lobsters, French crepes (on cooking station), roast beef on the regular dinner night which is really worth the price

7_Hi7ez-QPu9C_4C5nBlqA.text: First let me qualify this it $14.99 lunch.  Luke warm, Bland food.  Selection was meh, desert table a waste of time -70% empty. Service was sssllloooowww. Maybe it was to limit the amount of drink? Maybe they were understaffed due to all the cheerleaders? Regardless - not an enjoyable or tasty experience I would repeat.

3_NuuQ3GDddbeiR39xdVYg.text: The breakfast food is pathetic, its cold, Over cooked or not cooked at all, cooks are ride and wanna give you what they want not what u ask for, overall service is somewhat ok, but food wise it needs a lot of attention and changes to provide quality not quantity

R1KlkuX8ro057JgzMm3pew.text: Never been here since before the renovation.  But I am hearing and reading that they don't have any crab legs no more.  That's sad because that's the only way I will be back.    Please bring back the crab legs!  Then I would give 5 stars!!

Vv1EU-BcuZumGVOLzDZkjQ.text: I dined in on friday night when they were serving seafood night. The selection was great as it had snow crab, dung. crab, crayfishes (huge!), shrimp, & raw oysters. The feasting night gave me food coma but that's when you know they did a good job!. Services was good as our server kept checking in on us and clearing out our plates ASAP. This wouldn't replace my favorite buffet spot at the Bellagio but it's up to par! Will return when in vegas.

OJ9hxPnPLv7R9GZpFYRkbg.text: It's was a great buffet .. especially when they got remodeled now it sucks they quit serving crab legs I'll take my business elsewhere

XM0QmYWTzOEqBc0Pg-ZZEg.text: The new buffet name is Medley. For me to consider going back, they need to change their tune.  It seems like everything that was fine with the old buffet, they decided to go with the opposite on the new one.  From the way they get you in there to the fact there's no signs for at least half the items to the bland food, this is an utter disaster.  I hope they can get their act together soon because there'll be no one coming back if they keep this up.

cCLYlZ2YQRAo9qDJACe6sg.text: Major disappointment.  Lunch in December 2017 was $12.95 without a players club card and the food was completely forgettable - I can't recall a single item, and they only utilized half of the serving stations (not a lot of choice).  I did not get my money's worth.  Now, back in the early 2000's this was a very good "value buffet" which feaured decent food at modest prices. No more.  I still like the Orleans, and their rooms are clean, spacious, and well appointed.  But this newly renovated buffet was a huge disappointment and an insult to what once was the French Market Buffet,

1RVdwBuJOIpIpu_8KYXanA.text: Newly remodeled looks much bigger than before new lights and wide open even the food tasted better and the table server's were on the ball.The buffet is longer and real clean but the food looked good and was tasty.

cHQ9jSwsyT6HGXeW01AS0Q.text: This buffet is only open between 8-10am for breakfast. In Las Vegas. We were walking into the line, at 9:40, and they closed the line and wouldn't let us in.

llN8WGWp-VboEqiC9Dlb3Q.text: This has to be the worst buffet I have ever been to.  Price is commensurate with quality!  Save your money go somewhere else.  Everything here comes from the 4 food groups - Boxed, bagged, frozen or canned!  Not a single thing here is made from scratch!  Atrocious food if you can call it tyT!!

P0gOCJtvtbGccVYq5yk1cg.text: I have been to this buffet a lot. Workers are always friendly , and the food is  fresh and tasty.  Today there was an exceptionally nice prime rib carver who gave me way too much , but I did ask for it .It  tasted amazing . This is not your super expensive Vegas strip buffet, but for the price it is totally worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Medley Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

V93wKjtriWlZsQHj_rlbug.text: Good food great selection. The crapes are too die for very good. Service was also good. Short wait to enter but not bad.

T_8E1POx9_Su05sKzWanhQ.text: First off you really have to take a lot of caution in entering ANY buffet of some sort. If it's seafood or whatever. Do not eat anything raw at this place. Make sure it is cooked. I got food poisoning from either the sushi or "baked" mussels. I knew the minute I bit into the mussels I should've spit it out. Again please be aware of what you are eating. It is 1 week later and I still feel a little queezy.

poH55ELe7drrTZvGp4sh_A.text: Came here cuz my roommate and I had comps and wanted to try some place we hadn't been before. We heard some good things about this buffet and as a Boyd loyal player we decided to try this buffet , all I have to say was WOW! This place has totally stepped up their game !!! There was a huge variety of food from many different cultures , I was impressed by the many many carving stations and live action cooking stations , such as create your own pho, the made to order crepes and tacos !! The Chile verde is the bomb and if I get comps again heading here for that alone , it was that good !! Actually many of their pork dishes were great !! Also for the gluten free crowd the table menus give you a play by play of your gluten free options , I did post a pic !! All in all we left with a full belly and a happy disposition !! Only reason for 4 stars is that service was a little spotty starting out but our server did eventually come around and was there when we needed refills or a clean table !!

photos.caption: Photo of Medley Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gluten free buffet guide!

hsTrTw9BaIutkQkOtX_pcg.text: Staff was very pleasant and friendly. Had a group of 6. Good food for the price. Had your basic stations, salad bar and desert section. They kept up with the food as it was running low. Stations were clean. They had a bbq, asian, seafood, mexican and italian station from what I recall. They have bite sized desserts with a variety of options. Not a 5 star restaurant quality food but not terrible either. Price is average/typical for a local casino buffet. Good experience. Thank you

dNBu7Lx7sOnpAPkQNHUXfw.text: Great Atmosphere, Delicious food, price is comparable to the quality of food. Some dishes had excessive salt but when I mentioned it, immediately the floor manager took care of the issue. We were able to enjoy the dish to our taste. Service was amazing. Extremely clean Buffet. Enough staff to help the customers. Will definitely be a repeat customer.

KgUb7xFw88WDYaTTOnCfdQ.text: My friend and I got to the buffet about 1/2 hour before lunch service was closing. We were warned that we only had 1/2 hour to get our food and another twenty minutes to eat and get out. We figured it would be enough time, so we went ahead and stayed, even though we did feel rushed. Really, there's no reason for a buffet of this caliber to be closing from 3:00-4:00 to get ready for dinner. I've been there at dinnertime, and the food is not that different. But my problem was this: we didn't realize that we would be getting a sparse choice of food: dried out meat, overcooked vegetables, etc. It was super disappointing. I finally got to the dessert station before it closed (I was on a timeline and thought it would be closed by the time I ate my entree-- felt so rushed). There was exactly one piece of pie on a plate: ridiculous! The dessert case was not at all full-- it seemed like I would have to ask for anything, versus just taking a plate. I felt really cheated by this buffet overall. If they were giving some sort of discount for going the last hour, I would understand it.........but we were paying full price and getting very little for the money ($16 each basically, which is rather high for the quality of the buffet). We live in Las Vegas and go to lots of buffets, so I have much to compare with. This buffet, though beautiful since its remodel, is not a great buffet. I didn't care for much of anything that I took, food-wise. The beef brisket was super dried out and tough, I didn't find any meat in my pork tamale, etc.-- just very ordinary food. The fruit was good, but a plate of fruit does not translate to $16 for me. I seriously doubt I'll be going back. This is the third chance I've given them since the remodel, and it's been sub-par every time. Any Station casino's buffet is better than this one, and so much cheaper.

0yn5NWD6qRQtipbVwTxcIw.text: Beautiful renovation BUT food still the same ..  I love how trendy this buffet looks and the presentation of the foods but it's still NOT good.    They did change some of the food items like the omelette station and the meat craving station and the desserts(only thing that was good).    Chinese was probably the worst, than Italian and the soup station.  I was hoping it would be better than before but not.

photos.caption: Photo of Medley Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Medley Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Medley Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

i2kT4CiZYki9JeyBdbwyNA.text: Considerably better at breakfast, than the old French Market buffet. The best things I tried were the Italian sausage, beef chow mein, and chilaquiles.  The fails were the corned beef hash, which was not at all fried, and the tater tots, which were over fried to where they could break a tooth. The potato pancakes looked good, but were totally bland. Everything else I tried, was ok. It was definitely worth the price.

rIC69mMx4rcp2akO6T_VUQ.text: Sunday brunch was really good! Save money for a brunch buffet by just driving a couple miles away from the strip. For $21 that isn't bad at all. I enjoyed the coffee options at the dessert area as well as the corn beef hash! Staff is really friendly.

XC04weVYiXzvOxmplYl6-A.text: I was really looking forward to eat here because they have BBQ beef ribs but it was quiet a disappointment.  The beef ribs is not tender at all, the meat was hard which means they need to cook it longer so the meat is much tender.  I gave 3 star because they have many other choices of foods and service from Victoria was great.

WBHcdHv1q5kFiQJg_v8tyQ.text: This is a well worth money you pay buffet. Quality and variety is amazing. Line might be long but it's movin fast. Even I didn't tried all the food they have but so far all the stuff I tried is so yummy. Huge crawfish, fresh papaya salad, bbq ribs, they even have pho noodle soup! Etc....definitely recommended! Oh get a players card so u get $1 off too.

ajH5D2FYlenBRPRfV4Aklw.text: Came to Vegas for a few days and we always try to have an early breakfast buffet. We've been here before so we gave it another try. As always for breakfast it was bomb!!!! We had menudo, eggs,sausage, bacon, potatoes,pancakes, waffles and bottomless mimosas! Awesome!! But unfortunately dinner was not as good. So to be fair I'd have to say four stars is good. We bought the all day pass and got our moneys worth but will probably not do that again. Breakfast bomb! Dinner jus ok.

_bdRS5H61uAolGH7e4bV1A.text: Good buffet, some cool Louisiana-inspired options, along with the usual salad bar, meat options and dessert bar. I like the custom crepes, which I had loaded with Nutella and chocolate chips.   Options a bit on the thin side compared to other buffets (the one at Cosmopolitan being my favorite), but really a first-world problems sort of complaint, as there were plenty of choices I enjoyed.

YvdSyTv5zO_ykWpimY50Qg.text: This is one of my favorite buffet restaurant so far. Some of people in front is friendly , other is not. Most waitress is good and friendly. We have to wait less than 10 minutes for the seat. It's not too bad. The food is okay. I like the crawfish here. Others are normal, nothing is special. $26 for special on Friday. For me, dinner is better than breakfast.

CGLph2vQLv5bR4gmSQiNqg.text: Dear God. I come to casino buffets quite often (3-6 times a month) I decided to go to the medley buffet because I received a coupon for buy one dinner get one free buffet in the mail and the food was subpar and service was trash. Most definitely not like any other buffet ive had, after getting full I decided to have desert but when looking at the spoons there were literally food on every single one. Multiple people were scavenging through the spoon container to find one clean utensil. I thought I found one in a new set of utensils they brought out but when putting the spoon in my mouth I felt DRIED UP FOOD in my mouth. I asked for a manager and she handled it by removing the utensils and placing plastic utensils. They need to have a person Inspecting all dinnerware.

NPYQ_Zd6Wk7KbxCK-d-CSg.text: We received 4 free buffet vouchers in the mail from Boyd Gaming so we decided to try this place out on their seafood buffet night. I believe it costs $27.99 for dinner on Fridays. The line was super long and the wait was about 30 minutes. Not too bad considering this is their most popular night.   The crab and oysters were fresh and plentiful. The food in general is decent. We like to make our own dipping sauce for the crab and bring it since we don't care much for the butter they provide. We basically stack a mountain of crab on a plate and start cracking away. We tried a few other like the spare ribs, smoked sausage, mashed potatoes, corn on the cob, and clam chowder as side helpings to the crab. Nothing stands except for the service which is always attentive and professional.

photos.caption: Photo of Medley Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab line up

oIzJant75H4KdgQFzBZ46Q.text: Sometimes you just need to get out of the office with the gang and have some fun! This is a fine...and close....place for it! This is our "Field Trip Friday" lunch spot. We load ourselves into a couple cars, drive over and for $8.99 we bond over a mediocre A-Y-C-E Buffet. No harm in that!  OK, the food kinda mediocre, but there is a LOT of it! And the deserts are my favorite! Next time maybe I will just eat sugary treats?

OB5lHf301MDqsFr1wXgwYA.text: By far my favorite buffet in Las Vegas.  The food is outstanding, the selection is great, and the service is also great.  You also cannot beat the prices.  $7 for breakfast if you're a B Connected Players Club member or a guest at the hotel.  Even if I'm not staying at the Orleans during my visit, I will make it a point to get to this off-strip hotel for breakfast, lunch, or dinner at the buffet.  I highly recommend doing the same for others as well.  You will not be disappointed.

F_oz0iSPb-hUoslcoEAOXg.text: Looking through yelp someone posted a picture of the prices which is not current. Today we went for brunch and with the B connected card it's actually $16.99 instead of $13.99. Regular price is 21.99. The b connected card applies for 2 guests so since there were 3 of us 2 of us ate for $16.99 and the third person was $21.99. Asked for a high chair for my toddler (didn't have to pay for) they brought a highchair that was filthy with old food glued to it. So disgusting. Requested another highchair which was clean. Food: was OK I was disappointed but my husband enjoyed it.  A lot of variety especially in the desserts section it was overwhelming but out of the 4 desserts that we sampled the pecan bar was the best. Overall food lacked flavor not worth the $ go elsewhere.

1WvnLZmLuVyiKFxClSXw1Q.text: I don't think I have ever been happier in my entire life. The only reason I gave it 4 stars is because it's not as convenient to get to.  $17.99 for champagne Sunday Brunch (without player's card) and they did not mess around with the champagne. They basically just poured the entire contents of the bottle into our drink glasses (and it was just two of us). The servers were very attentive and fun.   The buffet itself: heaven  Made to order omelet station-delicious with plenty of options.  Seafood! Delicious baked clams, sushi, lox for bagels, calamari, and plenty if other options I did not even try (including crawfish which I thought I would try but instead became our table mascot).  Plenty of fresh fruit and cereals including oatmeal and grits.   The rotisserie chicken melted in my mouth and had I not filled up on everything, else the honey glazed ham looked amazing.   Dessert selection: wow. So many cookies, pastries, pies, and cakes to choose from, but I had to have the chocolate fountain.   If I could have stayed for more time (and had a bigger stomach), I think I would have tried everything in the Mexican and Italian sections because everything looked delicious.   Keep in mind that I have never been to another Buffet in Vegas, so perhaps there are better ones out there, however I know where I am going the next time I am in Vegas.

1CEFNpGYM70D4arHrVm5IA.text: I liked the price and the food wasn't bad either. The salad bar is small in comparison to many other buffets but who goes to a buffet and eats a salad?  Right?   They have a BBQ area, stir fry and make your own pasta stations, a Mexican food area and pizza and pastas. Oh and then there's dessert. I think they may actually have more dessert than food options. Soft serve, cakes and pies, gelato and sorbets and my dad's favorite: the bread pudding.   I enjoyed the breakfast buffet with the omelet station and crisp bacon!    The waitstaff that brought your beverages and took away your dirty plates were really nice and prompt with our drinks.   I had to minus a star because of the cashiers. On one occasion the cashier was rude and charged us incorrectly even after we told her numerous times how many people were in our party. She was downright sassy commenting on other people being served near us "oh there's another one, must a full mood out tonight".

Z9e1GkZmoDMnR581HI3Avg.text: The Orleans buffet might not be the most popular in Las Vegas, but in my humble opinion, it's one of the best! It consists a plethora of diverse dining stations. Each station has a wide variety of its particular cuisine. The food is great, the price is right and the staff is very personable. Your meal is discounted, when you use the hotel's B-connected card. They also offer a three meal (breakfast, lunch and dinner) pass at a discounted price. I highly recommend The Orleans Hotel buffet!

MjqUzK-XsNIXbkMRhRWJuw.text: Horrible.  Food was terrible, service was terrible.  If you want a refill on your coffee, better order two.  Upside - it was cheap.

XZ5mgKUk1KTS_EIXfBfP8A.text: Great Value Buffet at a low price, Lunch time Buffet is just $12 per person although I recommend getting a players card and then swipe in the Machine as you can get a buy 1 get 1 free, but even so at just $12 for lunch the choice is amazing, there is American, BBQ, Pasta, Mongolian, Fish, Gluten Free choice, vegan and Vegetarian  Huge Salad and Desert section,Which includes Sugar Free and Diabetic choice as well! something for every taste!  there is also soup available, the restaurant is clean, the service with a smile, even though the Que to get in was long we was in and sat down within 5 minutes and it was worth it, the food choice is great, its hot and fresh! I we got served By Antonio and kept our pepsi glasses filled, for Brits like me remember they work for tips so a tip of $1-$2 per person is a great way of saying thank you.

noFzEiyok7melelcyVbu0A.text: The brother casino has a better buffet for a cheaper price. Lines here are longer and food is okay. Not coming back as there is better for cheaper with a free shuttle!!!

OgZr4xXoW967cu99cUtYbg.text: ORLEANS:  The French Market Buffet is located in the Orleans and I love it.  It has a ton of options for a very affordable price. Not to mention, it's all-you-can-eat!    VARIETY:  The variety of food available is very diverse. Great for picky eaters, I guess, because of range of food is almost ridiculous! Dinner buffet was my fave; breakfast was a close second.   Here's a general idea of the dinner spread: -Fresh and cooked seafood: crab, shrimp, clams, crawfish, sushi, you name it. -Chinese: stir fry station, noodles, spring rolls, etc. -American: ribs, steak, etc. -Mexican: burritos and such -Several different pastas -Soup -Salad bar  -Dessert bar with a gelato case!  SWEETS:  The desert bar/station will satisfy any sweeth tooth!  Diabetic and all!  I'm so happy to say that they have a whole sugar-free dessert section for all you health nuts and diabetics.  I like to eat and sample sugar-free desserts every now and then, and these desserts are scrumptious.  This buffet dessert station may quite possibly have the best tasting sugar-free banana cream pie I have ever tasted! It tasted better than many regular banana cream pies I've tried!   VERDICT:  This buffet is definitely a go!  (Who could turn down such a tasty and affordable buffet??!)  No doubt I will be back for more of that delish sugar-free banana cream pie and that amazing spread.  :)

iwRr7ajIUyf1aFXYfmmdag.text: My father just stayed at the Orleans for the past week and we had breakfast here most mornings and dinner one evening. I would say the breakfast is the best value (8.99 with players card) but dinner was still pretty good. If it's a busy weekend prepare to wait in line especially in the morning but they do keep things moving along fairly quick. Drink service can be a bit slow to get to you but it was very busy the times I was there over the week and the servers had many tables.

O3AfIh_9K_saze_lDZNyEQ.text: I don't typically do buffets...but this one did it right!!! Everything was prepared well with quality ingredients. The service was fast and friendly.  The price was nominal for what you got..I think it it was like $13 for dinner...I would DEFINITELY go back if I wasn't sure what I was craving and needed a quick bite to eat!

pS3AQRB60DXK0Bk4ubIuEg.text: Hometown Buffet a la Vegas. Pretty standard ordinary sub par food. It is $15 for Sunday which is pricey so definitely I wouldn't go back. I had ham, blintzes and cold shrimp with sauce.

1zqHbw6wVo0ZkLcHxSUn0Q.text: Ate breakfast buffet because of being hungry cereal was my choice, not worth the breakfast buffet don't waste you money beside the dessert don't waste your time and money ..!

az7J2SFVaQERnlgDD3hf0g.text: Buffett was pretty good. They have seafood. . Mexican. .usa...bbq.. Italian... salads .desserts of many kind like cakes. . Pies. Gelato.. pRices listed online are only if u have a player's card which is free if u don't have one the it's about $6 more

photos.caption: Photo of Medley Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Being silly in the buffet
Photo of Medley Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The front

mQrwWhd7_c4pr2NQ2HddAQ.text: I will make sure to never return to this buffet again. After the way our group was treated by Nickey I was disgusted. She was very rude and came off argumentative from the beginning. Hopefully someone from management will see this and help her to change her attitude.

gzQ7GuRPodA3ZhSeKnak0g.text: Don't be scared away by the huge line of large people: it moves fast.   Strange concept where you pay at the register and then get in line to be seated for your buffet.  Drinks are free and fast (soda and water that is).  Several buffet stations: the variety is key since each section does not have a huge range of appetizing items, maybe 1-2 things in each section looked reasonably attractive.  No particular dish was special or amazing, just basic level ingredients and expected tastes.  More comfort food/americanized versions of foreign cuisine (this is Vegas after all).  Good way to fill up before a long night or afternoon out wandering the sad streets.

wM-u642tQLT_phYBKS0waA.text: The $11 weekday lunch buffet at Orleans Casino is an excellent value. Delicious prime rib and ham. Great deserts selections as well with 12 flavors of premium ice cream.

Ve9FlygUHFlrs2mVmJ0URw.text: What a disappointment! What was once one of the best values in LV considering the price and fairly unique southern food has changed to an ordinary buffet you can find in other casinos. The remodel was nice but the food got much worse although the price went up by $3+. I visited the buffet for breakfast and lunch (decided not to bother for dinner). The southern food has virtually disappeared and only a few of the dishes previously served from the French Market buffet are there. It also seems the executive chef has changed because the food tastes worse for a lot of the dishes. And the shrimp...my gosh, I told management 3x that the shrimp was old/bad/spoiled and 3x they kept changing the shrimp and it was still bad. I'm sure many people got sick that day. Also, they serve menudo for breakfast but not for lunch? If you're looking for a vestige from the French Market go elsewhere, you won't find it at Medley anymore. Sadly, I will pass on this buffet which is one of the reasons why I go to the Orleans in the first place as it was once one of my favorite buffets to go to.

Flvk_H2bzaIkY15pKY7AOQ.text: The only great thing about the place is the price; it simply can't be beat. But what you pay is what you get. It was our first meal after arriving to LV so we were pretty starved. Seated right away. Food was good but not great. Like it lacked zazz. The hot and sour soup sucked (way to sour). I did enjoy the potato salad, of all things. And I think the mongolian station was the best station because the food was actually flavorful.   Dessert was the best part! (though i wish they had more fruit options). I got some peach cobbler (my fave dessert) and some honeydew on the side. soooo good. And some hot tea with honey and lemon [on a 103F day haha] to finish my meal.  Not bad, not fabulous. Great price.

N93Wd4Wan98k56_4bTQUsw.text: Definitely not worth 22 bucks only reason im eating here is that it was comped my wife almost broke a tooth on some chicken no seafood salad which is cheap to make

JdVX_H0LKWOhpaWf3kg8Jg.text: Finally tried their Sunday champagne brunch.  Only complaint was that we overate.  Line was about 15 minutes long, service was good, food was fresh and had great selections.  Getting refills on drinks was no issue and the champagne tasted great.

rHcVw_9XEG7nD6Ny2g7LwQ.text: This is, by far, my favorite buffet in all of Vegas Valley. There are a lot of things I really enjoy and the taste and temperature is very consistent. The shrimp scampi is a must if you aren't allergic to shrimp. The prime rib isn't the best, but it is still pretty yummy. Also, there is SUSHI. Which is actually fresh tasting and delicious. They only offer a few different rolls, but it is better quality sushi than you would expect.  The vegetable sides are really where this buffet stands out, in my opinion. Especially the roasted potatoes by the BBQ section, the Lyonnais potatoes in the Frenchy section, and the greens beans all the way down at the end in Italian/Asian.  It reminds me of back home in Texas. And I don't say that about much. The only thing lacking, which I would have expected to see in a New Orleans-themed place, was rolls of some kind. They had fantastic corn bread, but no good yeast rolls like you get down South.

zJUCGOx2BjrFTT6zlsUurA.text: Disappointed - not my idea of a Vegas buffet. Poor service and microwave quality food - I guess as the saying goes - you get what you pay for

MRoPr3Oxna9XfiaH1Z-zQQ.text: Worst customer service ever. The cashier was great but the server and supervisor was clueless. We received a comp and with that we were supposed to get (4) souvenir glasses. We told the waiter and he was so stupid that he gave it to another table. We heard the other table say "oh why do we get this?" So, at the end of our dinner we asked for our souvenir glasses and he said, oh no you don't get it. He was asking for the receipt that he took. He tried to argue and got his supervisor who was also clueless, so we had to go to cashier. Needless to say, we got our souvenir glasses. They just didn't seem to care. Also, we left our sun glasses by accident on the table and guess what....when we returned they said they couldn't find them. Hmmmm I wonder why? I know they stole them!!! I guess they needed it more

0dY97Jf4_whVWAjuyfuh5g.text: Been to eat at better buffets in Vegas. Steaks were tough, pecan pie looked green (see photo). I did like the Mexican section. Food seemed to sit out all day. Will not be back, sorry

Kwo_-CsEDyCDW3ONIXazmA.text: Let me start by saying I was rather impressed with the quality of the cuisine at the buffet. I'll begin on a positive note before delving into the depths of my irritation with this place. I went twice during my stay. Once for breakfast and once for dinner. The breakfast was one of the best breakfast buffets I have visited in a while and the dinner was pretty top notch as well. There was a good variety of steaks during the Saturday night dinner buffet with a good supporting cast of potatoes, veggies and other buffet staples. The grilled onions and sauteed mushrooms were a nice touch. The problem I have is with the mandatory 18 percent gratuity for a large party. We stayed at the Orleans over a weekend for a family reunion and gathering of friends who had not seen each other in some time. Our party for dinner was approaching 50 bodies and we got there prior to their opeing for dinner and gave plenty of notice ahead of time. We did not just show up and ask for a table for 50. We paid in small groups (immediate families, etc) and were all charged the 18 percent. I can see an 18 percent tip at a restaurant where the waiter or waitress takes your order, fills your drinks, deals with special requests and is attentive to your table. An 18 percent tip at a buffet is over the top to begin with, but outrageous when you consider the drinks were running empty and the waiter was rude and acted as though we were putting him out. The tip was in the $150 range for a lack luster, one-star performance from the waiter. If you have a casino "Club Card", you'll need one card for every two people to get the discount and there was no price break for children. The quality of the food was the saving grace, making this an overall three star rating for me.

KAnpraeLV9I_tJcLryMwRg.text: ***Friday lunch review*** CHEAP!!!!...but expect what you paid for...  We've always wondered and were curious about the casino buffets away from the strip.  On Friday around noon, we had to go to AutoZone and Orleans Casino just happened to be around the corner...we said...why not?  The buffet has no lines which was nice...Yes it is nothing like the buffet you experience on the strip but for the price, it is ok...not bad.  * Price:  $8.99/person...CHEAP  * Food: NO CRABS but small cocktail shrimps with shells still on them.  My most memorable was Mongolian BBQ...it's descent (oh don't ask for beef...it's tough and tasteless) Crawfish available...but dry.  Oh I would stay away from the desserts...  * Service = pretty attentive.  * Ambiance = honestly, it has a feel of run-down old casino buffet but it's ok.  It has it's charm...very relaxed and casual.    Ok, no sophisticated gourmet here...basically, if you dream of being able to go to a mall food court and eat whatever you want, all you want....this place is it.

mBzsnaAr7FC9O9pKd-QrsA.text: This place is awesome if you are able to take down a lot of food. If I were able to post pictures, I would post one of the many pictures we took of 21 plates of empty crawfish shells on our table :D It was not a one man job, it took 3 guys and 1 girl.   I didn't just eat the crawfish. Their many stations offer you a variety of ethnic foods ranging from Italian to Asian and Mexican. Their meat items would be among the best. I favored their grilled sausages (wow, I thought about that sentence to try avoiding any 2nd meanings...). The majority of their food was mediocre at best, but they have some jewels.  The service is pretty efficient here. They come by every so often to check on your status and to refill your drinks. For the most part, they are very nice except for one or two of them. Many of them do have a good sense of humor and had a laugh with us when they came to look at all the plates. A lot of the other patrons came by to take pictures of us and give us some encouragement.  The environment was pretty spacious. It gives you a lot of room to move around without having to run into people on accident like some other buffets. It was a comfortable setting, just don't look around too much to see what other people do with their food. It can become pretty bizarre.  Overall, this is a good place to go to with family and friends. There is plenty of food selections, so you'll be able to find something you enjoy with very little ease. People are overall pretty friendly here, so you won't feel uncomfortable much. If you love crawfish, just come here for that because that alone made it worth the money for us, as you can probably tell from my introduction. I believe lunch was around $8 and dinner around $16. It is definitely worth a visit.   I gave this restaurant 3 stars because I judge establishments on overall quality, not just on the amount of food that I can eat. If I did that, almost any restaurant would get 5 stars. They do have some excellent food, but overall, there are some bumps. This is a very good 3-star establishment though that will most likely not let you down.

photos.caption: Photo of Medley Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I think we can say that we were victorious...

OOoKS_ZP6cGFtdNhkIf8Kg.text: Just made it before the end of breakfast at 10am. $7.99pp with the players card was a great, especially when paying for 8. Great selection and everything was well prepared. Good selection of American and Mexican. Even had good menudo.  They started bringing lunch out at 1030, so the big eaters in our group ate two meals in one sitting. Great value.

-GceVJ-H19pdFF96T3DjQA.text: The buffet is arranged into nine serving stations. They include the soup & salad bar and the Italian, Mexican, Chinese, Mongolian Barbecue, American, Seafood, BBQ and the dessert bar.  I have eaten here many times. The food is not outstanding but there is plenty of variety and I can always find things here that I like. The salad bar recently had marinated artichoke hearts which is a big plus for me. The beef ribs are meaty, tender and flavorful. And you can gorge yourself on the shrimp and crayfish. And numerous other offerings keep me returning. I found the dessert bar to be just so-so but overall it's a good buffet. And I'd have to say that the prices make it one of the best buffet values in town. If you present a B-Connected card which is free from the Orleans casino, you'll save an extra dollar on the buffet. The same card is valid at all Boyd Gaming properties.

i4ipOr3AjjScw1Fr3osb9A.text: Cheap ($14.95 dinner) and good enough!  Everyone lived and had no emergencies eating here! :)  Didn't have to wait very long, once we paid we were seated right away and SUPER close to the food.  It was great!  Service was excellent!  Food was hot and from the amount of people there was a good turn of fresh food.  Nice layout too - spacious and  no rude people.  Keep Calm Get Buffet On! :)    My favorite was the crab legs, crawdads, peel-n-eat shrimp, when given the right cut the baby back ribs were excellent and beef ribs were pretty cool too.  I had tiny bits of everything and didn't feel like those Wall-E floaty people!  Dessert was alright.  I did like the coffee ice cream.  Pumpkin - not so much.   I'd go back.

UQ1wiXMz5FSQlCXo8wIsWQ.text: If I had a choice, I'd still eat at the Courtyard Cafe with the lower rating I gave that because I don't like waiting in line, and it was a long wait - but mostly because it was senior day, and all the seniors who were members of B-Connected had their buy one get one free coupons.  I also don't like competing for food at the buffet line.  So, that said, what I'm saying is that the cons are that i don't like that the place was too popular.  And I can understand why it was popular on the day we went.  Of course, the senior couples are eating at half price, which is a great deal because the regular price for lunch is $8.99.  $8.99 itself is a very good price for this buffet.  The variety is good: you have American, Italian, Asian, Mexican, etc. stations, and the quality is good for a buffet (I tend to rate buffet food with a lower expectation that sit-down food).  I enjoyed the shredded pork carnitas, the chile verde pork was okay, and the bbq ribs, I enjoyed also - I can't remember everything I had, now, but I do remember sampling a variety, and I normally don't do that at a buffet.  I normally have two servings and stop.  Here, I think I went back three times, then went for soup (I had a cup/bowl of the hot and sour, and that was a bit disappointing - the broth was too thin).    The popular item seemed to be the craw-fish. I passed by tables where people had stacks of craw-fish on their plates.  I myself, took a nice quantity of shrimp, and except for peeling the shell, basically had a nice shrimp cocktail (on a plate).   If the line is super long, like out the door (as it was this day), I'll probably end up at the Courtyard cafe, but if the line is not too bad, and I'm hungry, you'll be finding me in this line.

FSW9xbOJc8RJ0dRfQKZnxQ.text: So far I have been here in Vegas for 3 days. I've had several buffets. Including one of the supposed 10 ten buffets in Vegas (Cravings) which totally sucked. The French Market Buffet was awesome. Very flavorful food with the perfect amount of seasoning... Thank u... After 3 days finally good food

Tc3lWXjJOJuSUIF9rscZCw.text: Went here for my wife's Christmas party on the weekend.  Although they had a large selection of food, nothing here looked particularly appealing;  though, it probably didn't help that I wasn't feeling very well before I came here.  The food overall probably rated a two, but the service by the staff very attentive to everyone so the service was great, bumping the rating up a star.

Oc-ojCFawlnQ-TDUvIqCwg.text: I used to like this buffet for value.  However, after my recent stay at the Orleans and 2 visits to the buffet, I need to update my review.   I thought the first time was a fluke. In the past, I never noticed them  putting out food that is way past it's prime.  However, there were several items I used to enjoy that should have gone into a compost bin rather than being served as food.  Watermelon and some items at the salad bar were especially disappointing since I had enjoyed them in the past. My boyfriend is the meat eater, and he said the quality of the meat had gone down too.  The pricer Sunday brunch was the most pleasant of the meals we had.   The free champagne, which wasn't bad, helped make the experience more enjoyable.  They had better fruit on Sunday, and had a  chocolate fountain to dip fruit, rice krispy treats, macaroons and marshmallows in.     I never cared for the cakes and pies at the French Market Buffet.  They are pretty, but like most Vegas buffet desserts, they taste like they use a cheap oil instead of butter.  The cobbler is usually good, and so is their ice cream and gelato.  We always like the servers and tip them even if the quality of the food is bad.  It is not their fault.

yGqRA1diHLeTu_5Xnl-Mww.text: Mold on the pie, told the chef he told me it was just burn marks. Never seen burn marks that are green. As we where leaving he was yelling at the dessert lady , and pulling all the pie I was eating. Only thing good about this place was the drinks. Even the prime rib was over cooked and dry . Gross, the shrimp scampi people on here rave about is slimy.

xVCyhiaYSLVUuxf-Qi4eYA.text: Came here yesterday for my first time as I haven't been here before I seen a couple of the reviews of this buffet and they were okay at best so I was skeptical came here at around almost 630 place was packed as there were people from a wrestling tournament from around the world staying here it was so packed that the lines were going almost out side. Anyhow me and my friend got in because me and him use the coupon we had where you get a free meal at the buffet so was lucky to not spend much of anything here. Now onto the food although it was good they didn't have many options to choose from with the foods at each station it was limited at best but the food was good just wish they kept up with the freshness of the food I went to get my plate the first time got some chicken bit into it as I sat down and it was dry and not that fresh but the second time I got some it was fresh and chewable just wish they were consisted with stuff like that also got the pizza it was good and hush puppies they were delicious and I got some mac and cheese out of the rest of the stuff I mentioned that was the worst no flavor bland and even if you added salt or pepper to it it still tasted awful. Besides that are server who got us our drinks worked her was very friendly and always at are table to make sure we were okay and got our refills we also gave him a tip as he worked hard and went that extra mile for us. Overall this buffet is okay would I say this buffet is one of the best out here no not a chance but you do get your money's worth besides the limited options of food and dessert and you'll leave here full I probably might come back one day as it's not really that bad and the customer service is good I give this place 3 stars.

yGBzLPOXndXs1L0w-CEuwg.text: The food and prices makes up for the long wait time getting in. I definitely recommend this place to everyone. I have been to many buffets in Vegas and this is by far the cheapest. So if you want a Cheap quality Buffet, and don't want to pay the high price of one, this is the spot you're looking for.

KylPTqN51l_x8ve_Aprzjg.text: Love the food selections and quality available. Seating arrangement however is very uncomfortable as tables are pretty close to each other. Customer service with waiters are usually a drag and they hardly care for you. Overall, I would come back but hesitant to recommend to others.
